job summary:
Savannah River National Laboratory (SRNL) is hiring individuals for multiple engineering disciplines in support of research and development projects within National Security, Environmental Stewardship, Science and Technology, and Clean Energy directorates for Department of Energy, Environmental Management, National Nuclear Security Administration, and other government, industry, and international customers. SRNL is an applied science laboratory that uses nanometer to macroscopic scale fundamentals along with modeling, bench scale, and full scale test beds to provide solutions to client problems. Specific responsibilities for an Associate Engineer will vary depending on the project areas mentioned, although typical assignments can include:


Learning and application of SRNL Safety and Security policies and procedures
Applying technical knowledge through the use of state-of-the-art computing, models, facilities, laboratories, and equipment.
Applying first principles analysis to develop applied solutions
Independently performing and accepting responsibility for the accuracy of engineering and design calculations and the evaluation of results using state-of-the-art techniques.
Assisting senior technical staff in performing and completing more complex tasks and projects.
Assisting in study, development, testing and analyses of designs, processes, and/or procedures.
Assisting in the design, development, and testing of laboratory and test bed scale experiments.
Publishing analysis, results, conclusions, recommendations, and /or experimental setup in internal and external reports, as well as patent disclosures, journal articles, and conference proceedings.
Mentoring by experienced engineers and senior professionals

Develop conventional engineering and scientific solutions to technical task objectives. Learn SRNS and specific Division/Department systems and requirements for accomplishing tasks. Assist more senior technical personnel in performing related activities in more complex tasks.

Accept delegated technical responsibility for a limited phase of a scientific or an engineering program. Support engineers or scientists performing related phases of a program. Assist in study, development, testing and analyses of designs, processes or procedures relating to a limited phase of a group's function. Organize and accept responsibility for the accuracy of limited technical analyses, and evaluation of results using standard techniques and procedures. Make scientific, engineering and design calculations. May prepare project cost proposal in an assigned area. Assist in the preparation of technical manuals, reports and procedures. May advance technology within assigned area through the medium of patent disclosures, preparation and presentation of technical papers, articles and talks. Participate in a support capacity on Total Quality initiatives.

Major

Chemical Engineer

Mechanical Engineer

Electrical Engineer

Nuclear Engineer

Computer Science

Other

Other Major

Materials Engineer, System Engineer

Basic Qualifications

(Quantifiable; e.g. Three Years Experience, Bachelors Degree)

(Quantifiable; e.g. Three Years Experience, Bachelors Degree)" aria-labelledby="lblBasicQualifications
(Quantifiable;e.g.ThreeYearsExperience, BachelorsDegree)" >
BS degree in applicable science or engineering discipline from an accredited college or university. No work experience is required but may have up to 24 full time equivalent months related experience acquired while earning BS degree. Sound technical knowledge base of disciplines's standard concepts, principles and techniques. Ability to apply formal training.

Preferred Qualifications

(e.g. Masters Degree)

(e.g. Masters Degree)" aria-labelledby="lblPreferredQualifications
(e. g.MastersDegree)" >
Previous experience working at a DOE/NNSA/DOD nuclear or non-nuclear site.

Other Basic Requirements

(Subjective; e.g. Excellent Communication Skills)

(Subjective; e.g. Excellent Communication Skills)" aria-labelledby="lblOtherBasicRequirements
(Subjective;e. g.ExcellentCommunicationSkills)" >
Ability to obtain and maintain an L or Q Clearance based on Division/Department needs.

Minimum Degree Required

BS

Clearance Required to Perform Job?

L

Competency #1

Deliver Results

Competency Description #1

Understand job responsibilities and be accountable for results.

Meet goals and strive for customer satisfaction and corporate success.

Make sound workplace and business decisions.

Keep commitments and promises.

Plan work in a responsible manner, balancing company goals vs. schedule, budget, safety and resources.

Elevate issues early to avoid surprises.

Competency #2

Shape the Future

Competency Description #2

Adapt and perform consistently under changing requirements and dynamic work situations.

Take initiative to offer or try a new approach to make the team and the company more successful.

Foster business success by offering and supporting different perspectives.

Continuously improve in job performance.

Take on stretch or rotational assignments to support company initiatives and achieve self development.

Competency #3

Build Relationships

Competency Description #3

Build and maintain good working relationships with everyone.

Maintain a customer-focused attitude and strive to satisfy the customer.

Communicate in a clear, respectful manner with everyone. Publicly recognize others for a job well done.

Provide open and timely feedback regarding meeting and delivering commitments.

Competency #4

Energize & Recognize Team

Competency Description #4

Work with team members to ensure team, department, and divisional goals are met.

Communicate in a clear, respectful manner with team and management.

Collaborate and share with other team members to promote knowledge transfer.

Mentor, guide, and provide assistance to newer employees.

Promote teamwork and support other members of the organization.

Ask for help and support when needed.

Recognize colleagues for their achievements.

Competency #5

Model Excellence

Competency Description #5

Behave in a professional manner demonstrating integrity, ethics, and a high standard of values.

Deliver your work with pride and ownership.

Respect others’ knowledge, skills, and experiences.

Seek to appropriately identify and resolve challenges.

Work to make the organization, company, and mission more successful.

Apply Continuous Improvement processes to work scopes to improve efficiency and reduce unnecessary costs.

Strive to exceed expectations in task completion.

Embrace the company’s culture of service, excellence, and stewardship.

Take personal responsibility to care for equipment and resources.

Adhere to conduct of operations principles.

Removal Date

30-Apr-2017

job summary:
Provide engineering support for mechanical systems. Understanding rigging concepts and code requirements for rigging hardware, slings and lifting equipment. Identify system concepts and determine system functional and technical requirements. Monitor lifting performance, troubleshoot and resolve problems. Ensure operation within technical and safety basis requirements. Propose and develop improvements including system/equipment upgrades and plant modifications. As design authority, prepare modification input documents, provide technical input (e.g. for procedure development) and approve work packages. Engineering support services include engineering analysis, design development and generation of design output documents including but not limited to: Weight estimation; lift plans for cranes, hoists, fork trucks; structural qualification for attached loads; and design of lifting frames and below the hook lifting beams. Education
BS Degree in Mechanical/Civil Engineering or equivalent work experience

Experience/Skills
Candidate should have an understanding of ASME B30 code requirements for Hoisting and Rigging. Candidate demonstrating five years experience in mechanical systems in an industrial environment is preferred. Experience with OSHA/ANSI fall protection and system design is preferred. Experience with OSHA scaffolding requirements is preferred. Candidate must have the ability to walk down systems in the field. Experience with equipment systems in nuclear or hazardous environments preferred.

job summary:
The Engineering Leadership Development Program (ELDP) enables new hires to experience various challenging opportunities with SRNS Engineering. As part of the program, new hires will work on a variety of projects from across the Savannah River Site, providing them with exposure to the different facilities and processes on site. New hires will receive one-on-one career development assistance from seasoned professionals from different backgrounds and be collocated with other new hires allowing for peer group connection. They will also receive technical training as a part of the SRNS Engineering Technical Staff Qualification Program. Also, as part of ELDP, these young professionals will have networking opportunities with senior management through different programs such as community service, volunteerism, Engineering Week and Safety Expos.

Develop conventional engineering and scientific solutions to technical task objectives within various SRNS facility engineering organizations (e.g., Savannah River National Lab, Tritium, Nuclear Material Operations, Infrastructure Services, etc.). Learn SRNS and specific Division/Department systems and requirements for accomplishing tasks. Assist more senior technical personnel in performing related activities in more complex tasks.

Accept delegated technical responsibility for a limited phase of a scientific or an engineering program. Support engineers or scientists performing related phases of a program. job summary:
Perform conventional practices of industrial hygiene (the science and art devoted to the anticipation, recognition, evaluation, and control of those environmental factors or stresses arising in or from the workplace that may cause sickness, impaired health and well-being, or significant discomfort and inefficiency among workers) in an operational facility. Assess implementation of industrial hygiene programs within assigned organization.

Accepts delegated technical responsibility for a limited scope of an Industrial Hygiene (IH) Program. Performs conventional practices of IH by anticipating, recognizing, evaluating, and controlling environmental factors or stresses in the workplace. Supports Industrial Hygienists performing related phases of the program. Assists in study, development, testing and analysis of designs, processes, and procedures relating to a limited scope of the group's function. Performs occupational exposure assessments of conventional work exposures and conducts exposure monitoring strategies as assigned. Organizes and accepts responsibility for the accuracy of limited technical analyses and evaluation of results using conventional IH techniques and procedures. Makes scientific IH calculations. Assists in the preparation of technical reports.

job summary:
Provide engineering support for mechanical and structural systems. Understand rigging concepts and code requirements for rigging hardware, slings and lifting equipment. Identify system concepts and determine system functional and technical requirements. Monitor lifting performance, troubleshoot and resolve problems. Ensure operation within technical and safety basis requirements. Propose and develop improvements including system/equipment upgrades and plant modifications. As design authority, prepare modification input documents, provide technical input (e.g. for procedure development) and approve work packages. Engineering support services include engineering analysis, design development and generation of design output documents including but not limited to: Weight estimation; lift plans for cranes, hoists, fork trucks; structural qualification for attached loads; and design of lifting frames and below the hook lifting beams.


Engineering Services will be provided using SRNS processes and procedures. Programmatic guidance will be provided by SRS.


A DOE security clearance is not initially required; however, candidate must be capable of obtaining and maintaining a DOE “L” clearance if needed to perform future assigned duties. 

BS Degree in Mechanical or Civil Engineering;


or


Current registration as a Professional Engineer in Mechanical or Civil Engineering


Candidate must have ten years of rigging engineering experience with mechanical and structural components in an industrial environment.


Candidate must have working knowledge of ASME B30 code requirements for Hoisting and Rigging.


Experience with OSHA/ANSI fall protection and system design is required.


Experience with OSHA scaffolding requirements is required.


Candidate must have the ability to walk down systems in the field.


Previous SRS Engineering experience with equipment systems in nuclear or hazardous environments is preferred.

education level/skills required / respon: Must be able to develop measurably effective course material from information provided by site personnel, operations, maintenance and engineering procedures,...
job summary:
Direct and perform the analysis, design, development, and implementation of effective training methods to provide employees with the technical knowledge and skill required to perform their jobs safely and competently. Acts in a lead capacity for a broad subject area. Has significant involvement with identification of need for a training program. Responsible for managing accountability for training results at a higher level than simple skill acquisition. May act as a Subcontract Technical Representative coordinating all efforts of subcontracted personnel including budgeting, man hour accounting, and overseeing work accomplishment. May have significant input in the budgeting process for a particular training program. Acts in a lead role in the administration of a training program.

Directs the activities of Senior Training Instructors pertaining to the development of training materials. Present lectures, demonstrations, and the coordination of on the job training. Direct classroom experiments and practical exercises. Assist trainees with using interactive training tools. Supply alternate and ancillary resources and references as needed. Monitor and promote trainee achievement of lesson and course objectives. Administer oral, written, and job performance measure examinations, evaluating results. Identify trainee deficiencies and direct corrective action. Writes course terminal and enabling objectives based on analysis date obtained. Analyze, review, assess, and extract relevant training content material including validation of exam questions. Develop lesson plan s designed to enable trainees to meet terminal and enabling objectives. Such plans will address differing target audiences, use a variety of media, and provide varied learning experiences. Design and coordinate production of supporting media. Produce training materials which includes manuals, lessons, plans trainee guides, exams, and job performance measures. Assess and revise training materials as changes in policy, procedures, regulations, and requirements occur. Coordinate scheduling of classes, resources, and monitoring of attendance. Develop program design in conjunction with task to training matrix. Review job, task, and needs analysis data for applicable discipline. May act as Subcontract Technical Representative. May act as training program budget coordinator. May act as training program administrator. Develop, implement and issue of Operating Experienc Program (OEP)/Lessons Learned training materials. Perform instructional review of training materials.

This requisition is to fill the HB-Line Training Lead position.

Requires a AA degree and 10-12 years of experience; or BA/BS degree and 8-10 years of training work experience; or an advance degree in the field of discipline and 4-6 years facility specific experience ; or equivalent in related work experience. Must posses the breadth and depth of knowledge of a Senior Training Specialist thinking within broad theories and principles, demonstrating creativity, foresight, and mature technical judgment in solving unprecedented technical problems impacting major company objectives. Very significant knowledge in a particular field is required in order to present technical information in a credible manner and answer questions from students with different backgrounds. Very significant knowledge of the content of assigned lessons, generalizations of concepts, and applications to various jobs onsite is required to be able pinpoint causes of deficiencies in achievement if required. Very signification familiarity with applicable Federal laws, DOE order, and SRNS policies is required. Very substantial knowledge in a particular field is required in order to prepare training material, anticipate potential student difficulties, identify analogies, and answer questions from people with many different backgrounds sufficient to evaluate the relative importance of concepts, and the interplay between what is being taught and closely related fields. Must be able to demonstrate exemplary performance of tasks in the discipline and evaluate student performance of those tasks. Must be able to develop measurably effective course material from information provided by site personnel, operations, maintenance and engineering procedures, technical manuals, etc. Possesses and applies to completion of difficult assignment a comprehensive knowledge of a particular field of specialization. Often crosses fields.

education level/skills required / respon: Chemistry, Physics, Nuclear Physics, Nuclear Chemistry, Sciences and Mathemataics. Provide limited guidance and direction to less senior engineering...
job summary:
Savannah River National Laboratory (SRNL) is hiring individuals for multiple science disciplines in support of research and development projects within National Security, Environmental Stewardship, Science and Technology, and Clean Energy directorates for Department of Energy, Environmental Management, National Nuclear Security Administration, and other government, industry, and international customers. SRNL is an applied science laboratory that uses nano to macroscopic scale fundamentals along with modeling, bench scale, and full scale test beds, and instrumentation to provide solutions to client problems. Specific responsibilities for a Senior Scientist will vary depending on the project areas mentioned, although typical assignments can include:


Learning and application of SRNL Safety and Security policies and procedures.
Applying technical knowledge through the use of state-of-the-art computing, models, facilities, laboratories, and equipment.
Applying first principles analysis to develop applied solutions.
Independently performing and accepting responsibility for the accuracy of scientific calculations and the evaluation of results using state-of-the-art techniques.
Completing the design, development, and testing of laboratory and test bed scale experiments.
Learning and applying methods for analyzing varied sample matrices for large variety of radionuclides and analytes.
Publishing analysis, results, conclusions, recommendations, and /or experimental setup in internal and external reports, as well as patent disclosures, journal articles, and conference proceedings.
Mentoring by experienced scientists and senior professionals.
Engaging in outreach activities designed to promote science, technology, engineering, and mathematics education and career fields.
Engaging in defined rotational assignments in varying directorates to gain perspectives from a diverse laboratory customer base.

Additional Responsibilities


Ability to write or participate in the development of proposals and achieve funding.
Defining specific problems and develop project plans based on general problem statements from management and customers.
Determining scheduling and staffing requirements for assigned projects, and demonstrate cost and schedule consciousness through timely project updates and completion of project activities.
Leading small projects by planning the technical efforts and coordinating activities with those of other divisions, departments, and /or contractors.
Assisting senior leadership in developing, performing, and completing more complex tasks and larger projects.
Assisting in teaching, guiding, and mentoring newer professions.

Scope technical tasks and develop creative solutions to assigned problems. Begin using SRNS systems and meeting SRNS requirements with minimal supervisory guidance. Accepts complex tasks and receives minimal guidance from senior professionals.

Incorporate conventional engineering or scientific practices and a variety of complex features such as complicated technical requirements, application of new or special materials or processes and difficult coordination or oversight requirements into problem solving and program planning. Provide limited guidance and direction to less senior engineering professionals. Carry out development and qualification programs on tasks concurrent with other phases such as design and fabrication to better evaluate and minimize future problems. Develop alternate solutions to existing problems. Perform all detail work necessary to determine best solutions. Evaluate proposals and make recommendations based on proposed projects/tasks in area of assignment. May delegate portions of the detail work to less senior personnel. Prepare costs and schedule estimates on proposed projects/tasks in assigned area. Demonstrate cost and schedule consciousness through timely completion of assigned tasks and projects. Prepare manuals and other documents supporting or publicizing the technical effort. Demonstrate creative ability through medium of patent disclosures, problem solving, engineering reports, technical papers and articles. Develop and lead the implementation of TQ initiatives within the group.

Major

Computer Science

Other

Other Major

Chemistry, Physics, Nuclear Physics, Nuclear Chemistry, Sciences and Mathemataics

Exercises some freedom in exploring subject area and identifying alternatives for investigation; in strategy of developing cohesive solution involving a specific discipline; and in analysis and establishing technical validity.

MS or PhD or a combination with years of experience. Previous experience working at a DOE/NNSA/DOD nuclear or non-nuclear site.

(Subjective;e. g.ExcellentCommunicationSkills)" >
Ability to obtain and maintain an L or Q Clearance based on Division/Department needs.

Knowledge / Skill / Ability within the Majors listed include:

Analytical Chemistry

o Analytical Chemistry (all types) Actinide, Nuclear, Inorganic, Organic, Radiochemistry, and Physical Separations

o Analytical chemistry for wide variety of sample matrices (metal, oxide, solution), chemical form (solid, liquid, gas), radioactivity (environmental to high-dose), chemicals, and compounds.

o Ability to independently perform current techniques and develop novel and innovative techniques.

o Radiochemistry application includes separation of radionuclides for analysis by nuclear counting techniques; specific counting techniques in use at SRNL include gas-flow proportional counting, liquid scintillation counting, gamma spectrometry, alpha spectrometry, beta spectrometry, and neutron activation analysis.

o Non-destructive assay using gamma and neutron counting techniques

o Ability to independently perform and peer review data reduction and data quality protocols associated with each counting method.


Radiochemical Processing

o Development and demonstration of nuclear and non-nuclear chemical flowsheet and processing strategies through evaluation of up-stream and down-stream processes;

o Demonstration of radiochemical process operations on simulated and radioactive samples;

o Technical support to operating facilities through technical bases consultation, process optimization, and troubleshooting;

o Development and performance of actinide separations and characterization techniques to support the processing of alternative fuel types and disposition of excess material.

BS

education level/skills required / respon: The candidate will support engineering efforts in repair and maintenance of specialized equipment. The candidate will support electrical fabrication of custom...
job summary:
The candidate will support electrical fabrication of custom electronic equipment; including circuit board assembly, chassis wiring, electronics enclosure components layout and installation, and interconnect wiring of electrical devices. Circuit board assembly will include surface mount component assembly utilizing manual, semi-automatic, and fully automatic placement and reflow equipment. Prior experience with circuit board assembly and interconnect / chassis wiring is critical. Prior experience with semi-automatic and automatic assembly equipment (pick and place, reflow oven) is desirable. Certifications or prior training on soldering standards and interconnect wiring is desirable. The candidate will perform multiple job functions and must be able to adapt to changing priorities quickly. Some travel may be required. Ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance will be essential to job functions.

The candidate must have the ability to utilize inspection microscopes and other high magnification devices used for assembly and inspection of small electrical components. The candidate must also have the ability to manipulate small electrical components (down to 0.04X0.02” components) utilizing electronic assembly tweezers and other electrical assembly tools. The candidate should be able to interface with equipment vendors and utilize vendor manuals for operation of complex surface mount component assembly equipment.

The candidate will support design efforts through setup and testing of prototype electronics and associated software. Ability to assembly prototypical electronic circuits, operate circuits, and quantify circuit behavior is critical. Understanding of basic electronic circuits, hardware and software derived behaviors is desirable.

The candidate will support design efforts through technical documentation of designs, both mechanical and electrical. Design documentation shall consist of as-built corrections to CAD drawings, and edits to technical documents detailing operation, maintenance, and key design parameters, as well as bill of materials. Prior CAD experience and technical writing is desirable.

The candidate will support engineering efforts in repair and maintenance of specialized equipment. This effort will include electrical and mechanical troubleshooting and assessment of potential failure modes as a result of an operating environment. Prior equipment troubleshooting experience is desirable. Advanced training and course work relative to electronics repair, maintenance, and theory is desirable.

Other responsibilities will include tracking and procurement of consumable supplies, identification and procurement of specialized equipment needed to support fabrication efforts, and tracking / procuring project materials to ensure delivery schedules are met. Familiarity with types of electrical components, component distributors, and manufacturer specific component nomenclature is desirable.

Basic Qualifications

(Quantifiable; e.g. Three Years Experience, Bachelors Degree)

(Quantifiable; e.g. Three Years Experience, Bachelors Degree)" aria-labelledby="lblBasicQualifications
(Quantifiable;e.g.ThreeYearsExperience, BachelorsDegree)" >
High school diploma and at least 8-10 years of practical experience in facility production operations is required. An associates degree in a technical or mechanical area and 4-6 years of practical experience or a bachelors degree in a techincal or mechanical area and 0-3 years of practical experience would be considered equivalent. General understanding and familiarity with electrical and mechanical documents, blueprints, drawings, and schematics and various computer applications may be required depending upon the position and specific duties. Conceptual understanding of various facility processes, systems, and equipment. Working knowledge of site work control procedures and practices for both maintenance and operations. General understanding of work hazards, safety programs, operating configuration and lockout/hold identification is required.

job summary:
Position is for an application developer/analyst to support OBIEE (Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Edition) eReporting application. OBIEE is an Oracle tool suite that delivers reporting in support of SRS decision making. Position requires developer to gather source system reporting requirements and model/design data structures and data extraction objects consistent with reporting tool requirements. Reporting currently available in OBIEE includes: Financial, Project Costing, Maintenance, Supply Chain Management, Medical and Site Training. Position influences reporting steady state operations and enhancements.. On the immediate horizon this position will have a direct impact on projects supporting RIE metric reporting, Scorecard replacement, Legacy Data Warehouse model migrations, and Environmental Integrator Operable Unit (IOU) tool replacement to name a few.

As previously stated OBIEE is an analytic tool that supports reporting and decision making. The OBIEE reporting functionality is still evolving. Position entails at a minimum:


Proven experience with OBIEE.
Defining scope of information technology (IT) reporting and develop effective quality solutions which challenge unique or controversial problem solutions in accordance with SRNS IT processes and procedures.
Develop, recommend, and monitor Business Intelligence (BI) site wide strategic direction for the site reporting.
Work closely with the Software Professional Lead and the customer/owner to understanding and apply functional and system reporting requirements
Responsible for the application’s reliability, stability, and availability
Maintain technical expertise in assigned emphasis areas, demonstrate flexibility in multi-disciplines and assist others in their development
Proactively communicate and coordinate with others across IT to provide support for assigned areas, development initiatives and drive change.

Keeps assigned applications operational by testing product upgrades, providing customer support and problem solving customer issues. Plans for information systems and services from a perspective of application design, development, installation or database administration in accordance with SRNS IT processes and procedures. Provides tactical design, engineering, technical specifications, project coordination, and configuration management for moderately complex IT solutions. Assists more senior technical personnel in performing related activities in moderately complex tasks.

Work closely with the Software Professional Lead and the customer/owner to understanding and apply your knowledge of the functional and system requirements


Maintain technical expertise in assigned emphasis areas and demonstrate flexibility in multiple disciplines
Proactively communicate and coordinate with others across IT to provide support for assigned areas

Perform other tasks associated with application development lifecycle, commercial off the shelf software support and database administration:


Perform root cause analysis and outlines corrective action for complex problems
Ensure continued service of customer applications through prompt correction of system or program malfunctions and applying a sense of urgency, commitment and focus on the right priorities
Master software engineering tools such as configuration management systems, change management, vulnerability scanning, and debuggers in the software development process
Guide personnel to ensure efficient utilization of resources and adherence to technical standards, lead the analysis and development of requirements, design specs, and final products by reviewing systems documentation, plans, and schedules produced by less experienced personnel
Train less experienced personnel in the development of requirements, specifications, technical products and existing business processes
Lead moderate sized initiatives and projects by establishing tasks, priorities, milestones, cost estimates, and schedules
Conduct feasibility studies of automation opportunities and establish cost benefit parameters
Develop test plans and execute these plans to ensure that the software is correct
Participate in validation and efficiency reviews of completed program code
Review policies and procedures for technical accuracy
Participate in cross-functional IT teams
Evaluate new requests, offer suggestions to improve, provide comments and estimates level of effort for moderately complex IT solutions
Provide support for the software infrastructure associated with the system environments
Maintain cyber posture and compliance required to maintain federal authority to operate
Perform installations and upgrades to software and databases for maintaining vendor support and strategic agility
Plan for future requirements of database systems, to include disaster recovery needs and storage requirements
Protect operations by keeping information confidential

In summary the desired candidate will:

Demonstrated knowledge of the academic as well as the practical aspects of software engineering and analytical reporting is required. Ongoing technical development in software design is required.
Demonstrates analytical reporting experience utilizing OBIEE.
Demonstrates ETL knowledge utilizing Informatica Power Center tools and/or Oracle Data Integrator.
Demonstrate sound knowledge of Oracle SQL and PL/SQL
Demonstrates programming skills that include analyzing information, gathering requirements, designing data architecture, designing software logic, design reporting objects, testing, documenting, problem solving, debugging and deploying consistent with established fundamentals/methodology.
Demonstrate proficiency and experience necessary to develop complex and integrated reporting solutions.
Demonstrate ability to utilize software engineering tools such as configuration management systems, change management, scanning, and debuggers in the software development process.
Ability to work with minimal direction and supervision to complete projects in a timely manner, make time for unplanned assignments and adapt to changing priorities.

Demonstrated experience with Data Warehouse Architecture, Design and Modeling.

In depth knowledge of Oracle SQL and PL/SQL is a must.

Proven experience with PeopleSoft Financial Management, Supply Chain Management and Human Resource Management.
Applicant must be self-motivated, ambitious and interact well with users and other analysts to translate business and integration requirements into configurable component designs and solutions. Have strong technical proficiency in all areas of development from configuration, requirements, modeling, ETL design, database, administration, and security.

job summary:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

CBI & AREVA MOX Services, LLC is a consortium of companies based in Aiken, SC and formed to advance the Department of Energy's mission to dispose of surplus weapon grade plutonium. The plutonium is disposed of by mixing it with uranium and forming a mixed oxide (MOX) fuel for use in existing nuclear reactors. After the MOX fuel is irradiated in the reactor, the plutonium can no longer be used for nuclear weapons. AREVA Federal Services provides resources to MOX Services for the design, construction, licensing and operations of the MOX Fuel Fabrication Facility (MFFF) to be built at the Savannah River Site. Resources provided are in the following disciplines: Licensing, ES&H;, Integrated Safety Analysis, QA, Engineering Assurance, Process Engineering, Systems Engineering, Design and Engineering (Structural, Electrical, I &C;, Seismic, Nuclear Criticality, Piping, Mechanical, HVAC), Project Safety, Procurement, Project Controls, Software Design, Training, Records Management, Operations, and Information Technology.

AREVA Federal Services LLC (AFS) is a world-class nuclear engineering services and operations contractor which was established to serve the Federal Government, specifically the Department of Energy (DOE) and its contractors, by combining the capabilities, technologies, and resources from multiple AREVA companies. AREVA offers international experience in all aspects of the nuclear fuel cycle and has experience and capabilities in process development, engineering, design, construction, fabrication, and operations of nuclear waste management facilities and technologies.

The combined resources of AFS include more than 400 employees, comprising over 200 engineers and 50 scientists. Additionally, since AFS is part of the large global company AREVA, Federal clients have access to the entire AREVA family of companies with a global workforce of over 75,000 employees and a U.S. workforce that exceeds 6,000 employees.

With manufacturing facilities in 43 countries and a sales network in more than 100, AREVA offers customers reliable technological solutions for CO

2


free power generation and electricity transmission and distribution. We are the world leader in nuclear power and the only company to cover all industrial activities in this field.

Our 75,000 employees are committed to continuous improvement on a daily basis, making sustainable development the focal point of the group's industrial strategy.

AREVA's businesses help meet the 21

st

century's greatest challenges: making energy available to all, protecting the planet, and acting responsibly towards future generations.

POSITION DESCRIPTION

Looking for an exciting opportunity in the nuclear industry? "Energize" your future with AREVA

AREVA Federal Services LLC, a subsidiary of AREVA, is seeking a

Software Engineering Specialist II-IV, Automation/PLC.

The Software Engineering Specialist will work in multiple automation domains; safety control software and normal control software. Dependent assignments, the Software Engineer will report to the Lead Engineers of either domain. Generally, work assignments should not overlap domains. After initial orientation and training the Software Engineer will work either individually or in a small team and expected to be relatively autonomous within the context of the current project. Projects will be varied and include new software development, updates to existing developments, software testing, and trouble shooting.

Duties include, but are not limited to:
Development of PLC software that meets the project requirements including for some applications the reuse of existing applications from the MFFF reference facilities;

Interpreting / synthesizing a process control system into written requirements based on upstream engineering documents and technical specifications;

Provide technical review of software requirements specifications, software design documents, and code reviews;

Execution of work within the constraints of the approved budget and schedule, and in conformation with the required quality standards;

Assure that functional deliveries are properly placed under software configuration management;

Demonstrate initiative and motivation necessary to assess problems and develop solutions with minimum assistance from supervisors;

Able to understand and obey all project safety requirements and initiatives;

Able to interact and coordinate with the responsible system engineers and designer of the process equipment.

Qualifications

All candidates must meet the following minimum requirements in order to be considered for this opportunity. Candidates who exceed minimum qualifications may be considered for a higher level position.

B.S. in Industrial Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field of Engineering; or related experience in lieu of degree, plus 7 - 10 years of related technical experience.

3+ years relevant experience in automation design; either manufacturing, government or nuclear power business sectors.

Good understanding of a structured Software Development Lifecycle.

Possess strong technical writing and engineering document interpretation skills.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills;

Skilled in the use of Microsoft OS and Office applications.

The following requirements are desired and will be used to differentiate all candidates who apply for this position.

Familiarity with: Siemens S7, Schneider Unity, or Triconex PLC.

Experience with Function Block, Sequential Function Chart, and structured text programming languages.

Prior experience in automation in regulated environments such as commercial nuclear power, pharmaceuticals, or the FDA.

Experience with either Modbus or Profibus industrial networks.

Experience in other programming languages such as VB, C, C++, or SQL.

We offer competitive salaries, an excellent benefits package, and flexible work options, as well as a uniquely diverse and unified team of professionals. Our culture supports an environment where employees can continuously learn and gain professional growth through education, exciting projects and career mobility. AREVA recognizes your achievements and excellent performance through various performance incentive, recognition and reward programs. Our commitment is to you, the employee.

Come work in an environment that is driven by integrity, innovation and visionary thinking. Join AREVA today, revolutionize the energy industry and energize your future!

AREVA is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

job summary:
AECOM is seeking a Criticality Safety Engineer 3 to be based in our Aiken, SC location. The Engineer is responsible for perform a variety of engineering assignments in planning and overseeing research, development, design, manufacture, test, installation, operation, and maintenance of diverse electronic/mechanical equipment and systems and generally as a member of a design, analysis or review team on more complex assignments or as a lead on less complex assignments.


Essential Responsibilities:


Perform a range of design development, analysis or review tasks under minimal supervision.


Act as a lead on less complex tasks and responsible for a portion of a design or section of an analysis or design review.


Generate complete design specifications of more complex projects.


Coordinate and work closely with other engineering, logistics, financial, and program management disciplines to define system specifications and requirements.


Establish and maintain a filing system or databases as needed for tracking project status.


Develop, maintain and produce technical documentation and system/subsystem specifications.


Direct interface and liaison with customers at all levels from quotation to final design and test activities, design reviews and technical working group meetings to comply with requirements and specifications.


Conduct site visits, experimental investigations and analyze engineering problems, propose solutions and alternatives, and provide recommendations.


Verify and comply with engineering documentation standards and test procedures.


Support development of technical proposal and provide comments on the technical content and level of effort of the proposed scope of work.


Minimum Requirements


Educational Requirement:

Bachelor of Science degree in an appropriate engineering or sciences discipline from a four-year accredited college or university.
Minimum Requirements:

Must have 5+ years of professional experience with 2 years experience in Criticality Safety.


Demonstrated experience with MCNP and/or SCALE codes.


Experience with: Demonstrated DOE and/or commercial nuclear experience in performing criticality safety analytical and operational oversight tasks in accordance with ANSI 8 series of standards.


Develop nuclear criticality safety evaluations (NCSE) and supporting criticality calculations in accordance with DOE standards and guidelines.


Develop criticality safety strategies, specifying criticality safety structures, systems, and components (SSCs).


Excellent written and oral communication skills are required.


Must have the ability to effectively mentor junior level Criticality Safety Engineers.


Ability to obtain and maintain a DOE Q clearance is necessary.


Due to the nature of work, candidate must be a US Citizen.


Preferred Qualifications


Preferred Requirements:

Advanced degree in Nuclear Engineering.


Familiarity with criticality computing platform selection/maintenance and Software Quality Assurance.


A DOE Q clearance is desired.


Additional Information:

Qualified applicants who are offered a position must pass a pre-employment substance abuse test.


Relocation benefits are available for this position.


What We Offer


AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow.


AECOM is an equal opportunity employer and Minorities, Females, Veterans, and Disabled persons are encouraged to apply. For further information, please click here at http://www.aecom.com/content/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/EEO-is-the-Law-poster-supplement.pdf to view the EEO Is The Law poster.

Nuclear Apprentice Mechanic – Plant Vogtle

Southern Nuclear, a subsidiary of Southern Company, manages and operates six nuclear power electric generating plants that provide approximately 20 percent of the electricity used in Alabama and Georgia. Southern Nuclear is leading the nuclear renaissance by building the first new U.S. nuclear reactors in more than 25 years. When completed, the two Westinghouse AP1000 reactors currently under construction at Plant Vogtle will make the facility the largest in the U.S. with four reactors on one site. This is an exciting time to join the Southern Company team and share your talents with a growing and progressive organization!

Job Summary

Accomplish mechanical maintenance activities on both non-safety and safety-related components by performance of preventative maintenance, predictive maintenance, and planned and unplanned corrective maintenance to ensure safe and reliable operation of a Nuclear Station. Be available for work when required to ensure an adequate pool of manpower to correct plant problems.

This position may be assigned to a position within the Emergency Response Organization (ERO) that requires response to the station when an emergency is declared. Assignment to one of these positions and a condition of continued employment will be the ability to arrive at the station to perform ERO responsibilities within 60 minutes of notification of an emergency.

Selected candidates are subject to work assignments at Units 3&4 at Plant Vogtle as determined by management.

Management reserves the right to exclude job applicants who are currently employed by contractors and vendors supporting the construction of Vogtle units 3 and 4.

Selected candidates for Mechanic positions must be able to successfully complete formal classroom training and pass all exams related to the position.

** Relocation assistance is not available for this position **

An employee in this classification will normally perform as an Apprentice Mechanic and will use his/her training and knowledge of a broad variety of pumps, motors, valves and other associated skills as called upon. This position will demonstrate proficiency in and qualify to perform mechanical maintenance required for maintenance and repair at a nuclear station at a Journeyman level, including: maintaining and repairing power plant equipment; working on both energized and de-energized equipment; following procedures/prints to install and maintain equipment; assembling and disassembling components using proper rigging and lifting techniques; troubleshooting equipment; and properly using mechanical test equipment. This position is required to maintain proficiency and periodic re-certification is mandatory.

Mechanical responsibilities are to test, repair, maintain, overhaul, and modify all mechanical plant equipment at the highest level of skill in accordance with nuclear procedures.

Accountabilities

Ensure efficient and reliable operation of station equipment through preventive maintenance, predictive maintenance, corrective maintenance, and troubleshooting activities on non-safety and safety-related plant equipment.

Perform investigation of failures/deficiencies on plant equipment with Engineering Department and Shop Supervisor and vendors in order to correct problems and improve reliability of plant equipment.

Perform Quality Control (QC) activities.

Participate in the Maintenance Training Program as required.

Continually improve the quality of mechanical maintenance procedures through the established feedback and revision processes.

Assist training as a subject matter expert in reviewing and preparing training materials and mock-ups.

Work shift work in support of maintenance activities as required and the potential to work as a job lead for mechanical maintenance jobs.

Incumbent is accountable for miscellaneous other responsibilities as assigned or required.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Must meet position requirements and demonstrate competency through the established testing procedures.

Ability to utilize computer-based maintenance management system.

Ability to read and follow procedures and mechanical drawings/prints is required.

Ability to use powered and non-powered hand tools proficiently is required.

Ability to plan work to maximize production is required.

Education and Training

High school diploma/GED

Associates Degree in a technical field or nuclear technology program, a plus

Demonstrate concern for safety of self and others

Knowledge and skills to maintain, troubleshoot, install, and repair mechanical /electrical equipment/components with advanced training and knowledge in a recognized area

Good verbal and written communication skills, high level of attention to detail, and able to work efficiently as a member of a team

Accept responsibility for own performance and be adaptable to changing requirements

Conduct task performance evaluations

Must qualify on the MASS pre-employment test

Applicants may be required to demonstrate their competency through testing and or hands on demonstrations

Southern Nuclear’s top priority is the safety and health of the public, our employees and the environment. We are committed to the safe operation of our nuclear generating facilities with equipment and systems that meet strict Nuclear Regulatory Commission safety and design regulations. Each Southern Nuclear employee is committed to instilling Institute for Nuclear Power Operations’ “Principles for a Strong Nuclear Safety Culture” in every aspect of their responsibilities.

With 4.4 million customers and more than 46,000 megawatts of generating capacity, Atlanta-based Southern Company is the premier energy company serving the Southeast through its subsidiaries. A leading U.S. producer of clean, safe, reliable and affordable electricity, Southern Company owns electric utilities in four states and a growing competitive generation company, as well as fiber optics and wireless communications. Southern Company brands are known for energy innovation, excellent customer service, high reliability and retail electric prices that are below the national average. Southern Company and its subsidiaries are leading the nation's nuclear renaissance through the construction of the first new nuclear units to be built in a generation of Americans and are demonstrating their commitment to energy innovation through the development of a state-of-the-art coal gasification plant. Southern Company has been recognized by the U.S. Department of Defense and G.I. Jobs magazine as a top military employer and listed by DiversityInc as a top company for Blacks. The company received the 2012 Edison Award from the Edison Electric Institute for its leadership in new nuclear development, was named Electric Light & Power magazine's Utility of the Year for 2012 and is continually ranked among the top utilities in Fortune's annual

World's Most Admired Electric and Gas Utility

rankings. Visit our website at

www.southerncompany.com.

Southern Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) of minorities, women, individuals with disabilities, veterans and strongly supports diversity in the workplace.

Job Description

Looking for an exciting opportunity? AFS MOX is looking for a

Tool Room Inspection/Release Specialist II.

The qualified candidate will be responsible for recording and maintaining control of inventory items purchased and produced in the tool room. Ensures compliance with established internal control procedures. Be competent to perform tasks that may impact on health and safety in the workplace. Relies on limited experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks. Works under general supervision. A certain degree of creativity and latitude is required. Additional general responsibilities will include the following:

Implement the tool management program and procedures of MOX Services.

Assist in the issuance and receiving of tools and other Government Property, as well as the storage and maintenance of the same.

Assist in the periodic audits of these items and various controls.

Assist in the inventory controls required by the Tool Room.

Assist in the efforts to report to Construction Management as required.

Assist in unloading trucks and stocking and restocking shelves as required.

Creates material masters in specialized tool room database.

Creates inspection test plans in specialized database.

Performs physical receipt inspection and review of material/product documentation in accordance with inspection test plan requirements and document inspection results.

Creates CR’s (Condition Reports) for non-conforming tools.

Releases material utilizing specialized manufacturing database.

Move material to shop floor or inventory. (May utilize material handling equipment such as fork lifts, hand trucks, cranes, etc.)

Archives quality records.

May assist with shipping components off site.

May interface with production and adjust work priorities to meet production schedules.

Play an active role in creating a safe and healthy workplace and comply with all applicable safety and health rules.

Qualifications

All candidates must meet the following minimum requirements in order to be considered for this opportunity. Candidates who exceed minimum qualifications may be considered for a higher level position.

HS diploma plus 5 years related experience. Prefer Associate Degree in a technical discipline plus 2 years related experience.

1 or more years of work experience with inventory control, construction or warehouse experience.

Develop and maintain knowledge of regulatory requirements.

Must be able to bend, climb, stoop, and lift up to 25 pounds.

The following requirements are desired and will be used to differentiate all candidates who apply for this position.

Working knowledge of standard concepts, practices, and procedures within a construction site.

Intermediate computer skills including data basing, spreadsheets, word processing, etc.

Ability to read drawings and understand tolerances.

Familiar with the site safety and health policy and program.

Logistics experience.

Government property protocol experience

ToolHound experience.

Our culture supports an environment where employees can continuously learn and gain professional growth through education, exciting projects and career mobility. AREVA recognizes your achievements and excellent performance through various performance incentive, recognition and reward programs. Our commitment is to you, the employee.

job summary:
E2 offers an excellent benefits package including health, dental, vision, and life insurance, 401(k) with employer match, paid time off. Qualified candidates only please submit your resume. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.

This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a DOE “L” security clearance. After award, candidates who do not possess an active DOE clearance will be initially assigned an uncleared badge and will be required to apply for a clearance.

This position is responsible for execution of the SRS Energy & Sustainability Management Program per DOE 436.1 and Executive Order 13693. Responsibilities require effective engagement with Facility, Operations, Maintenance, and Engineering personnel at SRS, as well as meeting the Energy Independence Security Act (EISA) requirements and document submittals. Some of the major requirements for this position include:


Be the site primary Energy Management Engineering and Technical interface and effectively engage with DOE-SR and DOE-HQ in the execution of the site's Energy Management/Sustainability commitments and scopes.
Provide coordination and Subject Matter Expert support with various SRS organizations & tenants to comply with DOE Sustainability metrics.
Provide required annual Consolidated Energy Data Report (CEDR) to DOE-HQ.
Provide required annual Site Sustainability Plan to DOE-HQ.
Support DOE program/data assessments.
Lead the site in the conduct of Energy Independence Security Act (EISA) audits and provide required annual data reporting for the site's facilities to DOE-HQ.
Respond to data and information requests from offsite parties (DOE-HQ, DOE-SR, etc.).
Provide Energy Savings Performance Contract (ESPC) data.
Represent SRNS and participate in monthly reporting teleconferences with DOE-HQ SWG (Sustainability Working Group).
Participate in monthly IPT (Integrated Project Team) meetings to support the program initiatives.

Define scope of technical programs and develop effective and efficient solutions to challenges which involve unique or controversial problems. Routinely use SRNS systems and meet all SRNS requirements with little supervisory guidance. Assist in teaching newer professionals and guiding their efforts.

Incorporate conventional engineering or scientific practices and a variety of complex features such as complicated technical requirements, application of new or special materials or processes and difficult coordination or oversight requirements into problem solving and program planning where only general objectives are stated. Coordinate various phases of the activity and perform development work in assigned field. Define specific problems based on general problem information from management and customers. Plan technical effort and coordinate activities with those of other divisions, departments and sections in focused areas to solve problems. Ensure compliance with technical requirements of assigned work, proper utilization and training of personnel operating under one's technical guidance to ensure compliance and effective execution of approved schedules and staffing estimates. Ensures appropriate technical performance of the end product developed and designed to resolve the original problem. Determine scheduling and staffing requirements for assigned tasks, in collaboration with management. Demonstrate cost and schedule consciousness through timely completion of assigned tasks and projects. Communicate results and objectives verbally and in manuscript form to customers, colleagues and management. Enhance expertise in field through participation in local technical societies. Demonstrate creative ability through medium of patent disclosures, problem solving, engineering reports, technical papers and articles. Education

BS Degree in Chemical Engineer, Electrical Engineer, Mechanical Engineer, Nuclear Engineer, or Civil Engineer.
Experience/Skills

Previous experience supporting sustainability and energy management programs in the government or industrial sector is required.

Proficient in performing consolidated energy data reports, site sustainability plans, and related program/data assessments.

Proven ability to solve complex problems through effective communication and technical understanding of industrial utility/energy systems (electrical, mechanical, etc.)

Work history demonstrating personal accountability for project schedules, deadlines, budgets, and the safe performance of work.

Ability to walk down systems in the field.

Previous experience with implementation of DOE Order 436.1 and Executive Order 13693

Familiar with the Energy Independence Security Act (EISA) requirements and associated document submittals

Accredited by the Association of Energy Engineers (AEE)

Working knowledge of Energy Savings Performance Contracts
Licenses

Ability to obtain and maintain a DOE “L” security clearance

job summary:
The SRNL Director of Strategic Computing (DSC) will direct programs, personnel and resources for Information Technology Management (ITM), Scientific Computing (SC), High Performance Computing (HPC), Cyber Security, Collaboration, and other technical computer support. The DSC will interface with SRNL strategic and programmatic initiatives for the advancement and growth of SC, and all other information technology needs to maintain and increase SRNL business. Oversee and direct technology strategies for SRNL’s SC infrastructure to enable strategic growth to support the mission interfaces. Provide strategic, technical, and policy directions to solve national, regional, and DOE Complex issues related to information technology and computing for SRNL. Represent SRNL on the National Lab Chief Information Officer Council (NLCIO) to address ITM and cyber issues DOE complex wide.

Major Responsibilities

The DSC will be the central point of contact for all SRNL ITM. Requires regular interface with SRNS Chief Information Officer (CIO) and staff, DOE-SR CIO, DOE-EM CIO, and SRNL Senior Staff. Lead, manage and direct SRNL’s overall computing strategy by determining strategic direction of new information technology services and solutions for SRNL that facilitate advancement of SRNL mission and strategic initiatives.

Develop and promote new collaboration and SC tools that are essential to emergent programs and the growth of the business. Develop new capabilities, competencies and skills that support business growth. Work with SRNL management in the creation of strategic partnerships and new missions. Assist in leading strategic business development efforts and initiatives to grow the business with internal and external customers to establish relationships with universities, other national labs, and industry. Work closely with the SRNL Chief Operating Officer (COO), SRNL Business Services Director, and SRNL Associate Laboratory Directors (ALDs). Represent SRNL on Advisory Boards as needed.

The SRNL DSC will also function as the SRNL CIO and be the SRNL representative on the National Laboratory CIO (NLCIO) Council. Interface with national laboratory CIO’s on a monthly basis to discuss complex-wide computing issues and directives. Represent SRNL as a voting member of the NLCIO Council. Attend National Information Technology and Computational meetings to stay abreast of advancement for strategic direction and initiatives.

Oversee and direct a staff of professionals in areas that include Scientific Computing (SC), Cyber Security, Technical & application support, the SRNL Library, and SRNL Conference Center. The DSC ensures SRNL representation on the SRNS IT Governance Board as a voting member. The SRNL DSC will provide Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) as needed for Software Quality Assurance (QA) programs and issues.

Responsible for management of SC which includes system administration, engineering, scientific, and SRNL business application support, data management, and storage for SC as well as support of SRNL scope for other web and database applications. Software procurement and administrative/financial management of Commercial Off the Shelf (COTS) proprietary software will be managed through SC. This group is also responsible for computational assistance to SRNL researchers as needed when requested. SC is also responsible a suite of scientific software tools including evaluation of Open Source software tools and packages. SC serves as the primary interface with SRNS IT for Network issues or needs, infrastructure upgrades and storage management. SC is responsible for operational cyber security for the HPC cluster.

Oversee SRNL Cyber Security Program. This includes cyber security related to the SRNL Accreditation Boundary (AB). The DSC servers as Owner of the SRNL AB and ensures that an Authority to Operate (ATO) is maintained.

Manage the operating and project-specific budgets and schedules. Manage the staffing, work assignments and technology direction.

Provide leadership to continually improve safety, disciplined operations, security, and quality performance.

Implement personnel, salary and administrative policies and directives in a consistent and fair manner.

Ensure development of employees including professional growth, leadership skill and active management of diversity. Lead, mentor, communicate and develop employees for enhanced performance and teamwork.

Other

Science or Engineering degree

job summary:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

CBI/AREVA MOX Services, LLC is a consortium of companies based in Aiken, SC and formed to advance the Department of Energy's mission to dispose of surplus weapon grade plutonium. The plutonium is disposed of by mixing it with uranium and forming a mixed oxide (MOX) fuel for use in existing nuclear reactors. After the MOX fuel is irradiated in the reactor, the plutonium can no longer be used for nuclear weapons. AREVA Federal Services provides resources to MOX Services for the design, construction, licensing and operations of the MOX Fuel Fabrication Facility (MFFF) to be built at the Savannah River Site. Resources provided are in the following disciplines: Licensing, ES&H;, Integrated Safety Analysis, QA, Engineering Assurance, Process Engineering, Systems Engineering, Design and Engineering (Structural, Electrical, I &C;, Seismic, Nuclear Criticality, Piping, Mechanical, HVAC), Project Safety, Procurement, Project Controls, Software Design, Training, Records Management, Operations, and Information Technology.

AREVA Federal Services LLC (AFS) is a world-class nuclear engineering services and operations contractor which was established to serve the Federal Government, specifically the Department of Energy (DOE) and its contractors, by combining the capabilities, technologies, and resources from multiple AREVA companies. AREVA offers international experience in all aspects of the nuclear fuel cycle and has experience and capabilities in process development, engineering, design, construction, fabrication, and operations of nuclear waste management facilities and technologies.

The combined resources of AFS include more than 400 employees, comprising over 200 engineers and 50 scientists. Additionally, since AFS is part of the large global company AREVA, Federal clients have access to the entire AREVA family of companies with a global workforce of over 75,000 employees and a U.S. workforce that exceeds 6,000 employees.

With manufacturing facilities in 43 countries and a sales network in more than 100, AREVA offers customers reliable technological solutions for CO

2


free power generation and electricity transmission and distribution. We are the world leader in nuclear power and the only company to cover all industrial activities in this field.

AREVA supports a safety conscious work environment and nuclear safety culture by aggressively promoting the identification and correction of safety issues and fostering a conservative decision making environment that drives nuclear safety.

POSITION DESCRIPTION

Looking for an exciting opportunity in the nuclear industry? "Energize" your future with AREVA Federal Services!

AREVA Federal Services LLC, a subsidiary of AREVA, is seeking an

Electrical

Field Engineer I-II.

Under broad supervision, the qualified candidate will be responsible for review of electrical design drawings and specifications, as well as verification of installed work in accordance with the applicable specifications and design output documents.

The position will be responsible for the following:
Field engineering in support of construction activities with a concentration on electrical field engineering duties.

Review/Interpret engineering drawings, specifications, and other documents.

Prepare and/or revise construction work packages.

Perform field walk-down inspections to review work for conformance with design requirements, applicable codes/standards and project procedures.

Prepare field change requests.

Work independently with minimal supervision and act as a resource for colleagues with less experience.

Qualifications

All candidates must meet the following minimum requirements in order to be considered for this opportunity. Candidates who exceed minimum qualifications may be considered for a higher level position.

B.S. in a Electrical Engineering/Engineering Technology, plus a minimum of 1-3 years of related experience. An advanced degree may be substituted for related experience

(MS 1-2 yrs. or PhD 1-3 yrs.). In applicable states a PE license will be accepted in lieu of a 4-year engineering

degree.

Experience working within a nuclear construction or operations environment.

At least one year of experience with: technical knowledge in construction process relating to the electrical engineering discipline.

Moderate knowledge of related engineering standards, techniques and criteria.

Good communication skills including the ability to comprehend and convey detailed technical data.

Ability to develop and maintain good interpersonal relationships.

Strong problem identification and problem resolution skills.

The following requirements are desired and will be used to differentiate all candidates who apply for this position.

Prior Nuclear experience

Detailed knowledge of the construction process.

Detailed technical knowledge in construction aspects of all engineering disciplines.

Working knowledge of other discipline scopes, roles, and responsibilities.

We offer competitive salaries, an excellent benefits package, and flexible work options, as well as a uniquely diverse and unified team of professionals. Our culture supports an environment where employees can continuously learn and gain professional growth through education, exciting projects and career mobility. AREVA recognizes your achievements and excellent performance through various performance incentive, recognition and reward programs. Our commitment is to you, the employee.

Come work in an environment that is driven by integrity, innovation and visionary thinking. Join AREVA today, revolutionize the energy industry and energize your future!

AREVA is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

job summary:
AECOM is seeking a Emergency Management Specialist 4 with nuclear industry experience .


Location may be flexible (Aiken, SC or Oak Ridge, TN or Richland, WA).


Incumbent will perform as a lead on more complex engineering assignments in one or more of the following fields:


Emergency Management/Preparedness, Accident Analysis, Hazards Analysis and Consequence Analysis.


Essential Responsibilities:


Establish and maintain a filing system or databases as needed for tracking project status.


Develop, maintain and produce technical documentation.


Conduct site visits, experimental investigations and analyze engineering problems, propose solutions and alternatives, and provide recommendations.


Verify and comply with engineering documentation standards.


Prepare, deliver and submit technical papers and perform engineering studies.


Support development of technical proposal and provide comments on the technical content and level of effort of the proposed scope of work.


Minimum Requirements


Educational Requirement:

Bachelor of Science degree in an appropriate engineering or sciences discipline from a four-year accredited college or university.
Minimum Requirements:

Must have a minimum of 7 years work experience in the nuclear industry.


A minimum of 5 years’ experience in preparation of Emergency Management Technical Baseline documents (i.e. Hazards Surveys, EPHAs, EALs), emergency planning or preparedness in either the nuclear (NRC / DOE / FEMA-REP regulations) or chemical (EPA /OSHA regulations) industry) .


Experience in using concepts from DOE-HDBK-3010-94 or NUREG/CR-6410 in the development of Accident Analysis related calculations in complex nuclear environments.


Experience in the development of Hazards Analyses in nuclear environments (DOE or NRC). This includes familiarity with the DOE (or NRC) standards and the ability to develop and revise existing Documented Safety Analysis and Hazard Assessment documents for nuclear facilities.


Must have a working knowledge (or experience in the implementation) of 10 CFR 830 and DOE Orders and Standards including DOE O 151.1C, DOE G 151.1 – 1A, DOE G 151.1 – 2, DOE-STD-3009-94, DOE-STD-5506-2007, DOE-STD-1027-92, DOE-STD-1189-2008, DOE G 420.1-2, and DOE G 421.1-1 or the related NRC regulations.


Candidate must be eligible to obtain a DOE Q clearance and access to Commercial Nuclear Facilities.


Candidate must be able to travel on business as needed.


Due to the nature of work, candidate must be a US Citizen.


Preferred Qualifications


Preferred Requirements:

Experience in completing dose consequences to onsite and offsite individuals for chemical and radiological releases resulting from flammability issues, spray releases, spills, boiling, explosions, and crushing events is desired.


Experience in hazards identification & screening, consequence assessment and drill & exercise.


Additional Information:

Qualified applicants who are offered a position must pass a pre-employment substance abuse test.


Candidate must be open to relocation away from the area should the need arise.


Relocation benefits are available for this position.


What We Offer


AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow.


AECOM is an equal opportunity employer and Minorities, Females, Veterans, and Disabled persons are encouraged to apply. For further information, please click here at http://www.aecom.com/content/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/EEO-is-the-Law-poster-supplement.pdf to view the EEO Is The Law poster.

job summary:
Purpose
Supervise and manage the day to day operation and maintenance of the Nuclear Regulatory Commission Licensed UT TRIGA Research Reactor in compliance with applicable federal regulations in support of its use as a significant research and educational tool to further the university's mission.


Essential Functions
Operational Support - Perform mission critical activities (reactor operations, maintenance, operator training, research, education and outreach) Maintenance and surveillance - Oversee facility safety and security. Perform and/or supervise required routine preventive and corrective maintenance on digital and analog reactor control and instrumentation system, address unanticipated failures, manage system upgrades and development. Reactor License and interaction with NRC - Emergency planning and drills, NRC inspections, Reactor Oversight Committee support, Licensing and requalification exams, site security. Engineering Support and Training - Reactor scheduling, S-badge training, Course support. Ensure all activities are conducted safely and within applicable program and license requirements. Maintain documents and procedures - Manage facility administrative programs (emergency plan, security plan, and operator requalification program). Maintain operational records, operational procedures, maintenance procedures, maintenance of electronic files, posted document maintenance, annual inventory updates. Security - Manage access authorization, manage security enhancements.


Marginal/Incidental functions
Other related functions as assigned by supervisor.


Licenses:
Class "C" Operator's Driver's License. Applicant selected must provide a current three year Driving
Record from the current state of residence. If not currently a Texas resident, must obtain a Texas Driver's License
within 30 days after entering Texas as a new resident.


Required qualifications
B.S. or M.S. degree in Engineering or a Physical Science with a minimum of five years of experience in reactor operations and maintenance. Appropriate technical school or military training may be considered as a substitute for degree requirements. Must be able to successfully complete security clearance for unescorted access to the facility and access to safeguards information required for 10CFR73. Must be capable of obtaining a Nuclear Regulatory Commission Senior Reactor Operator license, including medical qualification, under 10CFR55 within one year. Must be capable of certifying as a crane operator. Must hold or be capable of obtaining a Class C Texas driver's license.
Equivalent combination of relevant education and experience may be substituted as appropriate.


Preferred Qualifications
Supervisory experience including responsibility for student employees is desired. Previous training or education in fundamentals of nuclear reactor theory and operation. Experience with nuclear research reactor operation and maintenance, training nuclear reactor operators, experiment safety analysis, and nuclear facility security. Experience in handling and processing of radioactive materials. Experience in the use of standard chemistry laboratory equipment.


Working conditions
May work around chemical fumes
May work around standard office conditions
May work around biohazards
May work around chemicals
May work around electrical and mechanical hazards
Use of manual dexterity
Climbing of stairs
Frequent PC, nuclear instrumentation and electronic test equipment use. Occasional climbing of ladders and lifting/moving of up to 20 pounds.


A criminal history background check will be required
for finalist(s) under consideration for this position.


The retirement plan for this position is Teacher Retirement
System of Texas ( TRS ), subject to the
position being at least 20 hours per week and at least
