job summary:
Only open to US Permanent Residents (Green Card holders), US Citizens and Canadian Citizens.

Position: High Frequency Electromagnetic Engineer
Location: Denver, CO
Compensation: $90,000 - $125,000 + Excellent Benefits + Paid Relocation

Job Description:
The position would focus on high frequency electromagnetics analysis using ANSYS HFSS, SIWave, and Simplorer with a range of applications (e.g. antennas, RF and microwave, signal integrity...).
The engineer would also be expected to learn low frequency analysis (electric machines, actuators, sensors, wireless transfer) and system level modeling with ANSYS Simplorer.
Depending on the skills and interest of the engineer, the role could also involve thermal coupled multiphysics models with FEA or CFD tools.

Company Bio:
This Client is a major supplier of the ANSYS family of products to leading companies in the USA and Canada.
Their customers rely on them to help them become more productive, improve their engineering processes, and help them thrive in today's competitive market.
They have become a valued partner and a key member of their engineering teams.
They are an exciting group and are a growing simulation technology company with employees located in 10 strategic locations around the country.
They are committed to the success of our customers.
They work hand-in-hand with them to increase their simulation productivity and fidelity, enabling the development of advanced products and/or manufacturing processes.

Culture and Management Philosophy:
They are not only a equal opportunity employer offering a stimulating and challenging environment, but likely the most interesting place that you will ever work. This allows each person to exploit his/her full potential and push the limits of their expertise.
They also encourage our employees to develop their competencies and the recognition of such is part of the DNA of the company.
Each member of their staff is a simulation expert who also maintains an expertise in one or more specialized fields.
Their engineers have advanced engineering degrees with a number of years experience in the engineering consulting business.
They maintain a high level of professionalism in a friendly, cooperative environment.
Their company aspires to be recognized as an outstanding employer.
Though they consider themselves a 'Sales' organization, their technical team comprises over half of their staff, with a significant number of them having advanced engineering degrees.
Theuare involved in almost every industry ranging from mining to oil & gas, from automotive to aerospace, from electronics to nuclear, from marine to medical.
They place a strong value on their staff. The more they develop, the more they can work with their customers. They have grown their organization by making their customers successful.

Responsibilities:
You will provide technical and sales support along with performing training and consulting projects.
You will share enthusiasm for ANSYS simulation tools to existing or potential customers.
You will provide technical expertise to the account manager and the customers to assess analysis needs related to development, design, and problem solving with ANSYS software to develop the market and to provide high quality customer service.
You will also be responsible for completing challenging consulting projects and keeping up with the latest simulation technology.
The mix of different tasks and wide variety of applications makes for a work environment that is never boring.
Performs numerical simulations for consulting projects in a wide range of applications.
Visit customers to assess technical needs & communicate with the sales team.
Propose technical solutions to customers.
Demonstrate to customers/prospects the capability of the software.
Present technical seminars over web and in person.
Solve technical support requests related to simulation software usage.
Conceive custom applications related to the customer activity.
Write analysis reports and other technical documents.
Prepare and deliver training on ANSYS tools.
Minimal travel will be required with the majority of it in the local office region. Occasional short travel to further locations may occur.

Requirements:
Bachelor in electrical engineering or an equivalent discipline.
Master or Ph.D. in electrical engineering or equivalent is considered a plus.
3+ years of experience in applied electrical engineering simulation or in research with a strong focus on ANSYS HFSS.
Experience with multiple applications including analysis of antennas, EMI/EMC, and signal integrity is ideal.
Solid theoretical background in high frequency electromagnetic fields, circuits, and numerical methods.
Design/analysis of low frequency electronics (e.g. electric machines, transformers, solenoids...).
System level modeling expertise (Simplorer or similar).
Interest in thermal simulation in CFD or FEA (CFX, Fluent, Icepak, ANSYS).
Interest in multiphysics (e.g. electromagnetic, structural, thermal, fluids, acoustics...).
Ability to use 3-D CAD to build or simplify models Optimization and DOE methods.
Basic scripting/programming skills in any of the following: J-script, Python, C#, VB, .Net, C++.
Familiarity with computers and operating systems.
Excellent ability to communicate (both written & verbal) is essential.
Strong interpersonal skills.
Able to learn and incorporate theoretical, technical, and practical concepts quickly.
Capable to analyze problems and propose practical solutions.
Strong work ethic.
Creativity and flexibility.
Meticulous and detail oriented.
Capability to multi-task.
Capable of working in a team or individual environment.
Self-starter.
Dislikes repetition.

job summary:
The Senior Classification Analyst will support the NNSA Office of Defense Nuclear Security with classification guidance for the Classified and Controlled Information Program. This position is contingent upon contract award.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

The primary purpose of this position is to provide classification and analytical support for DOE/NNSA security activities. The person shall provide technical support for the following:

Advise on draft National, DOE and NNSA classification guidance, recommend concurrence to Classified and Controlled Information Program Manager, and suggest improvements to the draft guidance.
Provide technical assessment of draft orders, manuals and other related documents.
Conduct classification and declassification reviews of documents to determine if they contain classified information and controlled sensitive unclassified information.
Review press releases, reports, budget documentation, testimony and NNSA web pages for possible classification and controlled sensitive unclassified information concerns before public dissemination and assist with changes to produce unclassified language to permit release.
Assist with classification mentoring and respond to classification questions.
Advise NNSA Office of Defense Nuclear Security and DOE Office of Classification on policy issues and educate NNSA Headquarters staff on security issues through formal training and one-on-one meetings.
Serve as security and technology subject-matter expert responding to inquiries from throughout NNSA Headquarters and generate classification answers for NNSA field organizations and contractors, and represent their interests at Headquarters.
Investigate and evaluate security incidents, including decontaminating desktop computer systems that have become improperly contaminated with classified information.
Provide desk side, telephonic and email assistance to NNSA HQ personnel on classification and policy issues.
Other duties as assigned.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor’s Degree in nuclear engineering, security, public policy, management or related field
7 years experience in security / classification operations
Highly effective communication skills, effective work in fluid, high-paced environment, essential teamwork skills, detailed oriented
DOE Q or DOD TS security clearance
Certified Top Secret Derivative Classifier and Declassifier with Broad Authority, and Unclassified Controlled Nuclear Information (UCNI) Reviewing Official.
Experience with DOE/NNSA classification.

PREFERRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES

Advanced Degree in nuclear engineering, security, public policy, management or related field
15+ years experience in security / classification operations
10+ years of nuclear weapons experience
Qualified applicants please submit resume, cover letter and compensation requirements, with job title in the subject line, to careers@meleassociates.com.

job summary:
Sr. Project Engineer - Nuclear Services and Technology


CO-GWV-16-030 (#LI-CC1)


Introduction

Merrick & Company is seeking a Senior Project Engineer to join our Nuclear Services and Technology team in our Greenwood Village, CO office.


Job Description

The Senior Project Engineer will serve as a lead professional engineer for teams of engineers and designers within the mechanical and equipment design groups. This individual is a degreed and licensed professional engineer who is capable of managing multiple tasks. Tasks include the design of containment systems (gloveboxes, hoods, and hot-cells), material handling systems, radioactive material processing systems, equipment integration and installation, shielded facilities, and preparation of fabrication drawings, specifications, datasheets and calculations. The successful candidate will delegate work to other engineers and designers, and will check their work on projects. The successful candidate will provide technical direction, guidance, delegation, and technical planning for projects. Additionally, the candidate will assist and develop design criteria, manages work scope, schedule and budgets. The Senior Project Engineer is expected to assist with staff planning and reviews.


Scope/Key Responsibilities

· Lead multi-disciplinary teams of engineers and designers.

· Serve as Engineer of Record on mechanical designs.

· Follow regimented quality assurance / quality control procedures.

· Detailed design activities include preparation of fabrication drawing packages, equipment datasheets, fabrication specifications, procurement specifications, engineering studies, test plans, and detailed equipment sizing & qualification calculations.

· Responsibilities include planning, conducting and coordinating detailed phases of design work; presenting design reviews to clients; and providing shop support during fabrication and testing.

· Promote professional development amongst the team members.


Required Experience

· Minimum of eighteen (18) years of experience for either (or combination) NRC, DOE or DoD projects.

· Familiarity with ASME NQA-1 quality assurance programs.

· Demonstrated experience with leading mechanical engineering teams within a complex multi discipline team is essential.

· Familiarity with 3D design software Pro/E (highly desirable).

· Experience with prototyping, supplier support, factory testing and field startup desirable.

· Familiarity with MS Project or Primavera Sur-Trak a plus.

· Bachelor of Sciences degree required.

· Client projects for this position:

o Require sole U.S. Citizenship

o Prohibit Dual Citizenship

· Must have the ability to acquire a security clearance.

· PE license required.

· Candidate will be expected to have or obtain a PE license in various states.

· Local Candidate preferred.


Physical Requirements

· The job requires the ability to sit for extended periods at a computer workstation.

· The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

· Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Work Environment

This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as but not limited to: computers, phones, copiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.


Additional information

Apply on line only. No e-mail, hard copy or third party resumes accepted.


Merrick offers a competitive compensation and benefits package which includes; health insurance, dental and vision coverage, 401(k), unique work-life benefits, continuing education and training through the Merrick Learning Institute.


Merrick & Company is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by law.


We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

Prepares and presents expert testimony before regulatory bodies and courts.

Assists with interpreting codes and permitting as it relates to a specific discipline.


Ensures quality, quantity, and completeness of the assigned engineering tasks.


Advanced level of specialized engineering knowledge within a specific discipline and has basic understanding of other disciplines.


Fully versed in business development concepts and methods and supports the project proposal process.


Fully versed with the process of preparing and checking calculations as well as the approval, revision, retention, and storage of calculations within a specific discipline.


Fully versed in the collection and/or evaluation of data and information regarding technical and economic factors including physical, chemical, environmental, maintenance, operational, regulatory, constructability, and/or schedule factors relating to a specific subject within a discipline.


Reviews and advises on purchase orders and subcontracts.


Assists with the development of manpower, man-hour and labor cost requirements to aid in evaluating the budget.


Leads estimating tasks and performs material take off's for a specific discipline.


Fully understands the planning and scheduling of engineering tasks.


Understands the project change control process and identifies potential changes.


Fully versed with and can check the work sequence, general content and the methods used to generate specifications for the purchase of material, equipment, systems, services or construction within a specific discipline.


Can integrate all project functional requirements into a complete project plan.


Builds productive relationships with organizations within and external to Engineering.


Perform all other position related duties as assigned or requested.


Additional Information:

Qualified applicants who are offered a position must pass a pre-employment substance abuse test.


Relocation benefits are not available for this position.


Minimum Requirements

Bachelor of Science degree in Civil or Architectural Engineering with a Structures Major (or equivalent education).


15+ years of relevant and progressive professional experience in the modeling, analysis, and design of heavy industrial steel structures and foundations.


Good oral and written communication skills


In-depth knowledge and expertise in application software including STAAD.Pro, MathCad, Excel, and Word


Ability to obtain a security clearance.


In depth knowledge of the process of preparing and checking calculations, as well as, approval, revision, retention, and storage of project calculations.


In-depth knowledge of drawing production and checking, as well as, approval, revision, retention, and storage of engineering drawings.


Working knowledge of ANSYS analysis software.


Due to the nature of the work, all candidates must be US citizens (dual citizenship is not permitted).


Preferred Qualifications

Professional Engineering Registration.


Master of Science degree in structural engineering


3+ years of relevant supervisory experience including, managing engineers, designers, and specialists: project schedules and budgets; compliance with applicable state laws/regulations and building codes; interdisciplinary coordination; progress and performance reports and forecasts; specifications; and engineering studies.


In-depth knowledge of AISC Seismic Design Provisions.


In-depth knowledge of nuclear facility design codes including ACI 349, AISC N690, and ASCE 43.


In-depth knowledge of seismic response spectrum analysis.


What We Offer


AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow.


AECOM is an equal opportunity employer and Minorities, Females, Veterans, and Disabled persons are encouraged to apply. For further information, please click here at http://www.aecom.com/content/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/EEO-is-the-Law-poster-supplement.pdf to view the EEO Is The Law poster.

job summary:
Structural Engineer III


CO-GWV-16-182


Introduction

Merrick & Company is seeking an experience Structural Engineer to join a team working on a challenging, innovative project with the nuclear industry. The work will include creating comprehensive calculation analyses and documents supported by detailed finite element analysis, seismic analysis, and a combination of stainless steel framing member design, plate and shell design, and connection design following Department of Energy (DOE) design standards, codes, and quality procedures.


Job Description

The Structural Engineer III provides the structural design of equipment and facility structures for the DOE using DOE standards and codes.


Duties

· Work independently to evaluate, select and apply standard techniques, procedures, and criteria to perform engineering design tasks or sequences of tasks on projects

· Collaboratively use judgment to determine adaptations in methods for non-routine aspects of assignments

· Plan and coordinate detailed aspects of the engineering work including preparing scope, budgets, and schedules

· Assign tasks to and coordinate work with engineers and designers

· Read and understand engineering requirements for designs integrating multiple systems and codes

· Generate technical reports, calculations, or other similar documents detailing purpose, methodology, results, conclusions, and recommendations pertaining to the addressed engineering problem.

· Use experience to establish efficiencies

· Stay within established schedule as outlined by a lead engineer, and coordinate with other disciplines as directed by the lead engineer.

· Review and check the work of other engineers to determine accuracy and completeness

· Assist in training and mentoring entry level engineers


Required Experience

· Client projects for this position require US Citizenship.

· Bachelor’s degree (B. S.) in Civil/Structural or Architectural/Structural Engineering from an A.B.E.T. accredited program is required

· Candidate must be a licensed Professional Engineer (P.E.)

· Minimum of eight (8) years related experience is required

· Experience with current building codes and steel design is required

· Experience with seismic equivalent static analysis of structures is required

· Knowledge of finite analysis software such as RISA 3D, STAAD Pro, ANSYS or GTStrudl is required.

· Proficiency in engineering calculation software such as MathCAD is required.

· Proficiency in Microsoft Office software is required.


Preferred Experience

· Experience with nuclear design codes such as AISC N690, ASME NUM-1, and ASME NOG-1 is preferred.

· Experience with nuclear seismic design codes such as ASCE 4 and ASCE 43 is preferred.

· Experience with seismic dynamic analysis of structures is preferred.

· Experience with performing work under a quality assurance program such as ASME NQA-1 is preferred.

· Experience with writing technical reports, calculations, and other similar documents are preferred.

· Experience in the design of DOE facilities and equipment is preferred.

· Experience with the design of mechanical equipment and material handling systems is preferred.

· Experience with stainless steel design or cold formed steel design is preferred.

· Experience with process piping design is preferred.

· Local candidates preferred.


Physical Requirements

· The job requires the ability to sit for extended periods at a computer workstation.

· The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

· Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Work Environment

This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as but not limited to: computers, phones, copiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.


Additional information

Apply on line only. No e-mail, hard copy or third party resumes accepted.


Merrick & Company offers a competitive compensation and benefits package which includes; health insurance, dental and vision coverage, 401(k), unique work-life benefits, continuing education and training through the Merrick Learning Institute.


We recognizes the importance of developing top talent from within, our employees have access to a wide range of internal and external training and coaching programs and are rewarded for their achievements through excellent benefits and competitive salaries.


Merrick & Company is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by law.


We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

job summary:
Do you have a passion for Talent and to drive the recruiting craft to the next level? How about building sourcing strategies that will find the talent that will design the next iteration of the Orion Spacecraft? The Senior Manager of Talent Acquisition role epitomizes this opportunity.


At Lockheed Martin’s Space Systems Company (SSC), we do difficult. In other words, we love designing and building stuff and sending it into space…and yes, someday to Mars. We also like thinking beyond today and we want our Talent Acquisition Leaders to think the same. We also want our Leaders to apply best practices, but also drive and influence change. This newly created opportunity can be summarized in this way:


• Be a part of a company that is being recognized as Americas Most Attractive Employers for Business, Engineering and Computer Science, as well as one of the Top 25 Employer Brands by Simply Hired

• Opportunity to take the Talent Acquisition function within Space Systems to a more progressive level and be able to understand: where our best candidates come from, what are the root causes of time-to-fill, the latest best practices that we can leverage to find, attract and select the right talent

• Build and shape the team of Recruiters, Sourcers and Coordinators that meet the needs of the business

• Access to expertise within workforce intelligence, marketing and data analysis

• Mentor workforce of TA practitioners and leaders to help transform our culture to be partners with the business


Reporting to the Director of Global Talent Acquisition, this role will lead a geographically dispersed team of 18 consisting of 1 TA Manager, 10-12 recruiters, 3 sourcers and 2 recruiting coordinators with responsibility for filling over 1200 positions, as well as driving sourcing strategies to proactively fill critical skill pipelines.


First Year Objectives:


• Execute the experienced professional hiring plan in Engineering for 2017 (over 1200 hires)

• Partner with Marketing to develop and deliver strategic sourcing & marketing plans for critical Engineering talent segments (RF Engineers, Optical Engineers SW Developers, Nuclear Systems Engineers)

• Develop reporting and insights into the root causes of req aging, time-to-fill

• Organize and align the team to meet business demand and drive optimization

• Drive continuous improve in time-to-fill, hiring manager satisfaction and candidate satisfaction

• Assist with the development of a Recruiter and Sourcer Scorecard


Other Focus Areas & Responsibilities:


• Lead the executing on the tactical hiring plan that supports the Engineering and Technology function including position scoping, marketing, screening/selection, interviews, offer negotiations and on-boarding

• Collaborate with business partners and stakeholders to advise on programs in order to develop sourcing plans, options, allocate resources, manage costs, etc.

• Explore the market trends and best practices in attracting external technology talent and implement appropriate best practices

• Present regular reports to keep management informed of program status and related issues (i.e. requisition aging, time-to-fill, candidate quality and sourcing effectiveness)

• Effectively build and execute action plans based on manager and candidate satisfaction survey results

• Monitor and track business objectives, validate recruitment strategies, and develop business specific strategies when the need arises

• Manage the quality, productivity and compliance with internal policies, EEO/diversity policies, as well as, federal and state employment and labor laws

• Proactively monitor and track business objectives, validate recruitment strategies, and develop business specific strategies when the need arises

• Serve as the organization liaison for enterprise-wide committees, working groups, and projects

• Provide leadership to a professional team of Recruiters, Sourcers and Coordinators and motivate them to drive results to the highest level


Basic Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 10 years recruitment and/or human resources experience. Equivalent combination of education and experience will also be considered.

• Minimum 2 years of experience managing a recruitment operation and/or team of recruiters and/or HR professionals

• Demonstrated competence managing recruiting results in a deadline driven, high req volume environment.

• Experience analyzing and reporting on recruiting metrics

• Proficient with Microsoft Office and electronic applicant tracking systems (ATS)

• Demonstrated Experience managing a recruitment budget

• Knowledge of Department of Labor compliance related to nondiscrimination/ affirmative action laws and regulations


Desired skills

• Demonstrated track record of developing and implementing successful, creative, and forward thinking recruitment strategies (includes the ability to deliver diversity strategies and sourcing)

• Passion for the latest recruitment technology and talent marketing best practices

• International recruiting

• Previous experience in a large service focused organization

• Knowledge of aerospace and defense organizational structure, services and benefits

• PMI or PMP certification

• Proven ability to persuade and influence management and key decision makers on the direction of the organization.

• Talent management skills in terms of: hiring the right talent with positive impact to the team, ability to organize and integrate a geographically dispersed team, and develop high performers and be a supplier of talent to the HR organization

• Leadership skills in terms of: delivering results through others, energizing employees to perform effectively as a team, envision the future state and set appropriate direction

• Proven communication skills which include the ability to speak, write and listen in a manner that clarifies issues, promotes closure, and delivers information in a clear and concise manner and facilitates decision making.

• Demonstrated strong business acumen and analytical skills.

• A strong commitment to top-level customer service

• Results oriented team player, yet able to work independently of direct supervision


As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.


Join us at Lockheed Martin, where we’re engineering a better tomorrow.


Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.


Job Location(s): Herndon California, Herndon Colorado, Herndon Pennsylvania, Herndon Virginia

job summary:
We are currently looking for a high frequency electromagnetics engineer to join our team.


The position would focus on high frequency electromagnetics analysis using ANSYS HFSS, SIWave, and Simplorer with a range of applications (e.g. antennas, RF and microwave, signal integrity...). The engineer would also be expected to learn low frequency analysis (electric machines, actuators, sensors, wireless transfer) and system level modeling with ANSYS Simplorer. Depending on the skills and interest of the engineer, the role could also involve thermal coupled multiphysics models with FEA or CFD tools.


About us:


We are a major supplier of the ANSYS family of products to leading companies in the USA and Canada. Our customers rely on us to help them become more productive, improve their engineering processes, and help them thrive in today's competitive market. We have become a valued partner and a key member of their engineering teams.


We are an exciting group and are a growing simulation technology company with employees located in 10 strategic locations around the country. 
We are committed to the success of our customers. We work hand-in-hand with them to increase their simulation productivity and fidelity, enabling the development of advanced products and/or manufacturing processes


Culture and Management Philosophy


We are not only a equal opportunity employer offering a stimulating and challenging environment, but likely the most interesting place that you will ever work. This allows each person to exploit his/her full potential and push the limits of their expertise. We also encourage our employees to develop their competencies and the recognition of such is part of the DNA of the company. Each member of our staff is a simulation expert who also maintains an expertise in one or more specialized fields. Our engineers have advanced engineering degrees with a number of years experience in the engineering consulting business. We maintain a high level of professionalism in a friendly, cooperative environment. Our company aspires to be recognized as an outstanding employer.


Though we consider ourselves a 'Sales' organization, our technical team comprises over half of our staff, with a significant number of them having advanced engineering degrees. We are involved in almost every industry ranging from mining to oil & gas, from automotive to aerospace, from electronics to nuclear, from marine to medical... We place a strong value on our staff. The more they develop, the more they can work with our customers. We have grown our organization by making our customers successful.


Position Profile


The engineer provides technical and sales support along with performing training and consulting projects. The role involves sharing enthusiasm for ANSYS simulation tools to existing or potential customers. The engineer will provide technical expertise to the account manager and the customers to assess analysis needs related to development, design, and problem solving with ANSYS software to develop the market and to provide high quality customer service. The engineer will also be responsible for completing challenging consulting projects and keeping up with the latest simulation technology. The mix of different tasks and wide variety of applications makes for a work environment that is never boring.


Education:


Bachelor in electrical engineering or equivalent 
Master or Ph.D. in electrical engineering or equivalent is considered a plus


Professional Experience


Three (or more) years experience in applied electrical engineering simulation or in research with a strong focus on ANSYS HFSS 
Experience with multiple applications including analysis of antennas, EMI/EMC, and signal integrity is ideal 
Solid theoretical background in high frequency electromagnetic fields, circuits, and numerical methods


US/Canadian Citizenship or Permanent Residents preferred


Other advantageous experience includes:


Design/analysis of low frequency electronics (e.g. electric machines, transformers, solenoids...) 
System level modeling expertise (Simplorer or similar) 
Interest in thermal simulation in CFD or FEA (CFX, Fluent, Icepak, ANSYS) 
Interest in multiphysics (e.g. electromagnetic, structural, thermal, fluids, acoustics...) 
Ability to use 3-D CAD to build or simplify modelsOptimization and DOE methods 
Basic scripting/programming skills in any of the following: J-script, Python, C#, VB, .Net, C++ 
Familiarity with computers and operating systems


Abilities & Competencies


Excellent ability to communicate (both written & verbal) is essential 
Strong interpersonal skills 
Able to learn and incorporate theoretical, technical, and practical concepts quickly 
Capable to analyze problems and propose practical solutions 
Strong work ethic 
Creativity and flexibility 
Meticulous and detail oriented 
Capability to multi-task 
Capable of working in a team or individual environment 
Self starter 
Dislikes repetition


Responsibilities


Performs numerical simulations for consulting projects in a wide range of applications 
Visit customers to assess technical needs & communicate with the sales team 
Propose technical solutions to customers 
Demonstrate to customers/prospects the capability of the software 
Present technical seminars over web and in person 
Solve technical support requests related to simulation software usage 
Conceive custom applications related to the customer activity 
Write analysis reports and other technical documents 
Prepare and deliver training on ANSYS tools 
Minimal travel will be required with the majority of it in the local office region. Occasional short travel to further locations may occur.


If you are selected to join us, you will become a key member of our technical staff and will work and learn in a challenging technical environment. Success will be measured not only by helping to grow our simulation business, but also by continued development of your own technical skills by solving challenging problems in a wide variety of industries.


Location: Denver, CO or Seattle, WA

job summary:
We are looking for Prior Navy Nuclear ( MM's, EM's or ET's ) - This is a senior level field service opportunity where you will function as an Engineering Technical Representative similar to a Test or Systems Engineer in the critical facilities industries. The hiring manager is a former Navy nuclear professional and he is looking for former Navy Nuclear trained MM, ELT, EM or ETs for a "fulltime" senior field service engineering opportunity where you could live anywhere in the greater Denver to Cheyenne, WY area.


The hiring manager has also placed a very strong emphasis customer service and those who share his same vision of responsibly and timely response to customer requirements while treating members of the team with respect. This position is responsible for the oversight and technical documentation during the startup and commission of critical facilities equipment in data centers such as power generation and distribution systems, uninterruptible power supplies, static transfer switches, PDU's, BAS & BMS systems, HVAC equipment, installed firefighting and monitoring systems.


Candidates must have a strong working knowledge of electrical/electronic and mechanical systems and excellent customer service skills. While your Navy nuclear experience might not include all of the areas/systems this corporation works with, you must be able to discuss the theory and operational concepts of Back-up Generators, Uninterruptable Power Supplies, Power Distribution and Power Conditioning equipment, environmental systems such as HVAC, dehydrators and air handlers as well as fire prevention and firefighting systems.


This is a field service position, and any interested candidates need to be prepared to work 50-70% in the field, and you are home every weekend.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

-Perform design reviews of systems and validate construction to commissioning turnover acceptance.

-Develop, oversee and write installation, startup and commissioning policies and procedures.

-Perform construction observations and develop functional test plans.

-Execute tests for a wide variety of electrical and mechanical systems to ensure testing is performed in conformance with specifications, standards and procedures.

-Assist in training of plant operations and maintenance personnel.

-Act as liaison with vendors and subcontractors regarding problem resolution and perform testing as required.

-Technical writing experience; review, analyze data and prepare technical reports or procedures.

-Maintain effective communication with clients, contractors and other project team members.

-Work with others to manage small to mid-size projects to meet client expectations for technical excellence, budget and schedule.


QUALIFICATIONS:

-Minimum of six years in the US Navy Nuclear Electrical, Electronic or Mechanical field with strong experience in electrical power distribution or mechanical system installation and testing.

-Experience in diagnosing and solving construction and operational problems.

-Experience working with contracted repair and installation organization, to include QA, testing and acceptance procedures.

-Must have the ability to travel to customer sites, rent vehicles and mange a travel budget/schedule independently.

-Good interpersonal skills and ability to work with and guide others


COMPENSATION:

Base compensation commensurate with the area, and a unique bonus structure that offers a high level of income. Once the initial training is completed (6-12 months, depending on your ability to learn and qualify) you will have a salary review with the potential of a 15% increase in base compensation. The bonus structure is exceptional for the industry. The company benefits are extraordinary, including matching 401k and the company covers all of your medical/dental premiums.


Interested candidates can contact Michael Erikson with Magellan Professional Solutions, Inc. directly at (757) 549-1880 or by sending him an e-mail to: merikson(at)magellan-ps.com.

job summary:
AECOM is seeking a Sr. Estimating Manager to be based in the our Denver, CO location. The Sr. Estimating Manager will manage all activities related to estimating the elements of project cost (direct and indirect) including labor (manual and non-manual), materials and permanent equipment, supplies, consumables and expenses, construction equipment rental and operating costs, contingency, escalation, program risk, etc. Manage the estimating function for groups, regional locations and/or major projects.


Essential Responsibilities:


Management of cross-discipline applications including Electrical, Architectural/Civil/Structural, Mechanical, Systems Control, Estimating cornerstone application analysis, etc.


Provide functional and administrative oversight of all estimating activities, including: estimate planning, preliminary project schedule, coordination of estimating activities, equipment and material take-off, costing, vendor and subcontractor quotations, calculating Return on Invested Capital (ROIC) and Internal Rate of Return (IRR), preparation of a basis of estimate, and leading estimate reviews.


Implement estimating policy, procedures, and systems consistent with the company mission and competitive practices.


Ensure systems are maintained and established guidelines are implemented for various types of estimates in accordance with established policies and procedures.


Analyze and review proposals to ensure potential profitability.


Prepare budget and performance plan


Support Company programs and institutes appropriate measures for employee development by mentoring and training staff.


Maintain an adequate level of personnel, with appropriate levels of skills and training, to staff on-going estimating activities and meet project objectives.


Set strategic and tactical direction with regard to systems, work force staffing, budgeting and maintaining technical performance excellence Participate in contract and change order negotiations and Bid/No Bid decisions.


Prepare and maintain special reports and the report distribution list.


Resolve differences between functional policies and practices, and project priorities and philosophies, ensuring project requirements are consistent with estimating techniques and goals.


Assures quality archival of historical data (consistency, current, accurate, and complete).


Responsible for managing the estimating function for a project or in a subsidiary home office or assists in the management of estimating assignments for a major program.


Work directly with subcontractor to resolve technical matters during negotiation and contract execution


Responsible for budget preparation and performance plan.


Perform all other position related duties as assigned or requested.


Minimum Requirements


Educational Requirement:

Bachelors of Science degree in Construction Management or related field, or equivalent experience.
Minimum Requirements:

A minimum 12 years estimating experience.


10 or more year's experience preparing estimates for Department of Energy projects, particularly nuclear material processing and related waste products.


Knowledge of the Federal Acquisition Regulations, particularly Table 15-2 requirements, Truth In Negotiations Act, and Cost Accounting Standards.


Comprehensive knowledge of the impacts to craft labor productivities on Department of Energy sites.


In depth knowledge of estimate impacts on typical Department of Energy projects from quality assurance programs and engineering and construction specifications.


Due to the nature of the work, candidates must be US Citizens.


Preferred Qualifications


Preferred Qualifications:

Estimating experience with both new construction and upgrades to existing facilities at nuclear material handling and nuclear waste handling operations at Department of Energy locations.


Direct interface experience with design engineering and construction project managers.


Experience with WinEst and Hard Dollar estimating software systems.


Understand the requirements for an adequate estimating system, and how to prepare for an internal or external audit of the estimating system.


Understanding of forward pricing rates and how they are applied.


Understand and demonstrate the concepts of cost reasonableness and cost justification.


Ability to establish a basis for knowledge management / benchmarking data.


Ability to prepare burdened wage rates.


Knowledge of crew build-ups and sizes.


Ability to prepare an Estimate Basis by WBS element / CLIN element.


Understand schedule impacts to the cost estimate.


Experience managing and collecting appropriate backup information to support the estimate.


Additional Information:

Qualified applicants who are offered a position must pass a pre-employment substance abuse test.


Relocation benefits are available for this position.


What We Offer


AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow.


AECOM is an equal opportunity employer and Minorities, Females, Veterans, and Disabled persons are encouraged to apply. For further information, please click here at http://www.aecom.com/content/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/EEO-is-the-Law-poster-supplement.pdf to view the EEO Is The Law poster.

Summary
Spencer Ogden Search & Solutions has an opportunity for a technical recruiter to provide recruiting and executive search support for our Search and Solution Group.

The role focuses on sourcing, recruiting, qualifying and managing candidates for job openings focused in the North American Energy market.

You are comfortable with directly approaching candidates that are often not actively looking for a new opportunity.
You have the ability to build relationships in your industry and with target candidates and can sell career opportunities to target candidates that can change their careers and positively impact their lives.

You are a great communicator that can listen and turn information into sales opportunities.
You have experience in permanent recruitment and/or executive search and are interested in working in exciting growth markets such as renewable energy, smart energy, etc.

Contact us anytime to discuss this opportunity or if you feel our skills can help us to advance our business in other areas.

Nuclear

Smart Energy

Built Environment

job summary:
Only open to US Permanent Residents (Green Card holders), US Citizens and Canadian Citizens.

Position: High Frequency Electromagnetic Engineer
Location: Denver, CO
Compensation: $90,000 - $125,000 + Excellent Benefits + Paid Relocation

Job Description:
The position would focus on high frequency electromagnetics analysis using ANSYS HFSS, SIWave, and Simplorer with a range of applications (e.g. antennas, RF and microwave, signal integrity...).
The engineer would also be expected to learn low frequency analysis (electric machines, actuators, sensors, wireless transfer) and system level modeling with ANSYS Simplorer.
Depending on the skills and interest of the engineer, the role could also involve thermal coupled multiphysics models with FEA or CFD tools.

Company Bio:
This Client is a major supplier of the ANSYS family of products to leading companies in the USA and Canada.
Their customers rely on them to help them become more productive, improve their engineering processes, and help them thrive in today's competitive market.
They have become a valued partner and a key member of their engineering teams.
They are an exciting group and are a growing simulation technology company with employees located in 10 strategic locations around the country.
They are committed to the success of our customers.
They work hand-in-hand with them to increase their simulation productivity and fidelity, enabling the development of advanced products and/or manufacturing processes.

Culture and Management Philosophy:
They are not only a equal opportunity employer offering a stimulating and challenging environment, but likely the most interesting place that you will ever work. This allows each person to exploit his/her full potential and push the limits of their expertise.
They also encourage our employees to develop their competencies and the recognition of such is part of the DNA of the company.
Each member of their staff is a simulation expert who also maintains an expertise in one or more specialized fields.
Their engineers have advanced engineering degrees with a number of years experience in the engineering consulting business.
They maintain a high level of professionalism in a friendly, cooperative environment.
Their company aspires to be recognized as an outstanding employer.
Though they consider themselves a 'Sales' organization, their technical team comprises over half of their staff, with a significant number of them having advanced engineering degrees.
Theuare involved in almost every industry ranging from mining to oil & gas, from automotive to aerospace, from electronics to nuclear, from marine to medical.
They place a strong value on their staff. The more they develop, the more they can work with their customers. They have grown their organization by making their customers successful.

Responsibilities:
You will provide technical and sales support along with performing training and consulting projects.
You will share enthusiasm for ANSYS simulation tools to existing or potential customers.
You will provide technical expertise to the account manager and the customers to assess analysis needs related to development, design, and problem solving with ANSYS software to develop the market and to provide high quality customer service.
You will also be responsible for completing challenging consulting projects and keeping up with the latest simulation technology.
The mix of different tasks and wide variety of applications makes for a work environment that is never boring.
Performs numerical simulations for consulting projects in a wide range of applications.
Visit customers to assess technical needs & communicate with the sales team.
Propose technical solutions to customers.
Demonstrate to customers/prospects the capability of the software.
Present technical seminars over web and in person.
Solve technical support requests related to simulation software usage.
Conceive custom applications related to the customer activity.
Write analysis reports and other technical documents.
Prepare and deliver training on ANSYS tools.
Minimal travel will be required with the majority of it in the local office region. Occasional short travel to further locations may occur.

Requirements:
Bachelor in electrical engineering or an equivalent discipline.
Master or Ph.D. in electrical engineering or equivalent is considered a plus.
3+ years of experience in applied electrical engineering simulation or in research with a strong focus on ANSYS HFSS.
Experience with multiple applications including analysis of antennas, EMI/EMC, and signal integrity is ideal.
Solid theoretical background in high frequency electromagnetic fields, circuits, and numerical methods.
Design/analysis of low frequency electronics (e.g. electric machines, transformers, solenoids...).
System level modeling expertise (Simplorer or similar).
Interest in thermal simulation in CFD or FEA (CFX, Fluent, Icepak, ANSYS).
Interest in multiphysics (e.g. electromagnetic, structural, thermal, fluids, acoustics...).
Ability to use 3-D CAD to build or simplify models Optimization and DOE methods.
Basic scripting/programming skills in any of the following: J-script, Python, C#, VB, .Net, C++.
Familiarity with computers and operating systems.
Excellent ability to communicate (both written & verbal) is essential.
Strong interpersonal skills.
Able to learn and incorporate theoretical, technical, and practical concepts quickly.
Capable to analyze problems and propose practical solutions.
Strong work ethic.
Creativity and flexibility.
Meticulous and detail oriented.
Capability to multi-task.
Capable of working in a team or individual environment.
Self-starter.
Dislikes repetition.

job summary:
The Senior Classification Analyst will support the NNSA Office of Defense Nuclear Security with classification guidance for the Classified and Controlled Information Program. This position is contingent upon contract award.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

The primary purpose of this position is to provide classification and analytical support for DOE/NNSA security activities. The person shall provide technical support for the following:

Advise on draft National, DOE and NNSA classification guidance, recommend concurrence to Classified and Controlled Information Program Manager, and suggest improvements to the draft guidance.
Provide technical assessment of draft orders, manuals and other related documents.
Conduct classification and declassification reviews of documents to determine if they contain classified information and controlled sensitive unclassified information.
Review press releases, reports, budget documentation, testimony and NNSA web pages for possible classification and controlled sensitive unclassified information concerns before public dissemination and assist with changes to produce unclassified language to permit release.
Assist with classification mentoring and respond to classification questions.
Advise NNSA Office of Defense Nuclear Security and DOE Office of Classification on policy issues and educate NNSA Headquarters staff on security issues through formal training and one-on-one meetings.
Serve as security and technology subject-matter expert responding to inquiries from throughout NNSA Headquarters and generate classification answers for NNSA field organizations and contractors, and represent their interests at Headquarters.
Investigate and evaluate security incidents, including decontaminating desktop computer systems that have become improperly contaminated with classified information.
Provide desk side, telephonic and email assistance to NNSA HQ personnel on classification and policy issues.
Other duties as assigned.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor’s Degree in nuclear engineering, security, public policy, management or related field
7 years experience in security / classification operations
Highly effective communication skills, effective work in fluid, high-paced environment, essential teamwork skills, detailed oriented
DOE Q or DOD TS security clearance
Certified Top Secret Derivative Classifier and Declassifier with Broad Authority, and Unclassified Controlled Nuclear Information (UCNI) Reviewing Official.
Experience with DOE/NNSA classification.

PREFERRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES

Advanced Degree in nuclear engineering, security, public policy, management or related field
15+ years experience in security / classification operations
10+ years of nuclear weapons experience
Qualified applicants please submit resume, cover letter and compensation requirements, with job title in the subject line, to careers@meleassociates.com.

job summary:
Sr. Project Engineer - Nuclear Services and Technology


CO-GWV-16-030 (#LI-CC1)


Introduction

Merrick & Company is seeking a Senior Project Engineer to join our Nuclear Services and Technology team in our Greenwood Village, CO office.


Job Description

The Senior Project Engineer will serve as a lead professional engineer for teams of engineers and designers within the mechanical and equipment design groups. This individual is a degreed and licensed professional engineer who is capable of managing multiple tasks. Tasks include the design of containment systems (gloveboxes, hoods, and hot-cells), material handling systems, radioactive material processing systems, equipment integration and installation, shielded facilities, and preparation of fabrication drawings, specifications, datasheets and calculations. The successful candidate will delegate work to other engineers and designers, and will check their work on projects. The successful candidate will provide technical direction, guidance, delegation, and technical planning for projects. Additionally, the candidate will assist and develop design criteria, manages work scope, schedule and budgets. The Senior Project Engineer is expected to assist with staff planning and reviews.


Scope/Key Responsibilities

· Lead multi-disciplinary teams of engineers and designers.

· Serve as Engineer of Record on mechanical designs.

· Follow regimented quality assurance / quality control procedures.

· Detailed design activities include preparation of fabrication drawing packages, equipment datasheets, fabrication specifications, procurement specifications, engineering studies, test plans, and detailed equipment sizing & qualification calculations.

· Responsibilities include planning, conducting and coordinating detailed phases of design work; presenting design reviews to clients; and providing shop support during fabrication and testing.

· Promote professional development amongst the team members.


Required Experience

· Minimum of eighteen (18) years of experience for either (or combination) NRC, DOE or DoD projects.

· Familiarity with ASME NQA-1 quality assurance programs.

· Demonstrated experience with leading mechanical engineering teams within a complex multi discipline team is essential.

· Familiarity with 3D design software Pro/E (highly desirable).

· Experience with prototyping, supplier support, factory testing and field startup desirable.

· Familiarity with MS Project or Primavera Sur-Trak a plus.

· Bachelor of Sciences degree required.

· Client projects for this position:

o Require sole U.S. Citizenship

o Prohibit Dual Citizenship

· Must have the ability to acquire a security clearance.

· PE license required.

· Candidate will be expected to have or obtain a PE license in various states.

· Local Candidate preferred.


Physical Requirements

· The job requires the ability to sit for extended periods at a computer workstation.

· The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

· Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Work Environment

This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as but not limited to: computers, phones, copiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.


Additional information

Apply on line only. No e-mail, hard copy or third party resumes accepted.


Merrick offers a competitive compensation and benefits package which includes; health insurance, dental and vision coverage, 401(k), unique work-life benefits, continuing education and training through the Merrick Learning Institute.


Merrick & Company is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by law.

AECOM Technical Services (TS) is seeking a Consulting Engineer III to be based in our Greenwood Village, CO location.

Consulting Engineer must have in-depth knowledge of Staad.PRO modeling, analysis, and post processing.

Prepares, reviews and approves drawings as required.

In-depth knowledge of AISC Seismic Design Provisions.

job summary:
Do you have a passion for Talent and to drive the recruiting craft to the next level? How about building sourcing strategies that will find the talent that will design the next iteration of the Orion Spacecraft? The Senior Manager of Talent Acquisition role epitomizes this opportunity.


At Lockheed Martin’s Space Systems Company (SSC), we do difficult. In other words, we love designing and building stuff and sending it into space…and yes, someday to Mars. We also like thinking beyond today and we want our Talent Acquisition Leaders to think the same. We also want our Leaders to apply best practices, but also drive and influence change. This newly created opportunity can be summarized in this way:


• Be a part of a company that is being recognized as Americas Most Attractive Employers for Business, Engineering and Computer Science, as well as one of the Top 25 Employer Brands by Simply Hired

• Opportunity to take the Talent Acquisition function within Space Systems to a more progressive level and be able to understand: where our best candidates come from, what are the root causes of time-to-fill, the latest best practices that we can leverage to find, attract and select the right talent

• Build and shape the team of Recruiters, Sourcers and Coordinators that meet the needs of the business

• Access to expertise within workforce intelligence, marketing and data analysis

• Mentor workforce of TA practitioners and leaders to help transform our culture to be partners with the business


Reporting to the Director of Global Talent Acquisition, this role will lead a geographically dispersed team of 18 consisting of 1 TA Manager, 10-12 recruiters, 3 sourcers and 2 recruiting coordinators with responsibility for filling over 1200 positions, as well as driving sourcing strategies to proactively fill critical skill pipelines.


First Year Objectives:


• Execute the experienced professional hiring plan in Engineering for 2017 (over 1200 hires)

• Partner with Marketing to develop and deliver strategic sourcing & marketing plans for critical Engineering talent segments (RF Engineers, Optical Engineers SW Developers, Nuclear Systems Engineers)

• Develop reporting and insights into the root causes of req aging, time-to-fill

• Organize and align the team to meet business demand and drive optimization

• Drive continuous improve in time-to-fill, hiring manager satisfaction and candidate satisfaction

• Assist with the development of a Recruiter and Sourcer Scorecard


Other Focus Areas & Responsibilities:


• Lead the executing on the tactical hiring plan that supports the Engineering and Technology function including position scoping, marketing, screening/selection, interviews, offer negotiations and on-boarding

• Collaborate with business partners and stakeholders to advise on programs in order to develop sourcing plans, options, allocate resources, manage costs, etc.

• Explore the market trends and best practices in attracting external technology talent and implement appropriate best practices

• Present regular reports to keep management informed of program status and related issues (i.e. requisition aging, time-to-fill, candidate quality and sourcing effectiveness)

• Effectively build and execute action plans based on manager and candidate satisfaction survey results

• Monitor and track business objectives, validate recruitment strategies, and develop business specific strategies when the need arises

• Manage the quality, productivity and compliance with internal policies, EEO/diversity policies, as well as, federal and state employment and labor laws

• Proactively monitor and track business objectives, validate recruitment strategies, and develop business specific strategies when the need arises

• Serve as the organization liaison for enterprise-wide committees, working groups, and projects

• Provide leadership to a professional team of Recruiters, Sourcers and Coordinators and motivate them to drive results to the highest level


Basic Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 10 years recruitment and/or human resources experience. Equivalent combination of education and experience will also be considered.

• Minimum 2 years of experience managing a recruitment operation and/or team of recruiters and/or HR professionals

• Demonstrated competence managing recruiting results in a deadline driven, high req volume environment.

• Experience analyzing and reporting on recruiting metrics

• Proficient with Microsoft Office and electronic applicant tracking systems (ATS)

• Demonstrated Experience managing a recruitment budget

• Knowledge of Department of Labor compliance related to nondiscrimination/ affirmative action laws and regulations


Desired skills

• Demonstrated track record of developing and implementing successful, creative, and forward thinking recruitment strategies (includes the ability to deliver diversity strategies and sourcing)

• Passion for the latest recruitment technology and talent marketing best practices

• International recruiting

• Previous experience in a large service focused organization

• Knowledge of aerospace and defense organizational structure, services and benefits

• PMI or PMP certification

• Proven ability to persuade and influence management and key decision makers on the direction of the organization.

• Talent management skills in terms of: hiring the right talent with positive impact to the team, ability to organize and integrate a geographically dispersed team, and develop high performers and be a supplier of talent to the HR organization

• Leadership skills in terms of: delivering results through others, energizing employees to perform effectively as a team, envision the future state and set appropriate direction

• Proven communication skills which include the ability to speak, write and listen in a manner that clarifies issues, promotes closure, and delivers information in a clear and concise manner and facilitates decision making.

• Demonstrated strong business acumen and analytical skills.

• A strong commitment to top-level customer service

• Results oriented team player, yet able to work independently of direct supervision


As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.


Join us at Lockheed Martin, where we’re engineering a better tomorrow.


Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

job summary:
We are currently looking for a high frequency electromagnetics engineer to join our team.


The position would focus on high frequency electromagnetics analysis using ANSYS HFSS, SIWave, and Simplorer with a range of applications (e.g. antennas, RF and microwave, signal integrity...). The engineer would also be expected to learn low frequency analysis (electric machines, actuators, sensors, wireless transfer) and system level modeling with ANSYS Simplorer. Depending on the skills and interest of the engineer, the role could also involve thermal coupled multiphysics models with FEA or CFD tools.


About us:


We are a major supplier of the ANSYS family of products to leading companies in the USA and Canada. Our customers rely on us to help them become more productive, improve their engineering processes, and help them thrive in today's competitive market. We have become a valued partner and a key member of their engineering teams.


We are an exciting group and are a growing simulation technology company with employees located in 10 strategic locations around the country. 
We are committed to the success of our customers. We work hand-in-hand with them to increase their simulation productivity and fidelity, enabling the development of advanced products and/or manufacturing processes


Culture and Management Philosophy


We are not only a equal opportunity employer offering a stimulating and challenging environment, but likely the most interesting place that you will ever work. This allows each person to exploit his/her full potential and push the limits of their expertise. We also encourage our employees to develop their competencies and the recognition of such is part of the DNA of the company. Each member of our staff is a simulation expert who also maintains an expertise in one or more specialized fields. Our engineers have advanced engineering degrees with a number of years experience in the engineering consulting business. We maintain a high level of professionalism in a friendly, cooperative environment. Our company aspires to be recognized as an outstanding employer.


Though we consider ourselves a 'Sales' organization, our technical team comprises over half of our staff, with a significant number of them having advanced engineering degrees. We are involved in almost every industry ranging from mining to oil & gas, from automotive to aerospace, from electronics to nuclear, from marine to medical... We place a strong value on our staff. The more they develop, the more they can work with our customers. We have grown our organization by making our customers successful.


Position Profile


The engineer provides technical and sales support along with performing training and consulting projects. The role involves sharing enthusiasm for ANSYS simulation tools to existing or potential customers. The engineer will provide technical expertise to the account manager and the customers to assess analysis needs related to development, design, and problem solving with ANSYS software to develop the market and to provide high quality customer service. The engineer will also be responsible for completing challenging consulting projects and keeping up with the latest simulation technology. The mix of different tasks and wide variety of applications makes for a work environment that is never boring.


Education:


Bachelor in electrical engineering or equivalent 
Master or Ph.D. in electrical engineering or equivalent is considered a plus


Professional Experience


Three (or more) years experience in applied electrical engineering simulation or in research with a strong focus on ANSYS HFSS 
Experience with multiple applications including analysis of antennas, EMI/EMC, and signal integrity is ideal 
Solid theoretical background in high frequency electromagnetic fields, circuits, and numerical methods


US/Canadian Citizenship or Permanent Residents preferred


Other advantageous experience includes:


Design/analysis of low frequency electronics (e.g. electric machines, transformers, solenoids...) 
System level modeling expertise (Simplorer or similar) 
Interest in thermal simulation in CFD or FEA (CFX, Fluent, Icepak, ANSYS) 
Interest in multiphysics (e.g. electromagnetic, structural, thermal, fluids, acoustics...) 
Ability to use 3-D CAD to build or simplify modelsOptimization and DOE methods 
Basic scripting/programming skills in any of the following: J-script, Python, C#, VB, .Net, C++ 
Familiarity with computers and operating systems


Abilities & Competencies


Excellent ability to communicate (both written & verbal) is essential 
Strong interpersonal skills 
Able to learn and incorporate theoretical, technical, and practical concepts quickly 
Capable to analyze problems and propose practical solutions 
Strong work ethic 
Creativity and flexibility 
Meticulous and detail oriented 
Capability to multi-task 
Capable of working in a team or individual environment 
Self starter 
Dislikes repetition


Responsibilities


Performs numerical simulations for consulting projects in a wide range of applications 
Visit customers to assess technical needs & communicate with the sales team 
Propose technical solutions to customers 
Demonstrate to customers/prospects the capability of the software 
Present technical seminars over web and in person 
Solve technical support requests related to simulation software usage 
Conceive custom applications related to the customer activity 
Write analysis reports and other technical documents 
Prepare and deliver training on ANSYS tools 
Minimal travel will be required with the majority of it in the local office region. Occasional short travel to further locations may occur.


If you are selected to join us, you will become a key member of our technical staff and will work and learn in a challenging technical environment. Success will be measured not only by helping to grow our simulation business, but also by continued development of your own technical skills by solving challenging problems in a wide variety of industries.


Location: Denver, CO or Seattle, WA

job summary:
Structural Engineer III


CO-GWV-16-182


Introduction

Merrick & Company is seeking an experience Structural Engineer to join a team working on a challenging, innovative project with the nuclear industry. The work will include creating comprehensive calculation analyses and documents supported by detailed finite element analysis, seismic analysis, and a combination of stainless steel framing member design, plate and shell design, and connection design following Department of Energy (DOE) design standards, codes, and quality procedures.


Job Description

The Structural Engineer III provides the structural design of equipment and facility structures for the DOE using DOE standards and codes.


Duties

· Work independently to evaluate, select and apply standard techniques, procedures, and criteria to perform engineering design tasks or sequences of tasks on projects

· Collaboratively use judgment to determine adaptations in methods for non-routine aspects of assignments

· Plan and coordinate detailed aspects of the engineering work including preparing scope, budgets, and schedules

· Assign tasks to and coordinate work with engineers and designers

· Read and understand engineering requirements for designs integrating multiple systems and codes

· Generate technical reports, calculations, or other similar documents detailing purpose, methodology, results, conclusions, and recommendations pertaining to the addressed engineering problem.

· Use experience to establish efficiencies

· Stay within established schedule as outlined by a lead engineer, and coordinate with other disciplines as directed by the lead engineer.

· Review and check the work of other engineers to determine accuracy and completeness

· Assist in training and mentoring entry level engineers


Required Experience

· Client projects for this position require US Citizenship.

· Bachelor’s degree (B. S.) in Civil/Structural or Architectural/Structural Engineering from an A.B.E.T. accredited program is required

· Candidate must be a licensed Professional Engineer (P.E.)

· Minimum of eight (8) years related experience is required

· Experience with current building codes and steel design is required

· Experience with seismic equivalent static analysis of structures is required

· Knowledge of finite analysis software such as RISA 3D, STAAD Pro, ANSYS or GTStrudl is required.

· Proficiency in engineering calculation software such as MathCAD is required.

· Proficiency in Microsoft Office software is required.


Preferred Experience

· Experience with nuclear design codes such as AISC N690, ASME NUM-1, and ASME NOG-1 is preferred.

· Experience with nuclear seismic design codes such as ASCE 4 and ASCE 43 is preferred.

· Experience with seismic dynamic analysis of structures is preferred.

· Experience with performing work under a quality assurance program such as ASME NQA-1 is preferred.

· Experience with writing technical reports, calculations, and other similar documents are preferred.

· Experience in the design of DOE facilities and equipment is preferred.

· Experience with the design of mechanical equipment and material handling systems is preferred.

· Experience with stainless steel design or cold formed steel design is preferred.

· Experience with process piping design is preferred.

· Local candidates preferred.


Physical Requirements

· The job requires the ability to sit for extended periods at a computer workstation.

· The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

· Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Work Environment

This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as but not limited to: computers, phones, copiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.


Additional information

Apply on line only. No e-mail, hard copy or third party resumes accepted.


Merrick & Company offers a competitive compensation and benefits package which includes; health insurance, dental and vision coverage, 401(k), unique work-life benefits, continuing education and training through the Merrick Learning Institute.


We recognizes the importance of developing top talent from within, our employees have access to a wide range of internal and external training and coaching programs and are rewarded for their achievements through excellent benefits and competitive salaries.


Merrick & Company is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by law.


We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.
