job summary:
Job Descriptions:
Global Patent Solutions, LLC (GPS) is an intellectual property research and consulting firm founded to meet the demanding needs of Inventors and IP professionals around the world for high-quality patent research and consulting. From our headquarters in Scottsdale, AZ, we currently service a global client-base of IP Attorneys, Patent Agents, Business Leaders, R&D; Teams, Universities, Entrepreneurs and Inventors.
This is not your ordinary, run-of-the-mill research position. Each project is unique and possesses a new challenge for you to tackle. You must be able to assess and analyze the best way to approach a project. Previous patent knowledge is great; however, it is not required. We are willing and able to train.
The Research Analyst primarily will perform research of invention concepts related to the technologies listed above using a variety of databases and compile formal search reports to demonstrate findings to clients. A majority of work requires in-depth reading, writing and working on computers.

The position entails:
Quickly reviewing and gaining an understanding of technical aspects of client inventions and/or technical search concepts
Creating research strategies to best utilize time and resources
Performing extensive database research
Reviewing, gathering and analyzing technical literature
Reporting research findings in a timely and high-quality manner
We are a growing company located in Scottsdale, Arizona (Position Location: Scottsdale, AZ). We are primarily interested in hiring full-time positions in our Scottsdale office. It is possible, though not preferred, that unique circumstances would lead us to also consider an employee working remotely: this position, however, must be filled within the U.S.
If you can manage yourself, as micro-managing is not our style, and you are motivated to get results in a timely manner, this could be a great opportunity for you to learn and grow with a quality-driven company.

This position requires you to:
Meet and exceed client needs and deadlines by providing viable research solutions.
Quickly, continuously and concisely Learn, Interpret, Comprehend, Retain and Apply technical abilities. Enjoy an ongoing learning and computer-based environment that is dedicated to quality.
Thrive in ambiguity and to self manage, prioritize and take pride in your work.
Proactively, confidently and effectively communicate with internal team members and external clients.
Actively participate as a team member to best serve clients and the team.
You will mostly work on your own, but we do have a wonderful, supporting staff that requires some teamwork on occasion. We are looking for an efficient and flexible team player who likes to have fun too!

Required Experience:
Previous patent examining or patent searching experience preferred, but not required.
BS required. MS or PHD in Engineering preferred.
However, candidates applying for this position MUST have previous experience or extensive knowledge in at least one of the following technical areas:
Measuring and Testing, Radiation, Optics, Semiconductors, Nanodevices, Music, Nuclear Engineering, High Temperature Superconductors.
Electrical: Control Systems, Electrical Circuits and Components, Lighting, Power Generation, Conversion, and Distribution, Printers and Recorders
Keyword: Patent, Engineer, Engineering, Analyst, IP, Intellectual Property, Patent Examiner, Examiner, Agent, Patent Agent
From: Global Patent Solutions, LLC

Under immediate supervision, inspects construction activities to ensure compliance with project plans, approved shop/working drawings, project documents and specifications in accordance with established procedures; reporting observations orally and in writing to direct report.

Inspect construction activities in accordance with established quality procedures and evaluate compliance with project plans, specifications, shop drawings and other project related documents Prepare and submit accurate, legible, comprehensive and complete testing and/or inspection reports on a daily basis in accordance with established quality procedures Review plans, specifications, general notes and shop/working drawings for assigned activities prior to performing assigned duties Perform field tests on materials and completed work using standard methods established by AASHTO, ASTM or other agency with appropriate, properly calibrated testing equipment Solve mathematical problems requiring simple addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division and raising numbers to exponential powers. Round to the correct number of significant figures, calculate percentages, read graphs, and use simple geometric definitions and formulas The safe utilization, storage and maintenance of all documents and tools Contact assigned direct report for priorities and deadlines for assigned tasks Update of Direct Report on progress and delays on every task or assignment Safe usage and maintenance of individually assigned company vehicle and field equipment including use within company policy Carry out assigned duties in accordance with established procedures Meet directed priorities and deadlines Maintenance of certifications at the time of employment or obtained during employment Collection, preparation and transmittal of samples to laboratories

Personal computers and the use of applicable software.

Move 100 lbs.

Work under exposure to inclement weather conditions

Read and understand plans, specifications, instructions, labels, reports, etc.

Travel to project sites and maneuver over rough and uneven terrain

Prepare and maintain records, files, and reports

Maintain effective working relationships with internal and external personnel.

Use hand tools such as sledge hammers, shovels and picks

Follow verbal and written instructions

Wear personal protective equipment

Comply with all attendance requirements as noted in most current edition of Corporate Policy Manual

WORKING CONDITIONS:

Exposed to noise, dust, fumes, radiant and electrical energy

Works on ladders and scaffolding

May work protracted or irregular hours

Must pass a drug test prior to employment and will be subject to post-accident, random, and reasonable cause testing during employment.

job summary:
JENSEN HUGHES Power Services Group is looking for an Electrical Engineer
to join our Design Engineering group in either our Phoenix, AZ office. JENSEN HUGHES is a
premier nuclear safety and reliability consulting firm. We provide technical
support to a wide variety of engineering projects, which range from day-to-day
nuclear power plant operation to cutting edge research and development in all
areas related to plant safety.


This position involves analyses of power distribution systems,
recommending design changes, and creating analysis and design packages for
industrial and nuclear facilities. Typical analyses include arc flash, short
circuit, protective device coordination, power flow and stability, and
electrical component sizing evaluations.
Designs typically involve installation of new motors, MCCs, or breakers.


More senior engineers may also take on Project Management
responsibilities for larger projects. These
include client interface, schedule preparation, cost estimating, proposal
writing, and monitoring project performance.

Qualifications

BS in Electrical Engineering required
A minimum 4 years of relevant job experience with a focus in electrical design and analysis required
Experience in AutoCAD and power flow distribution software (e.g., EasyPower or ETAP) is a plus
Nuclear Power Plant or DOE/DOD experience is a plus
Good communications and writing skills are required
A PE is desired.
Individual must be physically capable of performing walk downs in plants and substations.
Periodic travel is required to validate plant configurations and typically lasts 1 or 2 weeks at a time. Total travel time is typically around 15% per year.

job summary:
The Transmission Interconnect Advisor will interface with customers requesting interconnection to the APS grid, and will lead efforts with internal stakeholders to complete interconnection studies and move interconnection requests through the process. Advisor will act in a lead capacity to draft, negotiate, and provide ongoing management for contracts related to transmission and interconnection, facility-use lease/agreements, and operating requirements for connected facilities. Advisor may also perform research and analysis to provide technical evaluation of rates, regulatory and industry issues and related policy recommendations.


Minimum Requirements:

Requires a Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Engineering, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. General knowledge of the APS transmission and distribution system, knowledge of other utility's transmission systems, rates and tariff provisions. Broad familiarity of FERC regulatory requirements and APS jurisdictional agreements. Experience in negotiating and developing transmission, interconnection and operating facility contracts. Organization, project management, communication and negotiation skills are essential. Analytical abilities to perform rate studies, regulatory analysis, and contract development.


Major Accountabilities: 

Initiate, plan, negotiate, and ensure execution of studies and contracts to meet requirements of transmission service, facility use/lease and interconnections and APS OATT. Initiate and direct studies/analysis to meet regulatory and company objectives and OATT requirements. Interpret/develop policies, procedures, prepare analyses required to administer rates, contracts and tariffs. Ensure that all FERC and NERC rules are kept current and employed correctly in contracts. Effectively interface and resolve project issues within APS, executive management and customers to meet project requirements. Represent Company in industry working groups for rates, tariffs, pricing, contracts, regulatory and operating issues. Establish and ensure completion of project schedules and goals for intra- and interdepartmental teams.


Export Compliance/EEO


This position may require access to and/or use of information subject to control under the Department of Energy's Part 810 Regulations (10 CFR Part 810), the Export Administration Regulations (EAR) (15 CFR Parts 730 through 774), or the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) (22 CFR Chapter I, Subchapter M Part 120) (collectively, "U.S. Export Control Laws"). Therefore, some positions may require applicants to be a U.S. person, which is defined as a U.S. Citizen, a U.S. Lawful Permanent Resident (i.e. 'Green Card Holder'), a Political Asylee, or a Refugee under the U.S. Export Control Laws. All applicants will be required to confirm their U.S. person or non-US person status. All information collected in this regard will only be used to ensure compliance with U.S. Export Control Laws, and will be used in full compliance with all applicable laws prohibiting discrimination on the basis of national origin and other factors. For positions at Palo Verde Nuclear Generating Stations (PVNGS) all openings will require applicants to be a U.S. person.


We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

job summary:
Arizona Public Service is seeking a Land Agent II/Land Agent Sr who will complete project assignments involving acquisitions of all private and governmental land rights necessary for construction, operations, maintenance and protection of company’s distribution, transmission and communication facilities. The Agent will prepare land documents for APS facilities, corresponding transmittal letters, write legal descriptions, complete applications for permits and submit to appropriate municipality, county and/or state/federal agency. The Agent will research various private and governmental agencies for survey and land documents including leases, ALTA surveys, plats, licenses, permits and land use agreements and ensure Federal right of way compliance.


Land Agent II Minimum Requirements:


AA degree with emphasis in real estate related disciplines and two years’ experience in right-of-way acquisitions; or a minimum of two years related Utility experience in land-related disciplines including Boundary Control and Legal Principles, and Principles of Right-of-Way Acquisition; knowledge of right-of-way acquisition practices, legal, and real estate principles and practices, and negotiation techniques.


Senior Land Agent Minimum Requirements:

BA/BS degree with emphasis in real estate related disciplines, Senior designation in IR/WA, or five years of land agent experience and 30 hours of college level real estate courses or equivalent; in-depth knowledge of right-of-way acquisition practices, survey, legal and real estate principles and practices, siting and licensing process and negotiation techniques.


Our Land Agent will also have demonstrated oral and written communication and interpersonal skills. Candidates for the position must have mathematic skills in algebra, geometry and trigonometry including a basic working knowledge in a Windows computer environment. Previous experience with survey and Boundary Control Principles, legal property descriptions, real estate law, utility engineering/specifications and CAD knowledge preferred.


Travel may be required.


Must have valid Arizona Driver's License.

job summary:
Under direction, inspects and oversees construction inspection activities to ensure compliance with project plans, approved shop/working drawings, project documents and specifications reporting observations orally and in writing to direct report. Work requires application of engineering principles.


Responsibilities:
Inspect construction activities in accordance with established quality procedures and evaluate compliance with project plans, specifications, shop drawings and other project related documents Prepare and submit accurate, legible, comprehensive and complete testing and/or inspection reports on a daily basis in accordance with established quality procedures Review plans, specifications, general notes and shop/working drawings for assigned activities prior to performing assigned duties Perform, supervise, report on frequency compliance and coordinate field tests on materials and completed work using standard methods established by AASHTO, ASTM or other agency with appropriate, properly calibrated testing equipment Perform mathematical calculations using basic algebra (fundamental laws, algebraic expressions), geometry, and the trigonometric functions of right triangles Train less experience workers on work methods Serve as lead worker for less experienced workers Assist Direct Report in planning and coordinating inspection operation Meets with contractor's supervisors or other project leaders on assigned project sites to discuss and coordinate testing, sampling, or inspection of construction materials or construction procedures Assigns work priority tasks to assigned inspector(s) Review material tests and completed work performed by assigned inspectors to assure compliance with requirements of established procedures. Verify adequacy of number of samples and locations at which samples are collected to assure representative distribution of sampling and testing Provides input in evaluations of employee performance The safe utilization, storage and maintenance of all documents and tools Contact assigned direct report for priorities and deadlines for assigned tasks. Update of Direct Report on progress and delays on every task or assignment Safe usage and maintenance of individually assigned company vehicle and field equipment including use within company policy Carry out assigned duties in accordance with established procedures Meet directed priorities and deadlines Maintenance of certifications at the time of employment or obtained during employment Collection, preparation and transmittal of samples to laboratories

Qualifications:
Graduation from high school or GED certification. A person in this position generally, but not necessarily has a minimum of 15 years experience in roadway, and related facilities, construction inspection or NICET Level IV certification in Transportation Engineering Technology (Highway Construction). Related experience and/or education may be evaluated to substitute for on the job experience

Shall possess a valid driver’s license within the applicable jurisdiction and meet firm’s auto insurability requirements

The following certifications and training are preferred:

Completion of Troxler Manufacturing or equal radiation safety course to utilize nuclear gauges

Completion of State specific Technician Training and Certification Program (TTCP) for applicable testing/sampling procedures, or ability to complete within 6 months of employment

ACI Field Testing Technician Level 1

Successful applicants without the above certifications or training may be required to pursue successful attainment of the certifications. Related experience may be substituted with the approval of the client.


Thorough knowledge of:

Highway construction plans, construction inspection procedures, and specifications


Materials used in highway construction


Material testing procedures


Considerable knowledge of:

The State specific Manual of Uniform Traffic Control Devices or National Manual of Uniform Traffic Control Devices approved by the Federal Highway Administrator as the National Standard

Working knowledge of:

Construction project document auditing techniques Personal computers and the use of applicable software Algebra, geometry, and trigonometry
Ability to:

Communicate effectively orally and in writing to communicate problems, status of work, daily reports, etc.

Lift 60 lbs.

Move 100 lbs.

Work under exposure to inclement weather conditions

Read and understand plans, specifications, instructions, labels, reports, etc.

Travel to project sites and maneuver over rough and uneven terrain

Prepare and maintain records, files, and reports

Maintain effective working relationships with internal and external personnel

Use hand tools such as sledgehammers, shovels and picks

Follow verbal and written instructions

Analyze, problem solve, and recommend solutions

Plan and coordinate work activities, oversee programs, interpret engineering plans, and instruct

Required to:

Present a professional appearance to best represent the firm

Wear personal protective equipment

Comply with all attendance requirements as noted in most current edition of Corporate Policy Manual

Skill in:

Proficiently performing tests on materials in the field to determine acceptability.

WORKING CONDITIONS:

Works outside and is subject to weather conditions

Potential exposure to equipment movement hazards and dangerous chemical/solvents if proper safety procedures are not followed

Exposed to noise, dust, fumes, radiant and electrical energy

Works on ladders and scaffolding

May work protracted or irregular hours

Flexibility to work irregular hours due to client needs (i.e. other than 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. and/or other than Monday through Friday.)

Work related responsibilities require travel out of town to RABA KISTNER offices, client offices, and project locations

Must pass a drug test prior to employment and will be subject to post-accident, random, and reasonable cause testing during employment.


Raba Kistner supports a diverse workforce and is an Equal Opportunity Employer who does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, gender, color, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or other classification protected by law. Drug Free Workplace. Females and minorities are encouraged to apply.

job summary:
Job Description

Particle Beam Therapy Site Manager


Site Manager will be responsible for managing the contracted on-site service activities related to maintaining required safety standards, reliability, and availability. He/she will take the lead on necessary customer communications; including commercial discussions, management support and engineering interface. He/she will also be responsible for supervising the subcontractors with the goal of ensuring a successful service program.


Responsibilities:

Manage contracted on-site service activities, including: start-up operations, shut down operations, preventive maintenance, corrective maintenance, equipment testing (including calibration and software testing), equipment troubleshooting and related software activities.


Maintain overall responsibility with Regulatory Assurance Quality Assurance Planning Manager for the following program areas: customer contract compliance, budget control, subcontractor contract administration, operations & maintenance schedule, technical compliance, quality assurance, configuration control, spare part management, document control, program communications.


Coordinate recovery operations following off-normal events.

Develop a complete working knowledge of the Proton Beam Therapy System (PBTS), particularly system level knowledge.

Qualifications


Bachelors degree in Engineering or a related discipline (Electrical, Mechanical, Nuclear, etc.).

A minimum of 5 years of experience as a Site Manager or equivalent is required. Experience should include:

o Personnel supervision

o Maintenance and operations experience preferred

o Experience in a Radiation facility is preferred

o Quality assurance and/or regulatory environment preferred

o Service program start-up or similar programmatic experience; particularly material management systems, service management systems, ERP systems, or work flow programs; etc.; contract management systems, including billing and payables; scheduling and staffing programs; etc.

o Technical program management or similar programmatic experience; including calibration or testing program development, start-up and shut down operations, preventive maintenance baselines, corrective maintenance procedure development, etc.


Ability to converse in Japanese is required due to the technical interface of the system and close interactions with the engineering department in Japan.


Experis is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE/AA)

job summary:
Konecranes is a global leader in the manufacturing and service of industrial overhead cranes and lifting equipment. For over 80 years, we've been dedicated to improving safety and productivity of businesses in all types of industries, including manufacturing and process industries, nuclear and renewable energy, shipyards, ports and terminals. Our strength comes from our continuous commitment to provide equipment and service that people can trust, accompanied by innovative technologies designed to improve performance, reliability and safety in every part of business operations that involve heavy lifting. We look to hire customer-oriented people who thrive on learning and problem solving in a fast paced environment. In return, we offer a good salary with highly competitive benefits including medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with a generous company match and tenure-based contributions, tuition reimbursement, life & disability insurance, vacation and other leave programs and opportunities for both formal and on the job training.

Our People and Commitment

Our people are not only committed to helping our customers lift their businesses, but each other as well. Establishing meaningful relationships and collaborating with each other, with customers, and with our distributors, empowers our employees to achieve success. The passion our employees have to make a difference and enhance the quality of the lives of those around them is what makes our people unique.

Share Your Knowledge and Experience

From electricians to machinists to mechanics to facilities maintenance, we're looking for skilled tradespeople to collaborate with our customers. We rely on their judgment and know-how to keep our customers' manufacturing lines running smoothly to reduce downtime and improve productivity and safety.

We Value Your Special Set of Skills

If you have experience working as an industrial maintenance mechanic or electrician or experience troubleshooting three phase electrical equipment, motors and control centers, and VFDs, you can rise to the top at Konecranes. We value your know-how and your ideas. If you have a trade, we need your special set of skills to help keep our customers' equipment running.

Join Konecranes and lift up our customers through your energy for solutions and your passion for service. What heights can you rise to by joining Konecranes?

Job Description

The Crane Maintenance team is seeking a self-driven Multi-Craft Technician to provide scheduled and on-call support at our customer sites. This Technician will start out maintaining and troubleshooting overhead cranes and associated equipment at various customer sites to establish an in depth understanding of overhead cranes and our service organization. The Technician will have the opportunity to contribute to our customer's equipment reliability, productivity and safety. As a Technician you will work hands on and use critical thinking to solve customer issues. Technicians typically work from a ladder or lift on equipment at heights of 40 to 60 feet. A candidate for this opportunity must be flexible, communicate openly and clearly, and be able to work within a team environment at all times.

The ideal candidate will:

Be passionate about providing overhead crane maintenance support for our customers' facilities.
Be energized by working for a world-class service organization and collaborating with customers.
Recognize the importance of building and maintaining strong interpersonal relationships.

Requirements:

Bachelors Degree in Electrical Engineering
At least one year of experience in an industrial maintenance environment or equivalent military experience
Experience troubleshooting 480vac 3 phase motor control systems
Valid driver's license and a driving record that meets company standards
Ability to provide written and/or electronic reports and verbally communicate with customers
Ability to work at heights greater than six feet off of the ground
Ability to work varied hours, overtime and/or "on call" as needed
This position requires standing, walking, sitting, lifting, carrying, pushing/pulling, balancing, kneeling and crawling

Preferred:

At least one year of experience of electrical/mechanical troubleshooting and repair
Prior experience with cranes

Konecranes is a global leader in the manufacturing and service of industrial overhead cranes and lifting equipment. For over 80 years, we've been dedicated to improving safety and productivity of businesses in all types of industries, including manufacturing and process industries, nuclear and renewable energy, shipyards, ports and terminals. Our strength comes from our continuous commitment to provide equipment and service that people can trust, accompanied by innovative technologies designed to improve performance, reliability and safety in every part of business operations that involve heavy lifting. We look to hire customer-oriented people who thrive on learning and problem solving in a fast paced environment. In return, we offer a good salary with highlycompetitive benefits including medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with a generous company match and tenure-based contributions, tuition reimbursement, life & disability insurance, vacation and other leave programs and opportunities for both formal and on the job training.

Our People and Commitment

Our people are not only committed to helping our customers lift their businesses, but each other as well. Establishing meaningful relationships and collaborating with each other, with customers, and with our distributors, empowers our employees to achieve success. The passion our employees have to make a difference and enhance the quality of the lives of those around them is what makes our people unique.

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled/Other Protected Category

job summary:
Energize your career with Westinghouse Electric Company! Our commitment to safe, clean nuclear energy is second to none, and we’re proud of our rich heritage of technical innovation and commitment to our global customers’ success. If you are interested in being a part of a company that values exceeding customer expectations and providing future generations around the globe with emission-free energy, we want to hear from you.


At Westinghouse, we are solely focused on nuclear energy technology. Our goal is simple-- to provide solutions to our customers to keep their plants safe, reliable and efficient. Helping our customers support the needs of their customers is why we are committed to quality, safety, and innovation at every turn.


We currently have an exciting opportunity for a New Graduate - Nuclear Engineer. If you are interested in being a part of a company that values exceeding customer expectations and providing future generations around the globe with emission-free energy, we want to hear from you.


** Please note that by submitting to this position, your application will be considered for all New Graduate - Nuclear Engineering opportunities at each Westinghouse location. **

* Perform routine engineering design evaluations and analyses with specific guidance.

* Prepare appropriate documentation supporting evaluations and analyses with specific guidance.

* Verify routine design evaluations and analyses performed by others, as qualified.

* Interface with customers, vendors and other internal functional groups on engineering level to obtain information

necessary to perform assignments.

* Identify and recommend improvements in processes on continuing basis and assist in implementation.


** December 2016 graduates ** May 2016 graduates


EOE of Minorities/Females/Vets/Disability

Bachelor's or Master's degree in an Nuclear Engineering discipline required.
Minimum GPA of 3.0 strongly preferred.
0 - 3 years of applicable engineering experience
US Citizen or Permanent Resident required.
Proficiency in Technical Writing

job summary:
You will have the opportunity to work in a project team environment with other engineers and designers involved in the design, modification, and analysis of new and existing nuclear power plant electrical systems and:


- Work on challenging assignments that include investigating, trouble-shooting, and solving a wide variety of electrical engineering issues.


- Act as electrical lead in the coordination of detailed design phases for all aspects of electrical engineering work.


- Lead efforts to ensure projects are completed satisfactorily, on time, and within budget.


- Prepare and review detailed calculations, including three phase power studies, short circuit, voltage drop, motor starting and protective relay settings.


- Prepare documentation for design input for drawing production, including master diagrams and master schematics.


- Prepare reports and studies that present technical information in a clear and concise manner and meet client requirements.


- Perform independent reviews of work performed by others including calculations and drawing preparation.


- Interface with vendors to prepare matrials and equipment purchase specifications for client recommendations.


- Develop project work plans.


- Enhance your career via peer-learning through sharing of knowledge with other experienced engineers in a variety of professional activities.


- Provide guidance as a mentor in the development of less experienced engineers.


INDEEDSL


Qualifications
BSEE or MSEE and:


- Ten or more years experience in the design of electrical engineering systems in a project team environment with a focus on integrated, detailed system design for new plants, or modifications or replacements for existing plants.


- Nuclear power project experience is required.


- Experience must include the selection of equipment, materials, control philosophy, and the preparation and assembling of calculations and specifications. Experience is required with electrical system design including medium and low voltage distribution systems (transformers, generators, motors), communication systems, equipment selection, and analytical calculations.


- Experience with serving as firm/client liaison.


- Experience in reviewing design drawings created by others.


- Effective written and verbal communication skills.


- Detail oriented approach to work.


- PE license preferred.


US citizenship or US permanent resident status is required.

Travel 40-60% of time to both domestic and international sites.

We currently have an exciting opportunity for a GPEx (Global Project Excellence) Advanced Project Manager (APM) in the United States Project Management Organization (US PMO) within the US Operations Projects Group of the Operating Plant Business Unit. In this position, a GPEx APM can expect to be responsible for the following:

Responsible for all project management processes on moderate complexity projects, a portfolio of lower complexity projects or a portion (for example, work package) of a high complexity project/program. Lead medium-sized team (average 10–30 team members), which may include project controls and sub-project managers. Support proposal process for moderate complexity projects, as assigned. May be assigned overall Project Manager responsibility of a high complexity project in a deputy capacity (with direct guidance of a Program Manager or higher).
Oversee the development of cost estimates and offers for operating plants support and modifications. Support and/or drive customer negotiations.
Complete all aspects of planning process including authoring project management plans and developing scope, schedule, and cost baselines as well as, risk and stakeholder registers per the Westinghouse Global Project Excellence Procedure (GPEP).
Based on project management plan, follow department protocols for acquiring team members as needed to complete the work. Manage and integrate all aspects of project including scope, schedule, cost, risk, procurement, quality, resources, communications, and stakeholders. Interpret and transmit project/contract requirements, and subsequent changes, to functional groups following an integrated change management process.
Coordinate project communications ensuring team, customer, and all stakeholders are kept informed of status. Develop or oversee project records in standard databases, systems, and procedures to ensure efficient handling and transmission of project correspondence and documentation internally and externally.
Properly close project by archiving work in financial, scheduling, document management, and resource management systems/tools. Perform final project quality assessment and report out. Identify and communicate opportunities for improvement, lessons, and risk avoidance for future work.
Use interpersonal skills to cultivate positive relationships with team, customer, and other stakeholders (e.g., internal management) in a matrix environment to facilitate successful project completion as well as identify opportunities for additional business growth.
Identify, assess, and implement improvement or recovery opportunities that will promote successful project delivery.
The successful candidate will be highly motivated, willing to take ownership of challenges, and customer focused.
EOE of Minorities/Females/Vets/Disability


Job Requirements

The successful candidate for this position will possess the following:

Bachelor’s degree in Project Management, Engineering, Business, Construction Management, or related technical discipline required. Advanced degree in Project Management, Engineering, Construction or Business preferred.
Minimum 8 years of experience with at least 5 years as project manager leading and directing low to moderate complexity projects to successful completion (3 years in technical/engineering role and 2 years as project manager may be considered as equivalent); 6 -10 years of experience as project manager in a technical industry such as engineering, manufacturing, nuclear or construction is preferred.
Familiar with the Project Management Institute (PMI®)’s Project Management Body of Knowledge required. PMI Project Management Professional (PMP®) certification or other approved equivalent project management certification is required.
Westinghouse Project Manager qualification completed. For external candidate, will complete project manager qualification within designated time period. Exemptions provided based on prior training and work experience.
Strong interpersonal skills, such as effective verbal and written communications; ability to lead team members; ability to develop relationships with internal and external stakeholders; and ability to make decisions and carry out multiple tasks as assigned, with minimal guidance from supervisory Project Managers and mentors.
Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft® Office tools. Knowledge and skill of project scheduling and cost management.
Demonstrated ability or understanding of the transformation of data to information for visual reports; database concepts in order to manage data within systems; the interaction of company functions that are touch points to projects (Finance, Legal, Quality, Supply Chain, etc.). High-quality presentation skills.

job summary:
- This position will offer you the ability to directly apply your knowledge of materials, structural analysis, structural steel design, and reinforced concrete design. As a member of an engineering and design team, you will work on a wide range of power plant modifications and upgrades to support client recommendations and reviews including creating calculations, document designs, and specifications. Additionally, you will be conducting structural analyses, which include complex loading conditions such as wind, seismic, blast, and pressurization.

- Under the direction of the Structural Project Lead, you will be responsible for guiding junior-level engineers and designers in structural engineering design efforts, including providing guidance with the coordination of detailed design phases for all aspects of structural engineering work.

- You will work on challenging assignments that include investigating, trouble-shooting, and solving a wide variety of structural engineering issues.

- Using our state-of-the-art computer tools, you will perform structural analysis and design of steel frames, connections, concrete members, equipment and piping supports, and foundations.

- Develop integrated structural designs and perform supporting calculations for the planned work.

- Prepare technical specifications for structural materials.

- Prepare engineering studies.

- Perform independent reviews of work performed by others including calculations and drawing preparation.

- Coordinate and provide guidance to other engineers, project managers, client personnel, and suppliers to ensure a complete and timely design.

- Perform reviews of existing facilities to propose upgrades and replacements, and present findings and recommendations to clients and peers.

- Develop your career via peer-learning through sharing of knowledge with other experienced engineers by way of S&L;’s systems of process and associated “Communities of Practice.”

- Provide guidance as a mentor in the development of less experienced engineers.

- There is the potential for you to travel to client and vendor offices for design reviews and to plant site locations for construction coordination and field verification of designs.


Qualifications
Essential skills and experience:

- This position requires a BSCE (MSCE preferred) from an ABET Engineering Accreditation Commission-approved program.

- Six or more years of working as a member of a project team environment in the design of non-commercial, heavy industrial plants, with a focus on the analysis of steel structures and concrete foundations and supports for new plants, or modifications or replacements for existing plants. Experience must include the selection of structural materials and the review and preparation of specifications.

- Experience in writing and providing support documentation for Structural Engineering calculations.

- Technically knowledgeable of the practical application of structural engineering including analysis for structural supports, loads, and design integrity.

- Experience with the design techniques, tools, and principles involved in the production of technical plans, blueprints, drawings, and models for industrial plants.

- Proficiency with any of the following programs: MathCad, STAAD PRO, SAP2000, SAFE, STRUDL, or ANSYS.

- Familiarity with design codes and standards such as IBC, ASCE 7, AISC, and ACI 318.

- Proficiency with MS Office applications.

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills.


Valued but not required skills and experience:

- Construction and start-up experience a plus.

- Commissioning experience a plus.

- PE license preferred.

JMT, currently ranked #67 on Engineering News-Record’s list of the Top 500 Design Firms.


JMT is seeking qualified, experienced and highly motivated individuals to assist in coordinating and overseeing PennDOT or PA Turnpike roadway, structure and bridge, and maintenance construction projects. The successful candidate will promote open communications, partner with and respond to project/senior level construction management to obtain on-time, on-budget projects with high quality and safety.


Working Conditions:


Work is performed in the field. Ability to extensively perform bending, kneeling, standing, shoveling, and lifting and carrying objects weighing up to 25 lbs as needed. Work may be conducted outside in heat/cold, wet/humid, and dry/arid conditions.


Job Competencies:

Attention-to-detail
Job Proficiency
Dependability

Organizational Competencies:

Building Relationships & Teamwork
Integrity & Ethics
Quality Service
Safety
Required Skills
Independently plan, coordinate, inspect and/or oversee day-to day project inspection activities to ensure contractor compliance through review, interpretation and enforcement of plans, contract documents, specifications and standards. Ensure proper documentation and payment of all contract work.
Assign, schedule and maintain subordinate inspection staff throughout all phases of the project. Provide direction and oversight to inspection staff and work with the owner to determine appropriate staff needs and monitor performance of the staff.
Review and maintain all pertinent project documentation and ensure that it accurately details construction progress, activities and materials, meets environmental permitting conditions, comply with safety policies and programs, and monitors EEO and DBE progress and performance.
Prepare, review and submit project inspection reports, work authorizations, work orders and estimates. Notify contractor of non-compliance and corrective action.
Review, analyze and evaluate contractor schedules.
Attend pre-bid, pre-construction and/or management level meetings throughout the course of the project, assist the client with issuance of project correspondences, claim defense, and provide updates to the client construction progress and issues.
Interact with the general public, government agencies, contractors, sub-contractors, and other internal and external parties to respond to inquiries and resolve field issues.
Work schedule varies according to project assignments, contract restrictions, and/or contractors’ schedule, to include night work, weekends and holidays.


Required Experience
Minimum of 5 years Inspector experience
High school diploma or GED with additional course work or training in road/bridge construction, civil engineering, project management, materials or an equivalent combination of education, experience, and training demonstrating the ability to perform job duties.
Thorough knowledge and considerable experience in maintenance & protection of traffic, earthwork, roadway, structure and bridge, and/or maintenance construction techniques, plans reading, procedures, methods, equipment and materials.
Road and Structure Specifications and Standards; state and federal labor regulations, MUTCD, environmental permitting requirements, and other rules and regulations related to highway construction projects.
Experience with project management software, Microsoft Word and Excel, CDS NeXtGen, CDS-V3 and ECMS.

job summary:
NRG is leading a customer-driven change in the U.S. energy industry by delivering cleaner and smarter energy choices, while building on the strength of the nation’s largest and most diverse competitive power portfolio. A Fortune 200 company, we create value through reliable and efficient conventional generation while driving innovation in solar and renewable power, electric vehicle ecosystems, carbon capture technology and customer-centric energy solutions. Our retail electricity providers serve almost 3 million residential and commercial customers throughout the country. More information is available at www.nrg.com . Connect with NRG Energy on Facebook and follow us on Twitter @nrgenergy .


About the Company


NRG is at the forefront of changing how people think about and use energy. We deliver cleaner and smarter energy choices for our customers, backed by the nation’s largest independent power generation portfolio of fossil fuel, nuclear, solar and wind facilities. A Fortune 500 company, NRG is challenging the U.S. energy industry by becoming the largest developer of solar power, building the first privately-funded electric vehicle charging infrastructure, and providing customers with the most advanced smart energy solutions to better manage their energy use. In addition to 47,000 megawatts of generation capacity, enough to supply nearly 40 million homes, our retail electricity providers – Reliant, Green Mountain Energy,Energy Plus and NRG Home – serve more than two million customers. More information is available at www.nrgenergy.com. Connect with NRG Energy on Facebook and follow us on Twitter.


Position Summary


NRG Retail seeks an energetic and ambitious self-starter to join our Margin Management and Pricing team focused on the Northeast Retail Business segment. In the role, the candidate will be responsible for achieving customer retention goals that will directly impact customer satisfaction count and profitability metrics. Crucially, the ideal candidate is a leader that can propose, develop and execute effective strategies that meaningfully change the trajectory of current retention trends. In return, the successful candidate will receive an opportunity to develop his/her professional career, gain exposure to senior management, assume increasing levels of responsibilities and contribute to delivering a brighter energy future for our customers.


Responsibilities

Identify, analyze and interpret customer trends from large, complex data sets
Design experiments and use statistical techniques to determine factors that drive customer behavior
Develop, deploy and refine models that predict customer behavior – with a focus on customer retention
Most importantly, based on statistical analysis, experiments and models deploy solutions that substantially improve business results
Report business risks and results proactively and concisely to senior management

Skills

Strong proficiency in advanced statistical techniques (factor analysis, time series, survival analysis, Bayesian statistics,..)
Proven ability to develop and implement solutions that meaningfully impact business outcomes
Demonstrated creative problem solving and critical reasoning abilities
Skills to extract customer behavior from data, construct then prove meaningful and reasonable hypotheses
Ability to make correct judgment call with incomplete information
Work with people in different functions and of different background
Strong proficiency in SQL and MS Excel is required
Require ability with some or all of the following software SAS, R or Python
Established ability to communicate effectively and proactively
Ability to communicate using visual tools (i.e. PowerPoint, Tableau) is desirable

Expe rience

A minimum of a four year degree in economics, statistics, computer science, mathematics, engineering or another quantitative discipline
Additional education is preferred
Seven (7) or more years of relevant analytics, quantitative analysis and predictive modeling experience
Three (3) or more years of supervisory or managerial experience required
Experience in retail, consumer facing industries like telecoms, electricity, insurance and banking

job summary:
We’re looking for account managers from all different backgrounds to join our regional sales team. This is no ordinary sales job, as ours is a uniquely high performing and supportive working culture.


Who is Hilti?
If you’re new to the industry, you might not have heard of us. We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software, and services for the global construction sector. We have a proud heritage, built over 75 years, and a worldwide reputation for pioneering products and exceptional service. With some 23,000 people in more than 120 countries, we’re a great place for you to show us your worth as you learn, grow, and carve out your career.


What does the role involve?
As an account manager, you’ll be visiting our customers, wherever they’re busy working, to find out how we can help them. You could find yourself on construction sites and nuclear plants or in offices and warehouses.

Ours is a model of professional, consultative selling and it’s a really hands-on job. It means rolling up your sleeves to demonstrate some of the most pioneering products in the industry, while selling our state-of-the-art software along with all the services and aftercare that come with the Hilti name. Far from traditional cold calling, it’s about building relationships with warm and responsive customers and helping them find the most innovative and cost-efficient solutions for their needs.

You’ll work with some of the industry’s most trusted and innovative engineering products.


You’ll work with some of the industry’s most trusted and innovative engineering products


What do we offer?
We’ll give you everything you need to excel in your role, including your own van full of tools and one-to-one coaching. You’ll enjoy a rare combination of autonomy and camaraderie, as you’ll manage your own book of business while being part of a friendly team.


We’ll give you lots of responsibility, including your own portfolio of customers and these might be trades experts, project managers, or company leaders. From there, we’ll trust you to do whatever it takes to deliver outstanding results. Go the extra mile and we’ll reward you with unrivaled training, development, and career opportunities as soon as you’re ready for the next challenge.


Day to day you’ll report to your regional sales manager, who will also be there to help you manage your career.


Why should you apply?
We have an excellent mix of people and some of our best account managers joined us with little or no construction experience. Success at Hilti is down to teamwork and ability, no matter what your background.


What you need is:
Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent work experience.
At least one year prior experience in customer service and/ or sales working directly with customers, preferred (either over phone or face-to-face)
Ability to thrive both independently and in a team environment.
Demonstrated ability to develop engaged customer relationships and effectively implement strategic concepts.
Excellent time and territory management skills.
Must be persuasive, sales driven, customer focused, and a team player.
Proficient computer skills including MS Office Suite, and smartphones.
Must maintain a professional business appearance in accordance with HNA dress policy at all times.
Career advancement may require domestic and/or global mobility.

A company vehicle is provided for carrying tools/fasteners for product demonstration purposes. Employee must have a valid US driver’s license and comply with HNA Fleet Safety Policy requirements.

As part of your interview process, we’ll take you on a day-in-the-life ‘field ride’ to give you a feel for the job and the caliber of our people. We’ll also pay for your travel to the interview.


Tempted to apply or find out more?

job summary:
Holtec International, a global supplier of heat transfer equipment for nuclear, fossil, solar and geothermal plants, seeks a mechanical engineering graduate with strong academic credentials, good communication and organization skills, and a solid foundation in thermodynamics and heat transfer for the position of application / proposal engineer.


The position is located at Holtec’s technology center in Marlton, NJ. Holtec manufactures heat transfer equipment domestically at its fabrication plant in Pittsburgh, PA and internationally through a network of manufacturing partners.


Position responsibilities


The Application / Proposal Engineer’s primary responsibility is to perform preliminary design/analysis and estimating of heat exchanger equipment in support of competitive bids for future projects. The Application / Proposal Engineer’s mission is to provide technical solutions in accordance with current thermal and mechanical codes and in compliance with the client provided technical specification. The Application / Proposal Engineer is the client’s primary technical contact during the completion of proposals and review of proposals in the form of verbal and written communications.


Managing the full life-cycle of proposals including specification compliance, both commercial and technical.


Perform thermal design of water and air cooled condensers, feed water heaters, non-fired heat exchangers using commercially available and proprietary thermal rating programs.


Perform mechanical design of heat exchangers and pressure vessels necessary to complete technical design to meet proposal requirements.


Propose alternative designs to optimize performance, equipment size, and cost competitiveness.


Develop equipment specifications for purchased items needed for proposal submission.


Primary point of contact with strategic vendors needed to support equipment purchased to complete proposal.


Compile pricing and present design and pricing information to management.


Create and submit proposals which are clear and professional and in accordance with written procedures and processes and the client’s request for proposal.


Respond to client questions through proposal evaluation process.


Manage multiple proposals for multiple clients at any given time.


Collect, develop and maintain proposal material for re-use across multiple proposals, ultimately contributing to and developing a proposal materials library.


Support other Heat Transfer Division activities that are aligned with the engineer’s experience and skills.


Position requirements


Selected candidate will have appropriate education and professional background to meet position responsibilities.


A Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering is required, MS Degree in Engineering preferred

Working knowledge of the ASME Code for pressure vessel design is required

Demonstrated experience with Heat Transfer, Thermodynamics, HEI, ASME, TEMA, and HTRI

Proficiency in Microsoft suite of programs is required

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Power industry experience is required

Independent and individual contributor

Able to multi-task and prioritize

Fluency in a foreign language is a plus


Travel


Approximately 10%, typically one or two trade shows a year and kick-off meetings with clients, upon successful proposal effort.

Liquid crystals are among the leading products on the market for LCD televisions and other displays, as well as fillers and effect pigments. The entire Performance Materials product portfolio offers highly innovative materials for advanced technologies and high-tech chemicals for advanced applications to a wide range of customers. EMD Performance Materials is extending its leading position in innovation. Customers from the sectors consumer electronics, lighting, printing technology, plastics applications and cosmetics make use of materials and solutions from EMD Performance Materials. The position is for a Network Planner. Successful applicant will possess extensive experience in PON/FTTH technology. Self-starter with integrity and confidence who strives to achieve in even the most challenging environments with limited supervision.

Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering. Candidates with advanced degrees will be given preference
Professional Engineering License

job summary:
Applied Technical Services 

Inc. (ATS) is a world-class, technologically advanced consulting and engineering firm with extensive testing and inspection capabilities. With headquarters in Marietta, GA and over 20 branch offices and over 750 employees scattered throughout the US, ATS has established an excellent reputation within the commercial, industrial and legal communities for taking a closer look with our metallurgy, materials testing, chemical analysis, non-destructive testing, forensic and consulting engineering, fire and explosion investigations and calibration services.


Our vision is to become the industry leader in providing expert consulting engineering, testing, and inspection services.


We are seeking NDT supervisors for our Marietta, GA location.


Summary :


Nondestructive Testing (NDT) consists of a wide group of test methods used to evaluate the properties of a material, component or system to determine the suitability of its intended purpose without causing damage or impairing its future usefulness. Test methods include Radiography, Ultrasound, Eddy Current, Liquid Penetrant, Magnetic Particle, and Visual inspections.


Duties and responsibilities :


An NDT Technician/Supervisor shall be qualified and certified to set up and calibrate equipment and to interpret and evaluate results and determine the acceptability of materials and components with respect to applicable codes, standards, and specifications.


The NDT Supervisor shall be thoroughly familiar with the scope and limitations of the methods for which qualified and shall exercise assigned responsibility for on-the-job training and guidance of trainees. The NDT Supervisor shall be able to prepare written instructions, and to organize and report the results of nondestructive tests.


Personnel considered for certification in NDT shall have sufficient education, training, and experience to ensure qualification in those NDT methods in which they are being considered for certification. Documentation of education, training, and experience must be provided upon employment. Documentation shall meet the minimum requirements found in the latest edition of ASNT SNT-TC-1A. Certification shall require the individual to pass a General, Specific, and Practical examination as outlined in ASNT SNT-TC-1A.


Nondestructive examinations will be performed in the lab and at client locations. Examinations will be performed on a wide array of components in the aerospace, chemical, construction, petrochemical, pulp and paper, and power generation industries, including fossil, hydro, and nuclear plants.


Minimum Qualifications


Examinations require the individual to have the ability to :

Work from heights on scaffolding, ladders, elevated platforms, man-baskets, etc.
Work in confined spaces which will require crawling, stooping, climbing, etc.
Work in around operating equipment and industrial environments.
Lift up to 100 pounds.
Work with radiation and hazardous materials such as cleaners, penetrants, film developing chemicals, etc.
Work shift up to 12 hours/day and 7 days/week.
Travel for extended periods of time.
Must have multiple years of experience in the pulp and paper industry and/ or have extensive project management experience in a similar industry with a knowledge of NDT

Benefits


ATS offers excellent wages and advancement opportunities. ATS full-time employee benefits include: medical, dental, vision, 401k, vacation, personal time, and bonus.


EOE/AA/M/F/Vet/Disabled

The minimum estimated requirements for lifting, carrying, and pushing is 20 pounds. The maximum for lifting is 50 pounds, for carrying is 40 pounds, and for pushing is 60-80 pounds. You can expect to be climbing ladders, scaffolding, and stairs; you’ll be responsible for operating equipment such as lifts, coring equipment, concrete mixers, compression machines, beam breaking machines, hammer drills, and saws.“Do I need any kind of technical certifications?”We’re looking for candidates that have current Georgia DOT certifications such as RTT, QCT Level 1 Asphalt, Concrete Technician, ACI Concrete Certification, etc. Current Radiation Safety and Use of Nuclear Gauges and NICET Level 1 or 2 in soils, concrete, and/or asphalt are also desired. Regional Construction Safety & Health Manager

Atlanta, GA (East Region)

JOB SUMMARY

This position exists to provide leadership for the Construction Safety and Health function within the E&CS; organization by leading the development and facilitating the implementation of a comprehensive construction safety process resulting in injury prevention, increased productivity and decreased project cost.

This position reports to the Construction Safety and Health Manager – and will be responsible for the supervision of Safety Professionals and their activities on projects primarily in the East (Georgia) Region. This position interfaces with the East Region E&CS; General Manager, Construction Site Managers, Project Managers, and Contractor Management on New Generation, Environmental, and Retrofit Projects throughout the East Region.

JOB REQUIREMENTS

Fifteen (15) years Professional Safety Experience preferably in industrial and/or power construction and a four year degree in Safety Management, Industrial Hygiene or Environmental Management or related field.

OR

Fifteen (15)years of professional safety experience, preferably in industrial and/or power construction (5 years must be direct construction experience within the Southern Company System in a safety leadership role).

Board Certifications preferred: Construction Health & Safety Technician (CHST), Associate Safety Professional (ASP), Certified Safety Professional (CSP), or Certified Industrial Hygienist (CIH)

Knowledge and experience managing contractor safety issues within an Owner/Contractor business relationship

Comprehensive knowledge of applicable OSHA safety and health regulations

Extensive experience working in an industrial environment

Working knowledge of industrial safety principles, including accident prevention techniques, personal protective equipment, administrative controls and engineering control measures

Strong oral and written communication skills; ability to deliver effective presentations

Strong leadership, teamwork and interpersonal skills, coupled with integrity and ethics

Proficient with PowerPoint, Word and Excel

Excellent written and verbal communication skills; the ability to influence at all levels

Ability to operate as a change agent through Teamwork; demonstrated success as a Team player

Employee development and performance management experience and skills

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

Provide Safety and Health guidance, direction and coaching to Management and Safety and Health Professionals; serve as a subject matter expert/ technical advisor for construction Safety and Health issues

Establish and maintain an organizational structure and staffing in your assigned region to provide cost effective Safety and Health services to E&CS; and other Business Units as assigned; manage the personal and professional development of Safety and Health Professionals

Identify the needs, then lead the development and delivery of appropriate Safety and Health training programs and other services

Monitor, evaluate, analyze, track and publicize the organization's safety performance; lead the safety continuous improvement effort

Leverage industry and Company Safety and Health knowledge and learnings across E&CS;

Be a leader in the implementation of the Safety and Health management System as well in the development and review of (policies, procedures and processes required for an Engineering/Construction organization.

Take a leadership and sponsor role in the implementation and sustainability the STEP Behavior Based Safety Program.

TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS

This will include both day-trip and overnight travel primarily within the Southern Company Eastern footprint. Approximate travel is 50%.

BEHAVIORAL ATTRIBUTES

Demonstrate Southern Style – Unquestionable Trust, Superior Performance, and Total Commitment.

Safety focus and a strong personal safety record.

ADDITIONAL DETAILS

Limited relocation assistance is available if the selected candidate currently resides outside the area

Competitive Pay

Medical and dental coverage

job summary:
The Quality Engineer (QE) / Field Quality Assurance (QA) will assist in maintaining compliance with the Nuclear Quality Assurance Programs while ensuring that conflicts or issues with contract/specification requirements are identified and corrected in an appropriate manner. The QE will take a leading role in the development of tools and processes to improve the programs and work with Project Engineers and Project Managers to develop work packages for mockups, process validations, and site work. This position will also be responsible for the site implementation of the QA Program for the project, managing the QC inspectors and providing leadership with projects. The QE / Field QA will ensure that the project needs related to quality are communicated to crew members.


Education, Certifications, Licenses & Registrations:
A BA/BS degree in Engineering or technical field is required.


Skills and experience:
Must have a technical/professional background in QA/QC.
Five (5) years minimum experience in QA/QC or Engineering function within the manufacturing/welding industry with a minimum of two (2) years in the nuclear field is required.
Must have working knowledge of 10CFR Appendix B and NQA-1 Quality Assurance programs.
Knowledge of the ASME PVBC and B31.x codes.
Experience with general statistics, Gage R&R; studies, M&TE; usage, and calibration.
Intermediate to advanced proficiency in MS Office is required; familiar with Access database applications, Smart Excel Workbooks, and Word is required.
This position requires an individual that is detail oriented and technically minded with effective oral, listening, and written skills.
Nuclear/QA documentation (Work and Travelers packages) experience is preferred.
Essential Duties:
Work with the project managers to ensure that code, contract, and regulatory requirements are translated into the project data package prior to final review by the Nuclear QA Manager.
Develop and perform R&R; studies.
Work closely with the Nuclear QA Manager to provide guidance in applying the QA Program with QA/QC, field engineers, and project managers.
Generally support the Nuclear QA Manager in projects as needed.
Perform inspections, receipt and visual, using M&TE.;
Review in-coming, in-process, and final documentation-including detailed dimensional data.
Physical Demands:
Sitting, standing, walking, lifting up to 50 lbs, and ability to work in an industrial field environment.
Travel up to 50%.
12 hour shifts in the field.
Ability to climb ladders and scaffolding.
May require wearing a respirator in certain locations.
Schedule:
Full Time

job summary:
Company Information

Terracon is a 100 percent employee-owned consulting engineering firm providing quality services to clients. Since 1965, Terracon has evolved into a successful multi-discipline firm specializing in environmental, facilities, geotechnical, and materials services. Terracon currently has more than 3,500 employees in 130 offices with services available in all 50 states. Terraconâs growth is due to valued employees exceeding expectations in client service and growing their careers with new and exciting opportunities in the marketplace.

Job Description General Responsibilities:
Perform field and/or laboratory testing, observation, and inspection of construction materials (e.g. soils, aggregates, concrete, asphalt, and steel).

Communicate with project manager, engineering technicians, client representative, contractorâs representative and others as applicable regarding the construction site, project requirements, and testing, observation, and inspection requirements and results.

Transport material samples with associated identifying documentation to the laboratory for further testing and analysis.

Tabulate, prepare, and submit data and observation in the form of written and digital reports as work is performed for daily transmittal to the Terracon Project Manager.

Maintain and clean equipment, vehicles and work areas.

May assist with scheduling and dispatch of Technicians to project sites.

Adhere to strict safety standards.

Essential Role and Responsibilities:
Performs testing, observation, and inspection as directed in accordance with training and the specified procedures.

Provides clear documentation of findings and results. Performs basic analysis of data to verify accuracy before communication and submittal to the Project Manager.

Communicates information to Project Manager and other personnel as directed by the PM.

Assists higher level technicians on complex tasks. Maintains assigned equipment and related calibration.

Follows safety rules and practices and other safety requirements for all projects.

Performs pre-task planning prior to executing work.

Report any safety issues or concerns to management. Be responsible for maintaining quality standards on all projects.

Requirements:
High school diploma or equivalent.

Minimum 1-2 years of relevant experience or the equivalent in training and related experience.

Experience with laptop computer use and Microsoft Word and Excel

ACI certification in one or more of the following areas: Concrete Field Testing Technician Grade I Concrete Strength Testing Technician Certified in radiation safety and Nuclear Density Gauge operation.

Successful completion of related internal safety certifications.

Valid driverâs license with acceptable violation history

Certifications in one or more of the following areas: NICET Level II certification in Construction Materials Testing in one or more of the following categories: Asphalt, Concrete, Soils.

NICET Level II certification in Geotechnical in one or more of the following categories: Construction, Laboratory, Exploration, Generalist

ICC certification in one or more of the following categories: Reinforced Concrete, Spray-applied Fireproofing, Structural Masonry, Prestressed/Post-Tensioned Concrete, Structural Steel â Bolting, Structural Steel â Welding.

American Welding Society (AWS) Certified Associate Welding Inspector (CAWI) American Society for Nondestructive Testing (ASNT) Level II certification in more than one of the following areas: Visual Testing (VT), Magnetic Particle Testing (MT), Dye Penetrant Testing (PT), Radiographic Testing (RT), Ultrasonic Testing (UT). Other national, regional, state, and local Materials related certifications requiring experience and written examination will also be considered if deemed appropriate by the Terracon Department Manager

To Apply please send your resume to: Theresa.bridges@terracon.com CJUB35

job summary:
ENERCON Services, is an employee owned, premier Engineering and Environmental Services Company. Our double-digit year-over-year growth is fueled by the quality of work we perform as an EOC (Engineer of Choice) to a large base of the power facilities in the US, as well as to an expanding global customer base. We are the #1 ranked Nuclear Engineering firm (enr.com; June 2015). Ranked #103 of the Top 200 Environmental firms, our Environmental Services practice area performs environmental consulting services for a variety of industries, including Utilities, Financial Services, Oil & Gas, Manufacturing, Mining, Petro-Chemical, Industrial, Commercial, Water & Wastewater Treatment, and Land Development.

We are currently seeking an experienced Primavera P6 Project Scheduler to join our team at our Headquarter's in Kennesaw, GA (North Atlanta Suburb).

Duties Include :

Perform detailed scheduling in Primavera P6, including developing and updating project schedules, activity logic ties, work breakdown structures, earned value reports, variance reports, resource loading and project progress updates
Develop & update resource curves and support Project Management Team with project related reports

Minimum Qualifications :

Bachelor or Associates degree in business related major AND formal Primavera P6 certification and training
At least 2 or more years of project scheduling experience using Primavera P6
Ability to manage ad-hock and emergent turnaround requests within a fast-paced environment
Demonstrated strong verbal and written communication skills
Demonstrated success in self-management of work load and time constraints to meet required deadlines
Strong MS Excel skills
Scheduling experience in nuclear power industry, specifically nuclear plant design modification projects highly preferred

ENERCON Services, Inc. (ENERCON) is a 32-year old, employee-owned, consulting firm, providing premier engineering, design and technical services to companies in the energy, utility and industrial verticals, as well as to governmental agencies across the US and Internationally. ENERCON is fully owned by our employees, and offers excellent benefits and opportunities for professional growth. To learn more about ENERCON and all of our exciting career opportunities, visit us at enercon.com .

ENERCON does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

job summary:
Sodexo’s growing Clinical Technology Management Division is seeking a talented Field Service Imaging Engineer Level 3 to support our customer, Alliance Healthcare, in the Winston Salem, NC area. The main role of the position will be to ensure all CTM related diagnostic imaging medical equipment is maintained in a quality and timely manner. The ideal candidate will have outstanding customer service and communications skill as well as a strong technical skills and a commitment to deliver excellent repair service in an expedient manner across the identified geographical area. Ideal candidates will possess:

Competency in troubleshooting/repairing and maintaining diagnostic imaging devices.
Understanding of regulatory requirements of medical devices
Proven success developing and sustaining vendor relationships
Ability to manage medical device life cycle plans
Medical equipment knowledge with the following is desired for this: DICOM, Siemens, Toshiba, Philips, GE Healthcare, Hologic, XRay, Ultrasound, C-Arm, MRI, CT, Radiation Therapy, Nuclear Medicine, General RF, Clinical Asset Management, Accelerators;
Ability to participate in on-call rotation schedule as required.

Under minimal supervision of the General Manager, Clinical Technology Management (CTM) /Site Supervisor, inspect, repair, maintain, and calibrate all types of basic diagnostic imaging and/or therapeutic radiation equipment, devices, system, and instruments. Interact on a routine basis with other clinical health providers in the identification of technology-based problems and solution development. An IMAGING SERVICE TECHNICIAN III represents the highest level of technical expertise and possesses the ability to troubleshoot, repair, and maintain the full range of diagnostic and therapeutic inventory devices, instrumentation, and systems. The IMAGING SERVICE TECHNICIAN III will possess a substantial background of knowledge and experience and is expected to contribute to: corporate initiatives regarding improvement and development of policy and procedures; technical guidance in the selection and installation of medical/imaging equipment and systems; and staff development and mentorship. The IMAGING SERVICE TECHNICIAN III may work toward status of a Site Supervisor or GM, CTM by attaining significant proficiency in supervisory and administrative skills leading toward leadership positions.


Basic Education Requirement -Associates Degree in electronics, biomedical engineering, or related field.


Basic Management Experience - 2 years


Basic Functional Experience - 5 years in maintenance and repair of clinical devices.


Sodexo is an EEO/AA/Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran employer.

job summary:
Energize your career with Westinghouse Electric Company! Our commitment to safe, clean nuclear energy is second to none, and we’re proud of our rich heritage of technical innovation and commitment to our global customers’ success. If you are interested in being a part of a company that values exceeding customer expectations and providing future generations around the globe with emission-free energy, we want to hear from you.


At Westinghouse, we are solely focused on nuclear energy technology. Our goal is simple-- to provide solutions to our customers to keep their plants safe, reliable and efficient. Helping our customers support the needs of their customers is why we are committed to quality, safety, and innovation at every turn.

necessary to perform assignments.

* Identify and recommend improvements in processes on continuing basis and assist in implementation.
