job summary:
About Us:
Established in 1981, SURVICE is a nationally recognized, single-source engineering service provider for Government and Industry organizations involved in all phases of the systems engineering process. We're proud to have supported the development, testing, and analysis of many of the major U.S. combat systems in the field today. In addition, we've helped create a central repository of defense systems related information and resources routinely used by analysts, testers, and other specialists.

Position Summary: SURVICE Engineering is seeking two (2) Laser Tracker Inspectors to support precision inspection and alignment at two nuclear plant construction sites. Sites are located in Columbia, SC and Augusta, GA. Inspectors will be working 12-hour shifts, possibly 6 days a week. This is a 4-month contract. Excellent pay. Includes overtime and per diem, if relocation is necessary.

Primary Duties & Responsibilities : Conduct precision inspection and alignment using Faro laser tracker with Spatial Analyzer software. Develop and utilize measurement plans for mechanical system installations and alignments. Set up and utilize precision measuring tools; validate measurement results for accuracy and repeatability. Read and interpret engineering drawings and geometric dimensioning & tolerancing (GD&T;) Provide coherent inspection and measurement reports. Be able to follow quality assurance and quality control procedures and processes. Be able to troubleshoot equipment and software; adjust measurement procedures to meet changing conditions on the job site.

Qualifications and Experience: Certificate, associate's degree, or bachelor's degree in engineering, engineering design, computer aided design, industrial design, manufacturing engineering, manufacturing technology, quality/inspection, surveying preferred. At least one year experience as a laser tracker operator/inspector/Metrologist required. 3-5 years preferred. Experience with nuclear power generation plants and associated installations, hardware and machinery preferred. Must be experienced with laser tracker measurements for alignment and/or inspection. Faro laser trackers preferred. Experience using other laser trackers will be considered. Experience with Spatial Analyzer software preferred. Experience using other metrology software packages (Verisurf, CAM2, PolyWorks) with laser trackers will be considered. Projects are located on construction sites must be willing/able to work wearing protective gear (helmets, fall arrest/harness, etc), crouch, climb ladders, lift equipment up to 50 pounds.

Working Conditions:

Motor Abilities - Prolonged walking and standing; Bending/stooping; Squatting; Twisting; Overhead work; Grasping/gripping; Fine motor control (hands); Lifting ability; Exertion; Repetitive work.
Special Senses - Visually demanding work; Near/far vision; Depth perception; Basic color discrimination; Ability to hear audio alarms; Speech discrimination.
Work Conditions - High noises possible ( >85 dB); Heights; Confined spaces; Stairs; Heat stress; Hazardous chemical/waste possible (construction materials); Ladders > 6 feet; Lasers; Protective clothing; Respirator use possible; Motor vehicle use; Typing/keyboard; Working: 12 hours/day; Day and/or Night shifts; Overtime/irregular hours.

Clearance Requirement : Must be able to obtain DOE Security Clearance

Benefits Statement
SURVICE Engineering Company offers a total rewards package to include competitive salaries, comprehensive insurance options, paid time off and holidays, 401(k) retirement and profit sharing, flexible spending, tuition reimbursement and more.

Recruiting Disclaimer
SURVICE Engineering utilizes our own internal corporate recruiters to fill our employment needs. If you are contacted over the phone or e-mail by a company listing a SURVICE Engineering job and requesting your personal information, allegedly on SURVICE Engineering's behalf, please do not respond.

SURVICE Engineering is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Manager - Structures & Fuel Assembly Prod Design In this position, the Manager can expect to be responsible for the following:


1. Manage department activities to implement, modify thermal, hydraulic and seismic aspects of existing designs, and improve production techniques in these areas for the organization. Lead and maintain broad oversight of department operations, anticipate and direct timely and effective responses to routine and non-routine problems. Proactively promote independent actions as required to improve customer and regulatory relations, and product improvement.

2. Ensure reliable product delivery, meeting objectives for safety, quality, production, cost and scheduling.

3. Lead and drive innovative solutions to challenging technical and process problems.

4. Direct operations utilizing cost effective resource management in the implementation of thermal, hydraulic and seismic analyses and testing.

5. Provide technical leadership to the organization through frequent communication and interface with customers and departments within and outside of the organization.

6. Oversee engineering design support for the manufacturing value stream in specific areas as required. Direct continual review.

7. Evaluate and approve design changes, calculations, specifications and drawing releases.

8. Plan and formulate engineering programs and organize department according to project requirements.

9. Review and monitor all design, engineering and proposed technological developments/enhancements.

10. Develop and maintain department standard operating procedures, training standards, manuals and drawing standards.

11. Review product design for compliance with engineering principles, company standards and customer contract requirements and related specifications.

12. Assign project personnel to specific phases or aspects of projects such as technical studies, product design, preparation of specifications and technical plans and product testing.

13. Provide coaching to and development of department personnel and promote teamwork.

14. Control expenditures within limitations of department budget.

15. Provide input to short and long term department plans.

16. Own and champion process improvement efforts in department operations.

17. Support and champion corporate initiatives as directed.

We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Principal Criticality Safety Engineer. In this position, a Principal Criticality Safety Engineer can be expected to be responsible for the following:


Provide technical leadership in Nuclear Criticality Safety (NCS) to ensure fissile materials are processed, stored, and handled safely so that personnel and property are protected against a nuclear criticality accident. Support plant operation by reviewing procedures and proposed plant modifications. Produce high quality documentation to establish limits and controls to support the NCS program.

Complete/continue NCS qualification.
Demonstrate a thorough understanding of the design basis, safety analyses, and operations of plant systems.
Develop, revise, and review Criticality Safety Evaluations and Calculation Notes in accordance with plant guidelines for both normal and credible abnormal conditions.
Establish normal and credible abnormal conditions in cooperation with engineering and operations staff through the use of hazard analyses.
Review documentation such as procedures and drawings to ensure proper NCS implementation.
Review and actively develop new processes or proposed changes through the Configuration Control process.
Provide specific NCS professional interpretations and advice.
Serve as Subject Matter Expert to support training as requested.
Mentor less-experienced NCS Engineers.
Provide NCS program development, mentoring, and implementation support as needed.
Participate in audits, inspections, incident investigations, and design reviews.

job summary:
Nexagen Networks is seeking a Nuclear Radiation Hardening Subject Matter Expert (SME) with a strong background in combined effects test to join our team at the Air Force’s premier testing facility in the nation. The SME will be responsible for program support, test and evaluation planning review and assessment support, and test and evaluation infrastructure analysis support for the Lead Developmental Testing Office (LDTO) involved in aerospace testing from developmental stages through acceptance for flight, and from component level to complete systems testing for a national program. Testing will be done at the Arnold Engineering Development Complex (AEDC) at Arnold Air Force Base, TN.


For questions or more information, please email us at careers@nexagen.com.


About Nexagen:


Nexagen is a growing small business with its primary operations located in Aberdeen, MD. It is a certified Minority Woman Owned Business, Small Disadvantaged Business. Nexagen is a CMMI Level 2 certified company providing System Engineering, Software Engineering, RF Engineering, Information Assurance, Project Management, Logistics, and Network Engineering Services. Nexagen supports multiple DoD clients to include the U.S. Air Force, U.S. Army, Navy, and Marine Corps. Nexagen is also a prime contractor for multiple Indefinite Delivery – Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) contracts to include SSES NexGen, GTACS, TAOSS, ARDEC and SPAWAR contracts.


Responsibilities:

Support and represent the LDTO relative to nuclear weapon system developmental test and evaluation requirements and plans in the areas of weapon system radiation hardening, as a recognized SME.
Identify and assess certification test requirements and processes
Review and assess the adequacy of related program developmental test and evaluation plans, including proposed resources (personnel, facilities, computational capabilities and equipment) and identify any deficiencies, issues or concerns to LDTO leadership in a timely manner.
Develop, monitor, and report risk analysis of test plans
Coordinate and interface with external Testing Agencies associated with the program, as required.

Excellent organizational skills and problem-solving skills.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Active Secret security clearance with the Department of Defense. Top Secret clearance highly desired.

Benefits

job summary:
Employed Opportunity for Adult/Geriatric Psych Unit

This hospital employed geri-psych opportunity is only ninety minutes from Nashville. The practice will cover IP Geri-Psych Unit plus outpatient clinic practice. The IP unit is geri-psych specific, while the outpatient clinic can be open to all age groups. This is the only inpatient geri-psych unit in the immediate area. This position requires ten days of ER call. This is the only Psychiatrist covering the unit with backup support from a Psychiatrist in Tullahoma (22 minutes away). This solid treatment team has consistent leadership, the same Program Director and Medical Director have been working together for 15 years. Winchester offers the best in small town living with convenient access to Chattanooga, Nashville and Huntsville. Specialty support includes cardiology, pulmonary/critical care medicine, nephrology, neurology, radiology, general surgery, orthopedic & spine surgery, ENT, oncology, occupational medicine, OB/GYN, pediatrics, pediatric cardiology, anesthesia and wound care. The generous financial package inclusive of full benefits, 401K, deferred savings, vacation, CME, relocation and sign on bonus. Student loan assistance is also available. Enjoy beautiful lakeside living just over an hour to Chattanooga.
About the Hospital

STRHS - Winchester, in conjunction with its sister campus,STRHS - Sewanee, is a 152-bed acute care and 46-bed skilled care facility. The hospital is Joint Commission-accredited and serves south-central Tennessee. The facility features a 10-bed ICU, a 12-bed Geriatric Psychiatry Unit, a 12-bed Inpatient Physical Rehab Unit, a Skilled Nursing Unit, Sleep Lab, Cardiac Cath Lab, five OR Suites and two Endoscopy Suites. There is also a 13-bay Emergency Room with more than 15,000 annual visits. Emerald-Hodgson Hospital has a four-bay Emergency Room that sees over 5,000 patients every year. Radiology services include MRI, CT, PET/CT, Mammography, Nuclear Medicine, Ultrasound and X-ray.
The Community

The city of Winchester is conveniently located in southern Tennessee. Three major metropolitan areas (Huntsville, Chattanooga and Nashville) are within convenient driving distance, each offering a host of cultural, recreational and entertainment activities. The community features top-rated schools, both public and private. The economy is strong and growing steadily, thanks to major employers such as Nissan, Shaw Carpets and Arnold Engineering. Within a short distance is The University of the South, located on a beautiful 10,000-acre campus atop the Cumberland Plateau in Sewanee, Tennessee. This nationally acclaimed liberal arts college also offers graduate studies in theology. The area around Winchester was once used extensively by Native Americans as a hunting and fishing territory. Archaeological excavations in the region have uncovered numerous artifacts and sites.
Recreation

Winchester surrounds beautiful Tims Ford Lake, which attracts visitors from miles around for its wonderful fishing, boating and water skiing. The 10,700-acre lake is one of the most picturesque in Tennessee and is regarded as one of the top bass fishing and recreational lakes in the Southeast. Year-round fishing also provides a substantial yield of bluegill, catfish and crappie. The park has almost five miles of paved trails that allow the hiker and cyclist to explore its natural surroundings. Tims Ford State Park has a beautiful, L-shaped swimming pool, one of the largest in the Tennessee State Park system, with a 12-foot diving pool, children's wading pool and a bathhouse. Tims Ford State Park also has a 52-site campground, with water and electric hook-ups at each site. The Bear Trace at Tims Ford is a 6,790-yard golf course designed by The Golden Bear, Jack Nicklaus. The course has received widespread acclaim, including being named one of the "Top Ten Places You Can Play" by Golf Magazine and one of the "Best New Destinations" in Tennessee. Situated on a peninsula surrounded by Tims Ford Lake, this bent-grass, links-style par 71 course has been described by one national publication as a "glittering newcomer." Just down the road in Lynchburg is the Jack Daniels Distillery, the nation's oldest registered distillery and a favorite tourist destination.

Manufacturing Engineer II


Sargent Aerospace & Defense is a premier global supplier of custom engineered, high quality products to the Aerospace and Defense Industries. Sargent Aerospace & Defense products are found on many major Commercial and Military aircraft in operation worldwide. Products and systems include hydraulic actuation and valve systems, locking actuators, steering metering control valves, fuse pins, hot forged bolts, pneumatic ducting and valve seals, tubing system alignment joints, engine hot section and structural components, airframe components, shock strut bearings, Teflon lined spherical bearings and broad component maintenance, overhaul, spares logistics and power-by-the-hour support services. Sargent is also a major supplier of hydraulic control valves to the US Navy on all Nuclear Class Submarine programs. Sargent has an immediate opening for a Manufacturing Engineer II .


Scope and Purpose:


Develops and improves manufacturing processes by studying product and manufacturing methods. Drives product and process changes to reduce cost, inventory, and improve quality and delivery. Implements Lean and Six Sigma strategies in support of continuous improvement culture to increase productivity.


Roles and Responsibilities:

Model safe behavior at all times
Support production with all required technical needs. Determine materials required to manufacture, assemble and test precision products, determine labor hours to complete each operation of work order and determine inspection points.
The Manufacturing Process Engineer will optimize and document all aspects of manufacturing processes by identifying improvement opportunities and applying simpler, faster, cost effective and reliable methods.
Evaluate new and existing processes to ensure quality and safety of the job
Create and maintain detailed manufacturing and process instructions for complex parts assemblies as well as modifications to existing products.
Champion the use of Process Controls to measure capability, reduce variability, and overall improve the quality of the product.
Drive and support Lean Manufacturing techniques in the shop including process mapping, cellular manufacturing, set-up time reduction, and overall waste reduction.
Effectively use all process improvement strategies and techniques including Lean and Six Sigma to minimize waste and maximize economies.
Must be able and willing to work extra time as necessary to ensure completion of assigned tasks

Education and Experience:

Bachelor degree in Engineering or related technical field plus 2 years as a Manufacturing Engineer OR
Associates degree in Engineering or related technical field plus 4 years of related experience OR
In Lieu of a degree, minimum of 6-10 years of directly related experience.
Working knowledge of solid modeling
Must be a U.S. Citizen

Preferred Qualifications:

Aerospace and defense machining and manufacturing requirements (tight tolerance)
Manufacturing footprint optimization and part/product family strategies
Ability to read and decipher drawings and procedures, and GD&T;
Tooling documentation/library and tool life management
Training or certification in Six Sigma and Lean Principles
Experience in mechanical/hydraulic systems/bearings
Experience in a DoD or military product manufacturing environment

We offer competitive compensation and excellent benefits including Medical, Dental, and company matched 401k plan.

job summary:
Sodexo’s growing Clinical Technology Management Division is seeking a talented Field Service Imaging Engineer Level 3 to support our customer in the Tucson, AZ area. The main role of the position will be to ensure all CTM related diagnostic imaging medical equipment is maintained in a quality and timely manner. The ideal candidate will have outstanding customer service and communications skill as well as a strong technical skills and a commitment to deliver excellent repair service in an expedient manner across the identified geographical area. Ideal candidates will possess:

Competency in troubleshooting/repairing and maintaining diagnostic imaging devices.
Understanding of regulatory requirements of medical devices
Proven success developing and sustaining vendor relationships
Ability to manage medical device life cycle plans
Medical equipment knowledge with the following is desired for this: DICOM, Siemens, Toshiba, Philips, GE Healthcare, Hologic, XRay, Ultrasound, C-Arm, MRI, CT, Radiation Therapy, Nuclear Medicine, General RF, Clinical Asset Management, Accelerators;
Ability to participate in on-call rotation schedule as required.
#CTM


Under minimal supervision of the General Manager, Clinical Technology Management (CTM) /Site Supervisor, inspect, repair, maintain, and calibrate all types of basic diagnostic imaging and/or therapeutic radiation equipment, devices, system, and instruments. Interact on a routine basis with other clinical health providers in the identification of technology-based problems and solution development. An IMAGING SERVICE TECHNICIAN III represents the highest level of technical expertise and possesses the ability to troubleshoot, repair, and maintain the full range of diagnostic and therapeutic inventory devices, instrumentation, and systems. The IMAGING SERVICE TECHNICIAN III will possess a substantial background of knowledge and experience and is expected to contribute to: corporate initiatives regarding improvement and development of policy and procedures; technical guidance in the selection and installation of medical/imaging equipment and systems; and staff development and mentorship. The IMAGING SERVICE TECHNICIAN III may work toward status of a Site Supervisor or GM, CTM by attaining significant proficiency in supervisory and administrative skills leading toward leadership positions.


Basic Education Requirement -Associates Degree in electronics, biomedical engineering, or related field.


Basic Management Experience - 2 years


Basic Functional Experience - 5 years in maintenance and repair of clinical devices.


Sodexo is an EEO/AA/Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran employer.

Maintain customer relationships through customer conferences, voice of customer feedback, complaints, etc.

Products and systems include hydraulic actuation and valve systems, locking actuators, steering metering control valves, fuse pins, hot forged bolts, pneumatic ducting and valve seals, tubing system alignment joints, engine hot section and structural components, airframe components, shock strut bearings, Teflon lined spherical bearings and broad component maintenance, overhaul, spares logistics and power-by-the-hour support services. Sargent is also a major supplier of hydraulic control valves to the US Navy on all Nuclear Class Submarine programs. Sargent has an immediate opening for a senior level Design Checker .


ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES:


· Performs the complete dimensional analysis to ensure proper function and assembly of all parts comprising an assigned project.


· Checks all engineering documents created for each assigned project to ensure conformance to all company and/or contractually specified standards for drafting practice, dimensioning and tolerancing, material specifications, manufacturing processes, etc.


· Assists the Project Engineer in determining and implementing the method of dimensioning engineering drawings for each assigned project.


· Provides direction/guidance to individual Drafters in concerns of drafting procedures, dimensioning, view placement, etc.


· Creates installation and assembly layouts to verify local clearances between mating and adjacent parts.


· Performs complex tolerance and dimensional stackups of all parts and assemblies comprising an assigned project.


· Advises other Drafters in drafting procedures, dimensioning and tolerancing, view placement, etc.


· Performs checking of other Drafters drawings and models.


· Assists the Acting Drafting Administrator or Engineering Managers in the preparation of and proposing changes to the Drafting Procedures Manual.


· Other duties as assigned.


REQUIRED JOB KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:


· Associate’s degree in Computer Aided Drafting or equivalent education in an applicable engineering field of study. Minimum 10 years CAD Design, CAD Checking or equivalent Engineering experience.


· Creo 3.0 or equivalent experience in a comparable CAD program.


· Manufacturing or Machine Shop experience is highly valued


· Must be proficient in all aspects of ANSI Y14.5 Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing


· U.S. Citizenship required.


Must be able and willing to work additional time as required to ensure completion of all assigned projects.


We offer competitive compensation and excellent benefits including Medical, Dental, and company matched 401k plan.

Job title: Medium Voltage Electrician - Staff Technician, Senior
education level/skills required / respon: Completion of a two year technical vocational or college program in the field of expertise with emphasis on math, science, engineering or technology AND eight...
job summary:
Facilities Management at the University of Arizona is looking for a qualified Medium Voltage Electrician to join our Medium Voltage Team as a Staff Technician Senior. Specifically we are looking for an experienced electrician who has a broad range of skills and documented experience working with medium voltage electrical equipment (primarily 5kV and 15kV). Your medium voltage experience should include electrical distribution, testing, repair, preventative maintenance, and safety practices. Strong analytical skills are needed in this role. This position tests, repairs, maintains and installs wiring, motors, transformers, generators, breakers, switch gear, relays, and other electrical systems up to 46,000 volts.


The mission of Facilities Management at the University of Arizona is to effectively and efficiently provide maintenance, operational services and utilities services that support the faculty, staff and students in pursuit of excellence in their individual and institutional academic research and community objectives.


These services are directed toward the pursuit of sustainability in the maintenance and operation of all facilities.


Facilities Management’s vision is to achieve customer satisfaction and employee excellence. We value accountability, communication, sustainability, cooperation, education, fairness and trust.


Outstanding UA benefits include health, dental, and vision insurance plans; life insurance and disability programs; paid vacation, sick leave, and holidays; UA/ ASU / NAU tuition reduction for the employee and qualified family members; state retirement plan; access to UA recreation and cultural activities; and more!


The University of Arizona has been recognized on Forbes 2015 list of America’s Best Employers in the United States and has been awarded the 2015 Work-Life Seal of Distinction by the Alliance for Work-Life Progress! For more information about working at the University of Arizona, please click here .


Duties & Responsibilities

Installs, repairs, troubleshoots and maintains electric motors, transformers, circuit breakers, switches, generators, control circuits, wiring, and other electrical system equipment and components in compliance with electrical codes, standards and regulations. Operates a variety of electrical testing equipment in locating and determining types of electrical malfunctions. Understand electrical one-line diagrams and schematics, determines work requirement and sequence of repairs and/or installations. Repairs and maintains medium voltage systems and components. one a regular basis, medium voltage team members must have the responsibility to be:

• Safety oriented

• Customer service oriented

• Willing to learn and follow procedures and policy

• Adaptable to adverse conditions

• Self-starters

• A team member that can bring great ideas but is able to take direction

• Willing to work scheduled and/or unscheduled shutdowns

• Willing to work athletic events and be on the on-call rotation


Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities

• Knowledge and understanding of the National Electric Code ( NEC )

• Knowledge of the interworking of Transformers primary and secondary

• Experience with electrical substations

• Experience with 480/4160/13800 volt systems

• Experience in electrical installation (Conduit, Brach Circuit, and Distribution)

• Knowledge of motor install and troubleshooting

• Ability to work well with others

• Ability to inspect work and ID poor installation of medium voltage from underground to cable termination and hookup


Minimum Qualifications

Please see Arizona Board of Regents Minimum Qualifications below. The specific areas of expertise we are looking for include:

• Eight years of progressively responsible experience with at least:

o Six years of maintenance and repair experience with medium voltage electrical transformer and distribution gear: OR,

o Six years in the design and construction medium voltage distribution/substations up to 46,000 volts.

• A valid driver’s license and two years licensed driving experience is also required.


Arizona Board of Regents Minimum Qualifications

Completion of a two year technical vocational or college program in the field of expertise with emphasis on math, science, engineering or technology AND eight years of broadly diversified experience in a variety of positions involved with complex applied technology such as science projects, aerospace, nuclear power, or sophisticated instruments; OR, ten years of broadly diversified experience in a variety of positions involved with complex applied technology such as science projects, aerospace, nuclear power or sophisticated instruments; OR, any equivalent combination of experience, training and/or education.


Preferred Qualifications

Completion of a four year Federally approved technical training program in electrical repair and maintenance is preferred (and will count towards time worked for above requirements.)

Full Time

Job Description The Electrical Engineer will assist the Program Manager with the acquisition program planning and execution activities for a microwave linked terrestrial CCTV system at three ICBM missile wings. The Electrical Engineer will use their previous experience directly managing contracted workloads with emphasis on design, modification, production, and sustainment of ground vehicles and munitions handling equipment to advising program management teams on technical matters, independently performing complex engineering analysis, and providing technical leadership over engineering activities. Job Requirements This position requires the following requirements and experiences: Have twelve plus years directly related experience or ten plus years with a Master's of Science degree Execution activities for a microwave linked terrestrial CCTV systems Advising program management teams on technical matters, independently performing complex engineering analysis Bachelor's Degree in Electrical, Software, Systems or Production Engineering Possess strong communication skills needed to effectively communicate complex technical matters to lay people ICBM experience highly desired but not required Other Skills/Abilities Ability to operate calculator, office copier, fax and computer are required.

job summary:
Job Summary:
This position provides specialized repair (radiology, nuclear medicine, ultrasound, etc.) and maintenance services to diagnostic imaging equipment and biomedical equipment.

Essential Duties:
Performs repair and maintenance primarily on general imaging equipment, such as X-Ray units, Portable X-ray units, Fluoroscopy Systems, CR units, and Mammography units, Ultrasound systems, etc.

Completes all necessary record keeping for work orders received and finished.

Assists in the ordering of parts and supplies necessary for the most cost effective maintenance of medical imaging equipment.

Provides on-call coverage on a rotating basis and other duties as assigned.

Provides input to the Account Manager regarding new service opportunities within a location serviced by the Clinical Engineering Division and performs other duties as assigned.

May also provide repair and maintenance of general biomedical equipment as secondary responsibility or as assigned.

Qualifications

Education / Accreditation / Licensure (required & preferred):
Associate’s Degree in a related field required. CRES/CBET certification preferred.

Experience (required and preferred):
Two years of related experience servicing medical imaging equipment. Reliable transportation required. Must be current on technological and medical advances. Must have current understanding of Joint Commission, 21 CFR and NFPA regulations. Must have the ability to repair and maintain a wide variety of medical equipment.

Additional Responsibilities:
Demonstrates a commitment to service, organization values and professionalism through appropriate conduct and demeanor at all times.

Adheres to and exhibits our core values:
Reverence: Having a profound spirit of awe and respect for all creation, shaping relationships to self, to one another and to God and acknowledging that we hold in trust all that has been given to us.

Integrity: Moral wholeness, soundness, uprightness, honesty and sincerity as a basis of trustworthiness.

Compassion: Feeling with others, being one with others in their sorrows and joys, rooted in the sense of solidarity as members of the human community.

Excellence: Outstanding achievement, merit, virtue; continually surpassing standards to achieve/maintain quality.

Maintains confidentiality and protects sensitive data at all times.

Adheres to organizational and department specific safety standards and guidelines.

Works collaboratively and supports efforts of team members.

Demonstrates exceptional customer service and interacts effectively with physicians, patients, residents, visitors, staff and the broader health care community.

Catholic Health Initiatives and its organizations are Equal Opportunity Employers.

job summary:
USSTRATCOM/J6 requires advisory and assistance support to interface with the Office of the Secretary of Defense (OSD), Joint Staff, Services, components, Combatant Commanders (CCDRs), and communities of interest (COIs) to ensure collaborative planning and situational awareness capability is available to all GAP CIE users. Additionally, contractors will assist current operation planners with tailored planning, orders development, dashboard development, and training support using capabilities within GAP CIE Assist in developing training/lesson plans and conduct user training sessions and facilitate the integration and synchronization of GAP CIE capabilities into Command and Joint exercises.

Tasks include:
Assist in system level testing and the development of required test documentation. Provide the Integrated Test Team (ITT) with technical level support ensuring test requirements are adequately defined.
Interface with users for testing and development of test objectives, and support user forums to identify, address, and correct deficiencies.
Assist in conducting GAP CIE user training sessions via remote (Defense Connect On-line (DCO) / DCS (Defense Collaboration Services)) and face-to-face to various users world-wide.

Requirements:
Knowledge (within the last 6 months is desired) of the Global Adaptive Planning Collaborative Information Environment (GAP CIE) to include: Deliberate planning, Crisis Action Planning (CAP), mission analysis, Plan Design and Assessment (PD&A;), course of action (COA) development, Joint Intelligence Preparation of the Operational Environment (JIPOE), Integrated Crisis Early Warning System (ICEWS), orders and message construction.

A minimum of one year of experience in areas directly related to Joint Operation Planning (Adaptive Planning, CAP, Mission Analysis, for example).

Possess expertise of USSTRATCOM, combatant command, and JFCC missions. The contractor must be able to operate independently and provide advisory and assistance inputs to the government customer at various DoD, combatant commander and JFCC level engagements, exercises, and professional forums.

Top Secret (TS) security clearance (SSBI/PR within the last 5 years) with eligibility for Sensitive Compartmented Information (TS/SCI) / Nuclear Command and Control (NC2) and Special Access Program (SAP) accesses.
For more than 36 years, MacAulay-Brown, Inc. (MacB) has been solving some of the Nation’s most complex National Security challenges. Defense, Intelligence Community, Special Operations Forces, Homeland Security and Federal agencies rely on our advanced engineering services and product solutions to meet the challenges of an ever-changing world. Join MacB where you will work a with team of highly experienced professionals in the areas of Intelligence, Cybersecurity, Research Development Test and Evaluation, Information Operations, fabrication, IT solutions, Logistics and Acquisition Management. MacB has won multiple workplace awards, offers generous salaries and benefits, and has outstanding growth opportunities.

job summary:
Entry Level Position with the Global Strike and Product Support (GSPS) software development team working for US Strategic Command creating Web-based and Java mission systems supporting the Intelligence, Global Strike, and Nuclear Planning communities. The qualified candidate will be mentored by experienced software engineers and learn Agile methodologies, web development best practices, Java Enterprise Edition (JEE) design patterns, object-oriented design, and secure software techniques.


The qualified candidate will work within teams of 3-6 software engineers to create / improve software systems within the Integrated Strategic Planning and Analysis Network (ISPAN) Mission Planning and Application System (MPAS) system of systems which assists USSTRATCOM with the development of nuclear and conventional kinetic/non-kinetic strike options.


Responsibilities will include software development, unit testing, design, debugging, defect correction, support to team peer reviews, and interaction with systems engineers, architects, and end users to understand the mission and system requirements for software tasks.


Basic Qualifications

- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or MIS from an accredited college / university (by start date).

- Ability to develop Web or Java code in a team environment

- Candidate must have excellent oral and written communication skills.


Desired skills

1) USSTRATCOM / DoD Experience

2) Experience with JavaScript (JQuery, Ext JS), CSS, and HTML

3) Experience with Java Enterprise Edition (JEE) or Spring Framework patterns

4) Experience with Object/Relational Mapping Framework (Hibernate / EclipseLink) or SQL

5) Experience with Web Services (REST / SOAP) or XML experience.

6) Experience with Object-Oriented Design.

7) Familiarity with development tooling Eclipse, GIT, Subversion, JUnit, JIRA


As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.


Join us at Lockheed Martin, where we’re engineering a better tomorrow.


Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

job summary:
Applications Support Subject Matter Expert - Exchange (Top Secret Clearance Required)-1546168


Description

Working at Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) is about leading and winning the right way – for customers, for employees, and as a global citizen. We offer our global workforce the opportunities to:


· Experience what it means to win as a professional.


· Discover a mosaic of career opportunities in a culture of open doors and open minds.


· Connect with colleagues who are the best and brightest in their fields.


· Collaborate with purpose to develop products and deliver services that will change the world.


· Be part of a socially and environmentally responsible, multicultural organization.


We are committed to conducting business with the highest integrity, which means working to benefit each community in which we operate. HPE is committed to winning the right way.


Hewlett Packard Enterprise is seeking highly motivated and qualified individuals to join our team in a broad variety of positions supporting a customer at Offutt AFB. The contract will provide mission critical, integrated, operational support for the IT infrastructure essential to the current and evolving missions for the customer.


The Applications Support Subject Matter experts will install, configure, service, repair, and maintain information technology systems in both a stand‐alone and client-server environment, including MS server and other authorized information technology systems. Install, configure, service, repair, and maintain hardware and software for network services, storage networking devices, and servers. Integrate multiple information systems in a networked environment, evaluate and resolve customer information system problems, effect required hardware upgrades and repair to maintain mission capability. Performs data backup and recovery.


Key Responsibilities:


•Serves as subject matter expert, possessing in-depth knowledge of Active Directory, SharePoint, and Exchange environments.


•Provides technical knowledge and analysis of highly specialized applications and operational environments, high-level functional systems analysis, design, integration, documentation and implementation advice on exceptionally complex problems that need extensive knowledge of the subject matter for effective implementation.


•Addresses problems of systems integration, compatibility, and multiple platforms.


•Consults with project teams and end users to identify application requirements.


•Assists in the evaluation and recommendation of application software packages, application integration and testing tools.


•Assists in performing product evaluations and recommends products/services.


•Analyzes, diagnoses, and repairs workstations, Internet connectivity, security services, and e-mail services. Works with outside vendors and support desks for third-party applications.


•Monitors and responds to hardware, software, and network problems.


•Utilizes software and hardware tools and identifies and diagnoses complex problems and factors affecting network performance.


•Ensures that all information systems are functional and secure.


•Complete electronic documentation of all work completed for change requests and incidents. Documentation shall be completed prior to closing out change request tasks and incidents


Qualifications 
Minimum Requirements:


•Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Information Systems, Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Science, Information Systems, or a related discipline, a minimum of 5 - 8 years relevant industry experience


•ITILv3 Foundation


•CompTIA Security+


**The candidate hired for this position must be a US Citizen with an active top secret security clearance with eligibility for SCI and with Nuclear Command and Control (NC2) eligibility.**


Desired Skills:


•Experience writing code using languages such as (and not limited to) COBOL, PL/1, Java, C, C++, C#, VB.Net.


•Experience with scripting languages, such as PowerShell and VBScript


•Ability to work with Web- development tools for new applications.


•Basic Understanding of RDBMS databases such SQL Server and Oracle. Basic understanding of modern software design and development methodologies.


•Strong understanding of modern SCM (software configuration management).


•Basic understanding of testing tools and unit and integration test scripting, and testing methodologies.


•Experience using an Integrated Development Environment (e.g., Eclipse, Visual Studio).


•Strong understanding basic Database Administration.


•Good verbal and written communication skills.


•Experience with each Java Scripting, Microsoft SharePoint Servers and SharePoint Designer, Adobe Flash


•Experience in data backup and recovery.


Job - Services 
Primary Location - United States-Nebraska-Offutt AFB 

Schedule - Full-time 
Shift - Day Job 
Travel - No 
Job Posting - Nov 10, 2016

job summary:
Braun Intertec is a 100% employee owned award-winning consulting firm offering geotechnical, environmental and testing solutions in the private and public sectors. Founded in 1957, the firm now has over 30 offices located across the Central United States and has consistently been recognized as a Top Workplace by Star Tribune and a Best Places to Work by Minneapolis/St. Paul Business Journal. We are committed to providing a challenging and rewarding environment that encourages employees to make full use of their knowledge, skills and abilities.

Braun Intertec is seeking students pursuing degrees in civil engineering, construction management, or related field to join our Lubbock, TX office for a 6 month co-op. Students will have the chance to get hands on experience in the testing of soils, bituminous materials, aggregates, and concrete materials. They will also be able to obtain Nuclear Density Gauge and ACI Certification while learning procedures as outlined in ASTM, AASHTO and DOT.

Opportunities:
Training throughout the Co-Op program includes comprehensive construction safety, nuclear density gauge and materials laboratory training

Hands-on application of classroom knowledge and theories to real construction situations

Mentoring from a licensed engineer and practical engineering applications to develop your professional role

Learn procedures and gain exposure to ASTM, AASHTO, ICC and DOT standards

Add to your professional résumé with experience and references from a well-respected engineering consulting firm

Competitive pay and the opportunity to work overtime

Required Skills

Have a valid driver's license and clean driving record

Ability to lift 50 pounds on a regular basis

Willing to travel up to 50% and overnight

Must be willing to work overtime and weekends as necessary

Required Experience

College student working toward civil engineering or construction management degree or related field

Some related work experience preferred, but will train top applicants

Must be able to commit to full-time employment for six months; from May to November/December

The successful candidate will be encouraged to expand their skills and certifications through company provided training and mentoring.

Braun Intertec is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer; AA/EEO/Veterans/Disability friendly employer.

job summary:
Granite Services International, Inc. (www.gsinc.com) helps power the world, building industries and creating solutions to some of our customers’ most complex energy problems. With offices in more than 50 countries, we are a global leader in providing field
service solutions to the power generation, oil & gas, nuclear, wind, and power & water segments.


We offer exciting career opportunities from technical and craft labor to marketing, IT and administrative positions. Field Service employees enjoy flexible and consistent work assignments; career progression, reward and recognition are central to our culture.
We develop people with classroom and on-the-job training, and through challenging work assignments that have long-lasting impact in the world.


Our excellent reputation is built on the foundation of our core values: Integrity, EHS, Quality and Productivity. If these are qualities you value, then join us in building and maintaining industries around the world. Granite is a wholly-owned affiliate of
General Electric (NYSE: GE).

SUMMARY


The Productivity Operations Manager III will examine the projected work scope to drive and implement recommendations around the number of ideal resources, hours, and expected cost, to achieve our targets for every highly-valued CS project. This position will
drive and implement standards to enhance productivity and reduce project cost. The Productivity Operations Manager III will provide mentorship to our regions in order to take the proper proactive actions to achieve hours and cost targets for all business units
globally.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:


• Develop and implement execution strategies to drive productivity and cost reduction without compromising safety, and quality

• Develop and implement targets for each highly-valued CS project based on technology, site configuration and scope of work

• Develop and implement processes in conjunction with the Business Operations department to ensure proper project set-up, tracking of man-hour targets, project costs, and a flawless reconciliation in order to facilitate value added analytics and reporting

• Develop and standardized processes to achieve cost-out targets through utilization of job cost estimates (JCE) and man-loaded schedules aligned to scope of work

• Examine and calibrate the projected work scope, resources, hours, and cost against the target for every highly-valued CSA project to ensure effective execution within the business targets

• Ensure Service Directors adhere to segment standards and Policy 6 guidelines to achieve proper cost allocation. This applies to all business units globally under a CSA agreement

• Examine total scope execution against schedules, crew size, JCE, and tools to optimize productivity

• Identify deviations of JCE’s against actuals and work with the Service Directors and Productivity Managers for each segment on implementing corrective actions

• Drive optimum CPH at the project level and develop trends with historical and projected data. Develop analytics to ensure CPH data is current and relevant to ongoing projects

• Work with the Business Operations Director to develop, implement, and manage productivity metrics in areas such as hours, labor cost structure, T&L;, Subcontractors, PPE, consumables for each of our segments and for every region

• Work with the regions to develop and maintain GSI’s market competitiveness strategy

• Collaborate, and Influence the Resource Management team to manage third party vendors to maximize effectiveness and minimize cost

• Influence GE’s productivity teams to ensure successful execution to meet business needs

• Establish and monitor key performance indicators to ensure business objectives are met

• Own and drive Best In Class Recognition Drive productivity through automation, best practice sharing , & Global standards as applicable

• Recognize new opportunities to leverage existing resources to new markets to align with the business climate (BOP, Boiler, other OEM)

• Ability to work under stressful circumstances with multiple deadlines and sometimes conflicting priorities and deadlines

• Perform other duties as assigned


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

General Electric (NYSE: GE).

SUMMARY


The Resource Planning Director I will make strategic business decisions to improve quality, enhance productivity, drive core teams, maximize utilization across segments/regions, and direct the hiring of Granite and third party resources. This position will
develop, own and execute a global resource pool strategy applicable to each segment to effectively maximize utilization and cross-utilization. The Resource Planning Director I will lead and develop a team of Resource Managers and liaise with the Recruiting
team to execute strategic business decisions regarding field recruitment. The Resource Planning Director I will create and implement target goals regarding performance evaluations; competencies, training costs, and utilization to ensure resources are used
effectively.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:


 Ensure global consistency in resource management fulfillment across the enterprise

 Develop, implement and drive company-wide, global field services strategies to maximize fulfillment, utilization, and cross-utilization of resources

 Develop a global resource pool strategy for each segment to improve fulfillment five

 Ensure readiness to serve for both near and long term commitments, while staying within the financial targets of the business, and adjust to market changes as needed

 Develop, manage and maintain an operational rhythm for effective supply vs. demand resource management strategies to determine fulfillment needs

 Monitor personnel headcount and hours worked across regions and segments to evaluate proper positioning relative to supply and demand in order to enable the regions to achieve our operating plan

 Establish and monitor key performance indicators to effectively utilize, integrate, and manage resources into our field services model, including subcontractors

 Use quantifiable metrics to determine and track changes of number and type of resources between the initially forecasted data, and the actual execution

 Direct field recruiting teams and initiatives to drive and optimize readiness to serve

 Partner with the technical training team to align training plans with future fulfillment demands

 Own and develop Resource Management Strategy per segment, including ROC rhythms

 Lead and develop a team of Resource Managers to liaise between operational requirements and recruitment teams and execute strategic business decisions relative to field recruitment

 Direct global field employee hiring through strategic global business hubs, to maximize utilization and reduce cost

 Use analytics to make strategic business decisions regarding ideal employee type ratios and hiring needs relative to forecasted fulfillment requirements

 Create and implement target goals for performance evaluations, competencies, training costs, and utilization to ensure resources are used effectively

 Determine and implement best practice strategies for third party optimization

 Partner with GE COE Resource Directors to maximize resource management effectiveness

 Focus on identifying customer issues and developing the strategic execution framework to solve those issues

 Perform other duties as assigned

 Strong knowledge of Power Generation products / services, processes, and organizational structures

 Customer facing experience (Internal or External)

 Some travel required

 English proficiency required

 Must have held prior leadership positions within the power generation industry with a minimum of 10 years combined field, project management and ten to fifteen years of managing direct reports

LEVEL: Professional IV

oil & gas, nuclear, wind, and power & water segments.

This role will is responsible for working with business stake holders to understand and document use cases and requirements for Identity, Provisioning, and Automation services. The key functions of this role include developing automated work flows, defining
the appropriate tool sets, leading the IDM initiative, identifying Key Performance Indicators (KPI), metrics reporting, defining Service Level Agreements (SLA), SLA compliance reports, and other efficiency improvements within IDM operations. Management and
support of the system will be crucial once the new IDM is deployed.

• Strong Knowledge of IT Governance and ITIL

• Experience with IT Operations cross functional process governance

• Knowledge of ServiceNow best practices

• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.


EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:


• Bachelor’s degree in a related technical field (or equivalent experience) 7-10 years experience in IT security or related field

• 5 years IT Support & Governance experience

• 5 years cross functional process management experience

• 5 years project management experience

• IDM process and technology implementation experience

• Automated work flow provisioning design experience

• Report definition for SLA, KPI, and metrics.

• The successful candidate will be someone who is has very strong IDM experience, has implemented IDM, can complete required documentation, and has the ability to implement a new solution while simultaneously building the team and processes.

job summary:
We’re looking for account managers from all different backgrounds to join our regional sales team. This is no ordinary sales job, as ours is a uniquely high performing and supportive working culture.


Who is Hilti?
If you’re new to the industry, you might not have heard of us. We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software, and services for the global construction sector. We have a proud heritage, built over 75 years, and a worldwide reputation for pioneering products and exceptional service. With some 23,000 people in more than 120 countries, we’re a great place for you to show us your worth as you learn, grow, and carve out your career.


What does the role involve?
As an account manager, you’ll be visiting our customers, wherever they’re busy working, to find out how we can help them. You could find yourself on construction sites and nuclear plants or in offices and warehouses.

Ours is a model of professional, consultative selling and it’s a really hands-on job. It means rolling up your sleeves to demonstrate some of the most pioneering products in the industry, while selling our state-of-the-art software along with all the services and aftercare that come with the Hilti name. Far from traditional cold calling, it’s about building relationships with warm and responsive customers and helping them find the most innovative and cost-efficient solutions for their needs.

You’ll work with some of the industry’s most trusted and innovative engineering products.


You’ll work with some of the industry’s most trusted and innovative engineering products.


What do we offer?
We’ll give you everything you need to excel in your role, including your own van full of tools and one-to-one coaching. You’ll enjoy a rare combination of autonomy and camaraderie, as you’ll manage your own book of business while being part of a friendly team.


We’ll give you lots of responsibility, including your own portfolio of customers and these might be trades experts, project managers, or company leaders. From there, we’ll trust you to do whatever it takes to deliver outstanding results. Go the extra mile and we’ll reward you with unrivaled training, development, and career opportunities as soon as you’re ready for the next challenge.


Day to day you’ll report to your regional sales manager, who will also be there to help you manage your career.


Why should you apply?
We have an excellent mix of people and some of our best account managers joined us with little or no construction experience. Success at Hilti is down to teamwork and ability, no matter what your background.


What you need is:
Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent work experience.
At least one year prior experience in customer service and/ or sales working directly with customers, preferred (either over phone or face-to-face)
Ability to thrive both independently and in a team environment.
Demonstrated ability to develop engaged customer relationships and effectively implement strategic concepts.
Excellent time and territory management skills.
Must be persuasive, sales driven, customer focused, and a team player.
Proficient computer skills including MS Office Suite, and smartphones.
Must maintain a professional business appearance in accordance with HNA dress policy at all times.
Career advancement may require domestic and/or global mobility.

A company vehicle is provided for carrying tools/fasteners for product demonstration purposes. Employee must have a valid US driver’s license and comply with HNA Fleet Safety Policy requirements.


As part of your interview process, we’ll take you on a day-in-the-life ‘field ride’ to give you a feel for the job and the caliber of our people. We’ll also pay for your travel to the interview.


Tempted to apply or find out more?

job summary:
Position: CEI Senior Inspector
Requisition Number: 2016-2610-25

S&ME;, Inc., an engineering and environmental services firm, is seeking a full-time, experienced, Transportation Technician (CEI Senior Inspector) for projects in the Central Florida region.
Responsibilities include: Performing highly complex technical assignments in construction layout; Developing and checking engineering computations; Coordinating and managing lower level technicians; Performing technical duties and inspecting transportation projects including roadway, bridge, port, rail, aviation and pedestrian construction projects, for conformance with plans, specifications and other contract documents; Observing and inspecting various contractors' operations which may include clearing and grubbing, erosion control, earthmoving, paving, concrete placement, bridge construction, pipe installation, traffic control, pavement markings, and utility relocations: Performing materials sampling and testing at specified frequencies for compliance with specifications and the owner's quality assurance program; Preparing daily work reports and performing a variety of calculations, computations, and documentation associated with transportation project inspection and material testing.
Other duties may include inspection of erosion control devices and permit compliance, verification of line and grade with survey equipment, preparing field books for contractor payment documentation, attending meetings, interacting with third party construction personnel, and performing DBE / EEO compliance.

Transportation Technicians are subject to both inside and outside environmental conditions and to various types of weather and field conditions, including heights, uneven terrain, highway traffic, hazards of highway construction sites and heavy equipment, and may travel/work extended hours, weekends and/or holidays.

Ability to routinely lift 40 to 50 lbs. required;
Math and technical writing skills.

job summary:
Candidate will support MIL-STD-882 DoD System Safety Program for missile system (both hardware and software). Primary responsibilities will include:

- Development and interpret of System Safety requirements / flow-down requirements

- Evaluate design for safety compliance

- Development of System Safety Program Plans (SSPP) & Hazardous Materials Management Plans (HMMP)

- Perform and/or support Hazard analyses such as System Hazard Analysis (SHA), Preliminary Hazard Analysis (PHA), Fault Tree Analysis (FTA), Functional Hazard Analysis (FHA) bent pin analysis/energy trace, Safety Assessment Reports (SAR), and Subsystem Hazard Analysis (SSHA)

- Conduct safety check lists and inspections

- Support design & test readiness reviews

- Review &influence; test procedures for safety

-Prepare data packages and briefing material for Weapon System Safety Review Board, Air Force Non Nuclear Munition Safety Board, Navy Weapon System Explosive Safety Review Board, Army Fuze Board, Navy Fuze and Initiation Systems Technical Review Panel, etc.

-Identify and maintain Critical Items List


Basic Qualifications

• System Safety experience with emphasis on developing/interpreting system safety requirements/flow-down requirements and performing safety hardware/software hazard analysis.

• Ability to obtain a Secret security clearance.

• Good written and oral communication skills.

• Strong computer skills including Microsoft Office.

• Ability to present findings to customers and management.

• Strong problem solving skills.


Desired skills

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or equivalent.

• Demonstrated experience in performing missile system safety analyses (e.g. System Hazard Analysis (SHA), Preliminary Hazard Analysis (PHA), Fault Tree Analysis (FTA), Threat Hazard

Assessment (THA), bent pin analysis/energy trace, & Flight Test Safety Assessment Reports (SAR)).

• Demonstrated experience in developing and sustaining System Safety Program Plans.

• Demonstrated knowledge, skill and experience in performing Software Safety analysis per AMCOM 385-17 and AOP 52.

• Demonstrated experience in the identification and maintenance of Safety Critical Items Lists

• Experience preparing for U.S Government Safety Review Boards (develop technical data package & presentation).

• Missile and/or launcher safety experience.

• Proficient with Microsoft Office products.

• Active Secret security clearance.

• Self-starter capable of performing assigned tasks with very little or no direction; interacts well with others.

• Good written and oral communication skills; experience presenting findings to customers and management.

• Analytical thinker with a demonstrated ability of solving complex problems which require ingenuity and innovation.

• Experience working in a matrix organization; ability to work with cross functional teams.


As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s team of 113,000 people works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in all 50 states and more than 570 facilities that span 70 countries.


Join us at Lockheed Martin, where we’re engineering a better tomorrow.


Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

job summary:
Since 1994 Surveying And Mapping, LLC (SAM) has had a clear focus on quality of work and customer satisfaction. Today, Surveying And Mapping has become an undisputed leader in providing geospatial solutions to a wide variety of industries. The firm has expanded from its initial offering of professional land surveying services, to include digital aerial mapping, terrestrial, mobile and airborne LiDAR services, hydrographic surveying, subsurface utility engineering (SUE), utility coordination and geographic information systems (GIS). The company also now has a wholly owned subsidiary, SAM-Construction Services, LLC (SAM-CS) that specializes in construction phase services.


09.08.2015- SAM is ranked No. 2 among the Top 100 geospatial companies in the U.S.


05.07.2015- SAM ranks 93 among Engineering News Record (ENR’s) Top 500 Design Firms


We are looking for experienced CEI Inspectors to join our growing team in our Orlando, FL office. As an Inspector for SAM, you will be performing construction engineering and inspection duties on highway and bridge construction projects for the Department of Transportation and local municipalities throughout Florida.


Duties & Responsibilities:
Perform highly complex technical assignments in field surveying and construction layout, making, and checking engineering computations, inspecting construction work, and conducting field tests Monitor the contractor’s on site construction activities and inspecting materials entering into the work to ensure compliance with plans, specifications and special provisions for the construction contract Maintain detailed records of the contractor’s daily operations and events that affect the work, monitoring and inspecting contractor’s work zone traffic control plan as well as reviewing modifications to the plan Perform sampling and testing of component materials and completed work in accordance with the construction contract

Required Experience - Education and Skills:
High school graduate or equivalent plus two (2) years of experience in construction inspection, one (1) years of which shall have been in bridge and/or roadway construction inspection; or Civil Engineering degree with the ability to earn additional required qualifications within one (1) year.

Must have the following: 
CTQP Concrete Field Technician Level I CTQP Asphalt Roadway Level I CTQP Earthwork Construction Inspection Level I CTQP Pile Driving Inspection CTQP Drilled Shaft Inspection IMSA Traffic Signal Technician Level I FDOT Intermediate MOT CTQP Final Estimates Level I Nuclear Radiation Safety Florida Stormwater, Erosion, and Sedimentation Control Training

We offer a best in class benefits package that includes company paid premiums for medical, vision, dental and life insurance. SAM provides a VERY generous 401 (k) plan, 401 (k) profit sharing AND performance-based bonuses. Come join our team of professionals that are leading the way for the surveying and construction industry!


SAM is an EOE/Affirmative Action Employer M/F/D/V. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAM and need special assistance to apply for a posted position, please contact (512) 685-3556 to leave a message or send an e-mail to hraccommodation@sam.biz.

job summary:
Responsible for coordination of the construction on the project. Coordinates compliance with the schedule, safety, cost, and quality decisions in conjunction with the Project Field Manager.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:

• Manages and coordinates all on-site subcontractor activities for compliance with the CPM schedule and monitors and enforces compliance with subcontract requirements; Implements the Project Construction Execution Plan. • Supervises and mentors all superintendents; monitors their activities and provides leadership. • Monitors and reports on construction productivity and schedule performance (including trends) to the Project Field Manager and Field Project Controls Manager. Takes actions necessary to meet project budget and schedule requirements. • Directs the establishment and implementation of subcontractor schedule recovery plans as required. • Coordinates the Construction Completion Walkdowns and the complete hand over of start-up packages to the Startup Manager and supervises the close out of all punch list items. • Assists Project Field Manager with client interface and relations. • Coordinates with Field Material Manager to review all site procured materials for acceptance. • Reviews and approves equipment rentals (if supplied by company) and coordinates shared use of this equipment with subcontractors. • Conducts weekly coordination meeting with subcontractors. • Conducts weekly subcontractor meetings. • Reports weekly schedule and commodity installation status to the Field Project Controls Manager. • Monitors all extra work authorization requests, backcharges, and supplier and subcontractor progress/final payment requests for acceptance and is responsible for subordinates providing the timely tracking information to Project Controls to support the change management system. • Adheres to Safety, Quality, Ethical Standards, Lessons Learned, and Performance Management programs in accordance with Division Policies, Standards, Guides, and Contractual commitments. • Directly responsible for the Division 8 labor charges and costs on direct hire projects. • Directly responsible for the Construction Equipment budget • Monitors and approve all CIR replies to the subcontractors. • Responsible for completion of the construction punchlist. • Has full knowledge of the safety program and acts as the Safety Representative on site in the absence of the regular Safety Supervisor. • Has general knowledge of all disciplines of construction and is able to stand in for each lead discipline. • Establishes the tool trailer list at the onset of the project. • Resolves safety and quality issues with the safety and quality managers. Further disputes are then deferred to the Project Field Manager. • Has the ability to stand in for the Project Field Manager in his absence. • Understands the major commercial and deliverable terms of the construction subcontracts and manages within these terms. • Monitors and controls overtime by his subordinates and subcontractors. • Writes the construction portion of the client and construction monthly report. • Coordinates with the Field Engineers or home office engineers on engineering deliverables • Responsible for the effective management of construction Manufacturer’s Service Technicians and the timesheet tracking. • Identifies and assesses improvement opportunities which will add value. Champions continuous improvement efforts. Assesses and supports the change management effects associated with the implementation of improvements. Proactively supports, encourages and facilitates staff to engage in continuous improvement activities. • Supervises work of others. Responsible for hiring, discipline, and pay administration of their subordinates. Supervises superintendents.


Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in construction, engineering or heavy industrial experience preferred, or 3+ years of experience at the superintendent level. 8+ years with a degree or 18+ years construction experience without degree with 2 of those years at equivalent construction manager 1 level.


All applicants must be able to complete pre-employment onboarding requirements (if selected) which may include any/all of the following: criminal/civil background check, drug screen, and motor vehicle records search, in compliance with any applicable laws and regulations.


Preferred Job Qualifications:

Preferred Competencies: • Knowledge of construction technology (Simple Cycle, Combined Cycle, Pulverized Coal, Circulating Fluidized Bed, Nuclear) • Knowledge of EPC industry • Constructability knowledge • Knowledge of project budget process and tools • Knowledge of department budget process and tools • Knowledge of Project controls • Risk assessment/management • Administrative policies and procedures • Construction Project Management Systems • Conceptual planning ability • Conflict management skills • Leadership ability (team building, coaching, mentoring, change management, advising) • Multi-tasking ability (prioritize, organize, schedule work) • Presentation skills • Problem solving skills (identify, analyze, research, evaluate, resolve) • Project management skills • Communication and meeting skills • Time reporting systems • Expense reporting policies and procedures

job summary:
Sodexo’s growing Clinical Technology Management Division is seeking a talented Field Service Imaging Engineer Level 3 to support our customer in the Orlando, FL area. The main role of the position will be to ensure all CTM related diagnostic imaging medical equipment is maintained in a quality and timely manner. The ideal candidate will have outstanding customer service and communications skill as well as a strong technical skills and a commitment to deliver excellent repair service in an expedient manner across the identified geographical area. Ideal candidates will possess:

Competency in troubleshooting/repairing and maintaining diagnostic imaging devices.
Understanding of regulatory requirements of medical devices
Proven success developing and sustaining vendor relationships
Ability to manage medical device life cycle plans

Ability to participate in on-call rotation schedule as required.
#CTM


Under minimal supervision of the General Manager, Clinical Technology Management (CTM) /Site Supervisor, inspect, repair, maintain, and calibrate all types of basic diagnostic imaging and/or therapeutic radiation equipment, devices, system, and instruments. Interact on a routine basis with other clinical health providers in the identification of technology-based problems and solution development. An IMAGING SERVICE TECHNICIAN III represents the highest level of technical expertise and possesses the ability to troubleshoot, repair, and maintain the full range of diagnostic and therapeutic inventory devices, instrumentation, and systems. The IMAGING SERVICE TECHNICIAN III will possess a substantial background of knowledge and experience and is expected to contribute to: corporate initiatives regarding improvement and development of policy and procedures; technical guidance in the selection and installation of medical/imaging equipment and systems; and staff development and mentorship. The IMAGING SERVICE TECHNICIAN III may work toward status of a Site Supervisor or GM, CTM by attaining significant proficiency in supervisory and administrative skills leading toward leadership positions.


Basic Education Requirement -Associates Degree in electronics, biomedical engineering, or related field.


Basic Management Experience - 2 years


Basic Functional Experience - 5 years in maintenance and repair of clinical devices.

job summary:
We’re looking for account managers from all different backgrounds to join our regional sales team. This is no ordinary sales job, as ours is a uniquely high performing and supportive working culture.


Who is Hilti?
If you’re new to the industry, you might not have heard of us. We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software, and services for the global construction sector. We have a proud heritage, built over 75 years, and a worldwide reputation for pioneering products and exceptional service. With some 23,000 people in more than 120 countries, we’re a great place for you to show us your worth as you learn, grow, and carve out your career.


What does the role involve?
As an account manager, you’ll be visiting our customers, wherever they’re busy working, to find out how we can help them. You could find yourself on construction sites and nuclear plants or in offices and warehouses.

Ours is a model of professional, consultative selling and it’s a really hands-on job. It means rolling up your sleeves to demonstrate some of the most pioneering products in the industry, while selling our state-of-the-art software along with all the services and aftercare that come with the Hilti name. Far from traditional cold calling, it’s about building relationships with warm and responsive customers and helping them find the most innovative and cost-efficient solutions for their needs.

You’ll work with some of the industry’s most trusted and innovative engineering products.


Our tools are chosen for projects ranging from earthquake-safe homes to some of the world’s tallest towers and fastest railways.


What do we offer?
We’ll give you everything you need to excel in your role, including your own van full of tools and one-to-one coaching. You’ll enjoy a rare combination of autonomy and camaraderie, as you’ll manage your own book of business while being part of a friendly team.


We’ll give you lots of responsibility, including your own portfolio of customers and these might be trades experts, project managers, or company leaders. From there, we’ll trust you to do whatever it takes to deliver outstanding results. Go the extra mile and we’ll reward you with unrivaled training, development, and career opportunities as soon as you’re ready for the next challenge.


Day to day you’ll report to your regional sales manager, who will also be there to help you manage your career.


Why should you apply?
We have an excellent mix of people and some of our best account managers joined us with little or no construction experience. Success at Hilti is down to teamwork and ability, no matter what your background.


What you need is:
Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent work experience.
At least one year prior experience in customer service and/ or sales working directly with customers, preferred (either over phone or face-to-face)
Ability to thrive both independently and in a team environment.
Demonstrated ability to develop engaged customer relationships and effectively implement strategic concepts.
Excellent time and territory management skills.
Must be persuasive, sales driven, customer focused, and a team player.
Proficient computer skills including MS Office Suite, and smartphones.
Must maintain a professional business appearance in accordance with HNA dress policy at all times.
Career advancement may require domestic and/or global mobility.

A company vehicle is provided for carrying tools/fasteners for product demonstration purposes. Employee must have a valid US driver’s license and comply with HNA Fleet Safety Policy requirements.

As part of your interview process, we’ll take you on a day-in-the-life ‘field ride’ to give you a feel for the job and the caliber of our people. We’ll also pay for your travel to the interview.


Tempted to apply or find out more?
