education level/skills required / respon: The Logistician II will assist in coordinating with other engineering and logistic support organizations to obtain technical information to support staging and...
job summary:
The Logistician II provides logistic support for the installation, testing, operation, maintenance, and configuration control of Combat Systems (CS) Non-Propulsion Electronic Systems (NPES) equipment. The Logistician II will identify planning and logistic issues associated with Ship, Submersible, Ballistic, Nuclear/Attack Submarine/ Ship, Submersible, Guided Missile, Nuclear (SSBN/SSN/SSGN) maintenance and operation. The Logistician II will assist in coordinating with other engineering and logistic support organizations to obtain technical information to support staging and the statusing of Command and Control System (CCS)/NPES logistics for engineering changes, modifications, and problem reports during SSBN/SSN/SSGN maintenance and operation periods.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:


Perform reviews of CCS modification documentation to identify logistic support requirements.
Perform database support for the staging and status tracking of logistic materials.
Receive inventories, distribute, and coordinate CCS and NPES hardware, software, and logistic support items.
Maintain excellent professional relationships with Government and commercial clients.
Use desktop computers in performance of duties. This includes working knowledge of software such as Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel,Access, WordPerfect, etc.
Travel, work at other TSM and Government sites, and perform other duties as may be required by management.
Comply with TSM's Standard Procedure and DoD 5220-22-M, Safeguarding Classified Information, when dealing with classified information.
Comply with policies and procedures as set forth in the company’s Handbook of Policy and Procedure.
Comply with the provisions of the corporation’s Standard Practice Procedures manual and DoD 5220.22-M when handling classified information to include generating, marking, storing, handling, and destroying of classified material.
Work, cooperate, and communicate, as directed by the Site Manager, with supervisors, team leaders, and coworkers satisfactorily. This includes the professional, mature acceptance of constructive criticism.
QUALIFICATIONS FOR POSITION: ​


Minimum educational requirement is a High School diploma or GED certificate with seven (7) years of professional experience in Integrated Logistics Support (ILS). A Bachelor's degree in any field may be substituted for three (3) years of professional experience.
A total of four (4) years of cumulative specialized experience in at least two (2) of the following areas is required (qualifying experience consists of one (1) year or more in any single area):
Armed forces ILS training
ILS support for a modern, complex, military system
Status accounting for a modern, complex, military system
The professional and specialized experience requirements above may have been acquired simultaneously.
Must possess or have the ability to obtain a Secret Government security clearance.


Equal Opportunity Statement

Xator Corporation provides equal opportunity to all applicants for employment as required by and/or consistent with applicable country law and company policy. Consistent with the foregoing, Xator Corporation provides qualified applicants consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veterans’ status, citizenship, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other status(s) protected by law. In the United States, Xator Corporation ensures nondiscrimination in all programs and activities in accordance with Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964.

education level/skills required / respon: Diagnostic ultrasound, nuclear medicine, C-Arm, Mobile X-Ray, R&F, CT, and/or MRI equipment. The Clinical Engineering Department supports equipment from OR...
job summary:
As the region's only Level I Trauma center, Harborview Medical Center (HMC) is well known for innovations and excellence in trauma care and its centers of emphasis: Trauma, Burn, Neurosciences, and mentally-and medically- vulnerable populations. In addition to the centers of emphasis, HMC serves a mission population for King County. Harborview employees are committed to the vital role the institution plays in the immediate community, as well as the entire Northwest region. HMC is owned by King County and managed by the University of Washington (UW) and serves as a training site for UW’s School of Medicine. The UW is proud to be one of the nation’s premier educational and research institutions. Our people are the most important asset in our pursuit of achieving excellence in education, research, and community service. Our staff not only enjoys outstanding benefits and professional growth opportunities, but also an environment noted for diversity, community involvement, intellectual excitement, artistic pursuits, and natural beauty.

Our Clinical Engineering Department has an outstanding opportunity available for an Imaging Biomedical Electronics Technician III with experience supporting and maintaining complex medical equipment. The Clinical Engineering Department supports equipment from OR tables and monitoring systems, to complex surgical systems and imaging equipment. Employing twenty staff, the Department has a great professional and team environment supporting over 16,000 individual devices worth over $100 million.


This BMET III position will focus on maintaining critical medical equipment systems and imaging technology for the department, including rotating through an on-call schedule with the Biomedical and Radiology BMET teams.

…


REQUIREMENTS:


Requirements:

• To perform this job successfully, an individual should possess the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed and meet the amount of education, training, and/or work experience required.

• One year of experience as a Biomedical Electronics Technician II OR Five years of experience as a biomedical electronics technician OR equivalent education/experience.

• Associate’s degree in electronics or biomedical equipment technology is highly desirable, as well as a minimum of five years’ related experience in the repair and maintenance of medical equipment.

• An equivalent combination of education and experience may be substituted.

• Demonstrate competency related to the use of service and repair manuals including understanding of operating instructions, service diagrams, flow charts and schematics.

• Considerable knowledge of electronic circuitry and technical aspects of the operation, repair, and maintenance of electronic equipment.

• Considerable knowledge of the application and repair of computers and servers and how they interface with medical equipment.

• Basic knowledge of networking theory.

• Substantial knowledge of basic anatomy, physiology, and medical terminology.

• Ability to analyze, repair, and test electronic and electromechanical equipment.

• Ability to interpret schematics, wiring diagrams, and illustrated parts drawings of biomedical instrumentation.

• Ability to perform preventive maintenance inspections.

• Ability to run diagnostic programs.

• Ability to maintain accurate records of repairs, calibration, and tests.


DESIRED:


Desired:

• Perform preventive and corrective maintenance on imagining equipment to include, but not limited to: Diagnostic ultrasound, nuclear medicine, C-Arm, Mobile X-Ray, R&F;, CT, and/or MRI equipment.

• Utilize the current Computer Maintenance Management System to maintain records of work performed.

• Interact with vendors to provide specialized service or order parts necessary to maintain equipment.

• Provide follow-up communications to equipment end-user on the status of repairs and/or to provide training to end users as necessary.

• Participate in radiology equipment set-up and installation as necessary.

• Participate with regular “On-Call” schedule.

• Demonstrate competency related to the use of test equipment used in maintenance and troubleshooting of radiographic/imaging equipment.

• Knowledge of practices and procedures, methods, tools and materials used in the use, repair, and maintenance of radiographic/imaging equipment.

• CRES certification preferred.

• Good communication and computer skills. Networking skills are desirable.

• Knowledge of TCP/IP networking fundamentals / Routing / and associated equipment

• Strong interpersonal and communication skills required


CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT:


Generally good working conditions

• Ability to lift up to 50 pounds of equipment; to push/pull equipment carts; and to kneel, stand, bend, and reach during equipment repair.

• Skill in manual dexterity, hand-to-eye coordination, and color vision.

• Possible hazards include exposure to electrical shock, ionizing radiation, chemicals and chemical fumes, high-pressure air, infectious disease, and various other hazards associated with biomedical engineering work.

• Protective clothing and safe work practices are required.

• Rotating through on-call schedule.


The University of Washington is a leader in environmental stewardship & sustainability , and committed to becoming climate neutral.


The University of Washington is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer.
To request disability accommodation in the application process, contact the Disability Services Office at 206-543-6450 / 206-543-6452 (tty) or dso@uw.edu .

job summary:
Perform maintenance, troubleshooting and repair of Electronic Security Systems (ESS) in support of the Nuclear Weapons Security (NWS) mission of the US Navy. Work will mostly be performed in the field in the high-security environment of the Strategic Weapons Facilities (SWF) Pacific (PAC). Daily tasks will include critical ESS maintenance activities which require careful discipline, procedural rigor and teamwork. Tasks will also include formal and on-the-job training to learn new security systems, tracking of maintenance activities, and management of parts and spares.


Keyword\\Phrases Include :

Naval Systems, Electro-Mechanical, Nuclear Weapons, SWFPAC, SWFLANT, Hydraulic Maintenance, Submarines, Security, Schematics, Ability to Read Blue Prints, Marine Environment, Assemble and Test.


Basic Qualifications

- Must possess knowledge and experience with testing, maintaining, troubleshooting and repairing of electromechanical systems and sensors

- Ability to read and interpret technical drawings, blueprints and instructions

- Demonstrated ability to work successfully as part of a team

- Must be physically able to lift 45 lbs, climb vertical ladders and exhibit manual dexterity to work in a variety of field locations and facilities

- Must pass pre-employment physical exam and drug screening

- Must be able to qualify for, obtain and maintain Personnel Reliability Program (PRP) certification

- Must be able to obtain Secret Clearance

- Rotational swing shift assignments required


Desired skills

- Experience with advanced security systems and sensor maintenance in a military environment

- Mechanical experience including hydraulics maintenance and repair

- Organizational skills and the ability to work to a schedule and meet deadlines

- Demonstrated work ethic and desire to excel at assigned tasks

- Experience with maintenance information systems, maintenance instructions/forms and supply chain management

- Ability to occasionally be on-call during evenings, weekends and holidays


As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s team of 113,000 people works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in all 50 states and more than 570 facilities that span 70 countries.


Join us at Lockheed Martin, where we’re engineering a better tomorrow.


Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

job summary:
JENSEN HUGHES is interested in speaking to talented PRA engineers with nuclear experience to support risk management activities. We have opportunities from the greater Seattle, WA area to the Philadelphia, PA area. The position joins the Power Services Group of JENSEN HUGHES, a premier nuclear safety and reliability consulting firm.


Join a dynamic team that provides technical consulting to a wide variety of engineering projects, which range from day-to-day nuclear power plant operation to cutting edge research and development in all areas related to plant safety. The onsite risk management/probability risk assessment engineer functions as part of an overall corporate risk management team, interfacing with plant staff on all risk management applications. Specific work tasks include supporting Maintenance Rule implementation, advising work planners on scheduling of maintenance activities to minimize risk, and responding to emergent plant risk management activities and risk issues.


Applicants should be self starters interested in taking their career to the next level of consulting and delivering novel solutions for nuclear plant systems and operations. Experience with probabilistic risk assessment is desirable, as is experience with plant risk management activities.


Requirements:

BS/MS in Nuclear, Chemical, Industrial, Electrical, Mechanical, Safety or related Engineering degree from a US Accredited program.
5-15+ years experience at a BWR or PWR commercial nuclear power plant
Strong knowledge of nuclear plant systems and operations
Excellent communication skills and ability to present to small teams or groups
Willingness to travel
Pre-employment physical/drug testing and background check is required
Due to the nature of our business, we are required to comply with U.S. Export laws,which place restrictions on the transfer of knowledge outside the United States. As a result of this, it is necessary for us to know thecountry(s) in which you hold citizenship status. If you are a foreigncitizen, please indicate your U.S. Visa/immigration status in the application.

education level/skills required / respon: Our engineers have advanced engineering degrees with a number of years experience in the engineering consulting business....
job summary:
We are currently looking for a high frequency electromagnetics engineer to join our team.


The position would focus on high frequency electromagnetics analysis using ANSYS HFSS, SIWave, and Simplorer with a range of applications (e.g. antennas, RF and microwave, signal integrity...). The engineer would also be expected to learn low frequency analysis (electric machines, actuators, sensors, wireless transfer) and system level modeling with ANSYS Simplorer. Depending on the skills and interest of the engineer, the role could also involve thermal coupled multiphysics models with FEA or CFD tools.


About us:


We are a major supplier of the ANSYS family of products to leading companies in the USA and Canada. Our customers rely on us to help them become more productive, improve their engineering processes, and help them thrive in today's competitive market. We have become a valued partner and a key member of their engineering teams.


We are an exciting group and are a growing simulation technology company with employees located in 10 strategic locations around the country. 
We are committed to the success of our customers. We work hand-in-hand with them to increase their simulation productivity and fidelity, enabling the development of advanced products and/or manufacturing processes


Culture and Management Philosophy


We are not only a equal opportunity employer offering a stimulating and challenging environment, but likely the most interesting place that you will ever work. This allows each person to exploit his/her full potential and push the limits of their expertise. We also encourage our employees to develop their competencies and the recognition of such is part of the DNA of the company. Each member of our staff is a simulation expert who also maintains an expertise in one or more specialized fields. Our engineers have advanced engineering degrees with a number of years experience in the engineering consulting business. We maintain a high level of professionalism in a friendly, cooperative environment. Our company aspires to be recognized as an outstanding employer.


Though we consider ourselves a 'Sales' organization, our technical team comprises over half of our staff, with a significant number of them having advanced engineering degrees. We are involved in almost every industry ranging from mining to oil & gas, from automotive to aerospace, from electronics to nuclear, from marine to medical... We place a strong value on our staff. The more they develop, the more they can work with our customers. We have grown our organization by making our customers successful.


Position Profile


The engineer provides technical and sales support along with performing training and consulting projects. The role involves sharing enthusiasm for ANSYS simulation tools to existing or potential customers. The engineer will provide technical expertise to the account manager and the customers to assess analysis needs related to development, design, and problem solving with ANSYS software to develop the market and to provide high quality customer service. The engineer will also be responsible for completing challenging consulting projects and keeping up with the latest simulation technology. The mix of different tasks and wide variety of applications makes for a work environment that is never boring.


Education:


Bachelor in electrical engineering or equivalent 
Master or Ph.D. in electrical engineering or equivalent is considered a plus


Professional Experience


Three (or more) years experience in applied electrical engineering simulation or in research with a strong focus on ANSYS HFSS 
Experience with multiple applications including analysis of antennas, EMI/EMC, and signal integrity is ideal 
Solid theoretical background in high frequency electromagnetic fields, circuits, and numerical methods


US/Canadian Citizenship or Permanent Residents preferred


Other advantageous experience includes:


Design/analysis of low frequency electronics (e.g. electric machines, transformers, solenoids...) 
System level modeling expertise (Simplorer or similar) 
Interest in thermal simulation in CFD or FEA (CFX, Fluent, Icepak, ANSYS) 
Interest in multiphysics (e.g. electromagnetic, structural, thermal, fluids, acoustics...) 
Ability to use 3-D CAD to build or simplify modelsOptimization and DOE methods 
Basic scripting/programming skills in any of the following: J-script, Python, C#, VB, .Net, C++ 
Familiarity with computers and operating systems


Abilities & Competencies


Excellent ability to communicate (both written & verbal) is essential 
Strong interpersonal skills 
Able to learn and incorporate theoretical, technical, and practical concepts quickly 
Capable to analyze problems and propose practical solutions 
Strong work ethic 
Creativity and flexibility 
Meticulous and detail oriented 
Capability to multi-task 
Capable of working in a team or individual environment 
Self starter 
Dislikes repetition


Responsibilities


Performs numerical simulations for consulting projects in a wide range of applications 
Visit customers to assess technical needs & communicate with the sales team 
Propose technical solutions to customers 
Demonstrate to customers/prospects the capability of the software 
Present technical seminars over web and in person 
Solve technical support requests related to simulation software usage 
Conceive custom applications related to the customer activity 
Write analysis reports and other technical documents 
Prepare and deliver training on ANSYS tools 
Minimal travel will be required with the majority of it in the local office region. Occasional short travel to further locations may occur.


If you are selected to join us, you will become a key member of our technical staff and will work and learn in a challenging technical environment. Success will be measured not only by helping to grow our simulation business, but also by continued development of your own technical skills by solving challenging problems in a wide variety of industries.


Location: Denver, CO or Seattle, WA

job summary:
General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS), a market leader and technology innovator, is seeking talented professionals to deliver cutting edge solutions to our customers.


General Dynamics Mission Systems has an immediate opening for an Entry Level Electro-Mechanical Engineer to join our Nuclear Weapons Security team. The position provides an opportunity to develop and advance the cutting-edge technology that supports some of our nation's fundamental defense services. General Dynamics Mission Systems employees work closely with esteemed clients to develop solutions that allow them to carry out high-stakes national security missions.


The selected candidate will work with collaborative teams to design and development the systems, processes and tools that support internal and client operations. In addition to receiving a competitive salary and generous health and personal benefits, the Entry Level Electro-Mechanical will enhance their skill set among a talented and technically accomplished group of colleagues. The employee will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded.


Key Responsibilities


Entry Level Electro-Mechanical Engineers design systems, software and equipment layout, as well as develop test plans and preventive maintenance programs for General Dynamics Mission Systems and its customers. These employees are responsible for the development, implementation, installation, testing, modification and operation of a variety of complex equipment and systems. Individuals who fill this role also serve as company liaisons with customers on administrative and technical matters. Additionally, these individuals assist customers with the operation and maintenance of GDMS systems. Team members also provide technical expertise to users and company personnel both domestically and internationally.


Additional Responsibilities

Exercise creative thinking and ideation to advance our business performance.
Deliver innovative, flexible, integrated solutions to meet customers changing business needs.
Support and engage in programs, projects and practices behind the General Dynamics Mission Systems culture and strategy, and comply with all policies and procedures.
Follow industry and department trends and developments to ensure General Dynamics Mission Systems services are consistent with, and/or superior to, industry best practices.

Basic Qualifications:
Candidates must demonstrate a passion for innovation, a sophisticated understanding of systems engineering and analysis, and the ability to effectively develop and evolve General Dynamics Mission Systems technology. The Entry level Electro-Mechanical Engineer position requires a bachelor's degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering or in a related specialized area or the equivalent, and zero to two years of related experience. Applicants with a master's degree also qualify.


Department of Defense Secret security clearance is preferred at time of hire. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Additionally, applicants must meet the eligibility requirements for a controlled billet in accordance with DoD Instruction 5210.42 Nuclear Weapons Personnel Reliability Program (PRP). Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.


Required Skills:

Examine, prepare and verify technical drawings/documents and specifications to ensure that installation and operations conform to standards and customer requirements. Analyze engineering sketches, specifications and related data and drawings to determine design factors. Direct validation and verification testing of products and systems. Direct and coordinate deployed security systems support, documentation, testing, and failure analysis activities to ensure compliance with specifications, and customer requirements. Proficient in technical writing (technical manuals, test plans, implementation plans, etc.) Review project documentation to resolve discrepancies and compile required changes to work instructions and other program related processes. Upon hire, ability to maintain favorable standing in the Navy's Personnel Reliability Program as indicated in the basic qualifications. Be able to lift/carry 40 lbs.

Qualifications (Preferred):
Experience with IDS software such as Vindicator, AIM, Hirsch, etc… Additional IT industry certifications (MCSE, MCSA, MTA, CCNP, Linux+, CAP, etc…) Experience with configuration management (CM) frameworks (processes and software) Experience physical and electronic security systems design and evaluation

Company Overview:
General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation. With a global team of 13,000 top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency. We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high performance team!


General Dynamics is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/Disability/Veteran.

education level/skills required / respon: Navy Nuclear Trained Electriciansmates - with 8-12 years of service. 8-12 years of service in the Navy Nuclear Power program as an EM....
job summary:
Navy Nuclear Trained Electriciansmates - with 8-12 years of service. The hiring team will consider first tour (6 years minimum) nuclear trained EMs if they have post-Navy experience in an industrial electrical field.


While this position location is for the Seattle area, you can live anywhere in the greater Pacific Northwest, including all areas in the states of WA, OR and ID.


Commissioning Engineer - Electrical

As a commissioning team member, provide engineering and technical support to plan, schedule, coordinate and execute full life cycle commissioning of Critical Facilities. Clients exist in both the private and federal sectors and encompass commissioning for Financial, Healthcare and mission critical facilities. This position will allow the engineer to participate in the Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) design process, witness the static and dynamic testing of complex mechanical, electrical and controls systems and operate the system in normal, maintenance and failure modes of operations.


Responsibilities:

- Assist in the development of Commissioning Plans

- Review shop drawings/submittals.

- Develop MEP Test and Operating procedures

- Respond to RFIs when requested by Project Management team.

- Assist in the static and dynamic testing of UPS, Emergency Power, Generators, central mechanical plants, chillers, cooling towers, pumps, precision HVAC systems, life safety and controls systems.

- Interact with contractors, interpret design and specifications. Review workmanship and general coordination as required.

- Work with clients to resolve problems within the scope of the design.

- Conduct site observation surveys and prepare field reports on the status of projects and completion of projects with respect to compliance to the plans and specifications.

- May monitor performance of contractors.

- Act as project coordinator with other field engineers, coordinating printing, presentation and administration procedures.

- Other duties as assigned.


Qualifications:

8-12 years of service in the Navy Nuclear Power program as an EM. The hiring team will consider first tour (6 years minimum) nuclear trained EMs if they have post-Navy experience in an industrial electrical field (or similar experience)


This company provides independent third party commissioning services, and they are an AABC Certified commissioning authority (CxA).


You will verify the reliability of all components and systems within client facilities in order to provide documented confirmation that will fulfill the functional and performance requirements of the owner, occupants, and operational staff. With a focus on mission critical facilities, the experienced staff routinely faces unique challenges and high levels of equipment complexity, and they are knowledgeable with respect to problems that can hinder successful operation of these facilities.


Types of Facilities Commissioned:

Data Centers, Command Centers, Server Farms, MDF/IDF Rooms, Health Care Facilities, Hospitals, Research Facilities, Laboratories, Clean Rooms, FAB Plants, Bio-Chemical Facilities, LEED Facilities, Office Buildings, Central Plants

Our commissioning team works with the design and construction team to document and ensure the intent of the owner is carried out throughout the five phases of commissioning process.


This company has a significant level of industry knowledge and highly experienced people in the field, we are able to aid the designers, contractors, and vendors in delivering a quality product and minimizing the time and budget impacts commonly experienced during complex projects.


Compensation

- Competitive Salaries in the $65-75k range for individuals coming right out of the US Navy nuclear service. With industry experience the base compensation can start out at a higher level - all based on the interview results

- Merit Increase Opportunities


In addition to the excellent compensation, this position offers comprehensive health benefits. They understand the importance of maintaining good health and planning for retirement. The company's total rewards package includes the following:


Comprehensive health care benefits for employees and dependents

- Choice of medical plans from United Healthcare

- Dental Coverage

- Vision Coverage

- Prescription Drug Coverage

- Short Term Disability

- Long Term Disability

- Accidental Death & Dismemberment Insurance

- Life Insurance

- Section 125 Flexible Spending Plan for uninsured medical and dependent care expenses

- Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

AFLAC Supplemental Insurance

- Supplemental Life Insurance Plans

- Sick Policies

- Accident Policies


Paid Time Off (PTO)

- Nine Paid Holidays

- Bereavement Leave

- PTO Program Based on Professional Experience (3-5 weeks)


Retirement Plan

- 401(k) plan offered through The Hartford

- Traditional pre-tax option

- Roth 401(k) option

- No vesting schedule


Professional Development

- Tuition Assistance Program

- Professional Membership/License Reimbursements


Interested candidates should upload resumes to the Power-Careers website as well as contact Derek Hayes with Target Professional Services, directly at (814) 446-6188, or by sending him an e-mail to: targetpsinc(at)aol.com.

education level/skills required / respon: Maintain Clinical Engineering expertise through ongoing training and education. The Imaging Engineer II installs, inspects, troubleshoots, repairs, calibrates,...
job summary:
The Imaging Engineer II installs, inspects, troubleshoots, repairs, calibrates, and verifies the performance of complex medical imaging equipment including, but not limited to, general radiographic rooms, R/F, portables, C-arms, mammography, Nuclear Medicine, CR, DR, ultrasound, bone density, and all supporting equipment. This position is required to be familiar with many classes of clinical equipment and may perform maintenance on equipment outside these specialty areas. The Imaging Engineer ensures regulatory compliance, assists in inventory management, and may serve as an advisor to other TriMedx personnel on technical matters concerning specialty equipment. The individual demonstrates adherence to the TriMedx core values in all professional interactions by showing respect to all people, creating real value, initiating meaningful change, and exhibiting integrity.


Responsibilities
Technical Service (40%)
Perform performance assurance (PA) inspections, scheduled maintenance, and operation verification procedures (OVP) on complex medical imaging equipment
Repair, install, and calibrate complex medical imaging equipment
Inform supervisors of the status of repairs, scheduled inspections, unusual equipment situations, and any customer concerns
Work with, direct, and document the activities of subcontractors, vendors, and outside service technicians to ensure proper service delivery
Maintain Clinical Engineering expertise through ongoing training and education
Assist with Service Operations Special Projects as assigned and contribute to the development of others through mentoring and sharing expertise Regulatory Compliance (25%)
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of the equipment database to include the inventory, performance assurance (PA) schedules, nomenclature, and service history
Adhere to the Medical Equipment Management Plan (MEMP), including all regulatory agency compliances and other applicable policies and procedures
Responsible for ensuring all service and documentation is complete, timely, and accurate
Work with Medical Physicist on accurate and aligned radiation outputs to ensure regulatory compliance and patient safety Account Relationship Management (25%)
Build and maintain customer relationships
Discuss equipment status and functionality with clinicians
Adhere to the Mission, Vision, and Values of the organization(s) served.
Provide a positive representation of TriMedx services by integrating the core values into job performance Inventory (10%)
Perform periodic inspections of current inventory status and maintain common failure parts inventory to ensure equipment uptime
Verify the completion of security analysis for new customer equipment
Performs Incoming Inspections (II) to maintain a complete and accurate inventory of medical devices, including trial and evaluation, rental, and loaner equipment in addition to permanently assigned equipment inventory
Maintain the accuracy and integrity of the equipment database to include inventory, performance assurance (PA) schedules, nomenclature, and service history
Make recommendations regarding inventory

Qualifications
Education and Work Experience
Associates degree in a technical/electronics field or equivalent military training required
Minimum 3 years experience in the repair, maintenance, troubleshooting, and installation of medical imaging equipment
Valid drivers license required; variable travel requirements depending on primary site that may require use of personal vehicle Knowledge
Complex computer skills including the ability to interpret error codes, defragment hard-drives, replace power supplies, and interpret computer codes required
Knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel) and networking applications required
Ability to integrate information from a variety of sources
Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills
Strong written, verbal, and presentational communication skills

Options

education level/skills required / respon: Bachelor’s degree in Nuclear Engineering preferred. Minimum of 3 years reactor engineering experience in the nuclear industry or 5 years of related professional...
job summary:
This is an open position with FirstEnergy Nuclear Operating Company (FENOC), a subsidiary of FirstEnergy Corp. [DBN]


The work associated with this position includes:
- Developing reactivity plans for power maneuvers.
- Monitoring reactor core operation and performing applicable testing.
- Conducting start-up physics testing.
- Supporting / Coordinating new fuel receipt and tracking special nuclear material.
- Providing control room support during power changes and responding to control room concerns related to the reactor core
operations.
- Preparing and reviewing procedures associated with reactor core operation and nuclear fuel management.
- Initiating, investigating, and correcting problems within the FENOC Corrective Action Program.
- Interfacing with and coordinating activities performed by internal and external engineering organizations and consulting service
companies.


- Managing and completing assigned activities to support timely implementation of required plant operations.
- Interfacing with customers to identify needs and providing engineering solutions to facilitate operational effectiveness.
- Working independently as well as in a team environment.
- Performing Emergency Response Organization (ERO) duties as assigned.


Qualifications
- Bachelor’s degree in Engineering required. Bachelor’s degree in Nuclear Engineering preferred.
- Minimum of 3 years reactor engineering experience in the nuclear industry or 5 years of related professional level engineering
experience in a non-nuclear utility industry is required.
- Deliver quality, accurate work within established deadlines.
- Excellent written and oral communication skills, including the ability to make formal technical presentations to various
management levels.
- Proficient with Microsoft Office programs, including Word, Excel, Access and PowerPoint.
- Ability to occasionally work back shift or extended hours, based on plant needs.
- Must reside within site-specific ERO response time.

job summary:
This is an open position within Davis-Besse Nuclear Power Station, a subsidiary of FirstEnergy Corp. [DBN]


As an Engineering Co-op, you will also have the opportunity to participate in the Co-op/Intern Professional Development
Program, which is designed to cultivate professional skills and provide professional level work at FirstEnergy. Each participant
will receive a personalized development plan, on-the-job training, and challenging assignments to refine skills and round out
competencies. Based on your Engineering discipline, as well as the department and projects you are assigned to, selected
candidates may:


- Support qualified program engineers in developing new engineering programs, including revising and developing procedures,
performing field walk downs and verifying inputs to the new programs
- Support the qualified Equipment Qualification (EQ) engineer in revisions to the EQ maintenance packages
- Perform equipment reviews in support of the Maintenance Rule Program owner and of the Maintenance Rule Program
improvement actions


- Assist qualified engineers in developing design modification packages
- Support qualified system engineers in the continued effort to maintain the station's current maintenance strategy
- Provide support to system engineers with single point vulnerability reviews
- Assisting in the development of life cycle management plans for large capital equipment
- Support the conversion of engineering test procedures into operations test procedures and maintenance test procedures


Qualifications
- Must be enrolled in a four (4) year accredited college / university in a degree program focused on Mechanical Engineering
- Maintain a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5 or better
- Must have the ability to work without sponsorship (now or in the future)
- Ability to commit to a minimum of two (2) CO-OP rotations
- Must be willing to relocate to / reside near Oak Harbor, Ohio for the duration of the assignment
- Successful completion of basic engineering coursework
- Must be able to work in both an office and plant environment with the ability to comply with safety procedures
- Experience with Microsoft Office applications and computer-aided design programs
- Positive communication skills (verbal and written) as well as organizational skills to prioritize and plan work, multi-task and
meet project deadlines
- Ability to work independently or in a team environment with minimal supervision
- Ability to use analytical skills to resolve problems and think creatively

protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with a disability. No recruiters or agencies without a previously signed

education level/skills required / respon: Mechanical Engineering from ABET accredited engineering program. This position requires performing project management and engineering functions on assigned...
job summary:
The Kansas City Plant is a U.S. Department of Energy, National Nuclear Security Administration facility managed and operated by Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T;). Our primary business is to manufacture sophisticated mechanical, electronic and engineered materials components for our nation’s defense systems. Our goal is to seek innovative solutions that surpass our customer’s expectations. All positions in FM&T; require U.S. citizenship and ability to obtain and maintain a government security clearance.


Honeywell FM&T; is on the leading edge of supplying engineering and manufacturing expertise for our nation’s defense and national security. This position requires performing project management and engineering functions on assigned projects or sub-projects by applying standard mathematical, physical science, and/or mechanical engineering technologies.


This Mechanical Engineer opportunity will fulfill a technical role in the Machined Products business within our Mechanical Products organization. Engineers in this organization provide engineering support of complex mechanical assemblies and precision machined products. This engineer will perform project management, manufacturing support, machining process development, part evaluations, and support quality control functions. While in this position, the engineer will have developmental opportunities for increasing roles of project responsibilities and management. Mentor opportunities for professional growth will be provided.

education level/skills required / respon: This engineering opportunity will fulfill a technical role in the Purchased Product Engineering business within our Electrical Products organization....
job summary:
The Kansas City Plant is a U.S. Department of Energy, National Nuclear Security Administration facility managed and operated by Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T;). Our primary business is to manufacture sophisticated mechanical, electronic and engineered materials components for our nation’s defense systems. Our goal is to seek innovative solutions that surpass our customer’s expectations. All positions in FM&T; require U.S. citizenship and ability to obtain and maintain a government security clearance. Honeywell FM&T; is on the leading edge of supplying engineering and manufacturing expertise for our nation’s defense and national security. This position requires performing project management and engineering functions on assigned projects or sub-projects by applying standard mathematical, physical science, and/or mechanical engineering technologies.


This engineering opportunity will fulfill a technical role in the Purchased Product Engineering business within our Electrical Products organization. Engineers in this organization provide engineering support of complex mechanical/electrical assemblies, specifically electrical connectors. This engineer will perform project management, vendor support, process development, part evaluations, and support quality control functions. While in this position, the engineer will have developmental opportunities for increasing roles of project responsibilities and management. Mentor opportunities for professional growth will be provided.

education level/skills required / respon: Department of Energy, National Nuclear Security Administration facility managed and operated by Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T)....
job summary:
The National Security Campus is a U. S. Department of Energy, National Nuclear Security Administration facility managed and operated by Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T;). Our primary business is to manufacture sophisticated mechanical, electronic and engineered-material components for our nation's defense system. Our goal is to seek innovative solutions that surpass our customers' expectations. To accomplish this, we research, develop and deploy some of the most advanced design and manufacturing technologies in use in the United States today. All positions at FM&T; require U.S. citizenship and ability to obtain and maintain a government security clearance.

This position will provide support to engineers, performing administrative tasks some of which are technical in nature such as coordinating and managing project data, assisting engineering project leads, coordinating and managing departmental performance metrics, and maintaining schedules. This position may also provide assistance in development of routings and work instructions, processing shop floor paperwork, managing Bills of Materials, supporting and executing procurements, tracking key performance data and coordinating other related administrative and technical-operations activities.

Summary of Duties:
Collect and analyze project execution data for manager and project leads.

Schedule, track, monitor, and report status of assemblies for development projects.

Assist project managers in cost management, generation of cost estimates, risk assessments, and tracking against cost and schedule requirements.

Adjust and monitor project forecasts for project leads.

Maintain and generate project files in the format and manner as required, including project tracking forms and appropriate graphical charts.

Generate and maintain project plans and assist in monitoring baseline changes.

Help maintain and assess quality documents and metrics.

Create or draft routings for development programs. Review routings with customers and technical experts. Perform updates and/or maintenance to factory routings and instructions as needed.

Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to work instructions, and seek ways to simplify them for efficient, yet accurate execution.

Process development tool orders and order development material, and follow up on the procurement process and schedules.

Perform capital equipment inventory and needs assessment.

Maintain custody of tools to be used for creating or viewing factory instruction and factory instruction-related aids, such as digital and video cameras.

Assist engineers with other work as required.

Must conduct activities in a safe and healthy manner and works in accordance with established ES&H; requirements to ensure the protection of associates, the public, and the environment.

Must take actions necessary to stop work when an unsafe condition or action is identified. Every associate has the right and responsibility to stop work when unsafe conditions or actions are identified.

Qualifications

You Must Have:
US Citizenship required (to obtain and maintain security clearance)

Associate's degree or technical/trade school completion or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Two (2) or more years' experience related to administrative/technical support.

Two (2)or more years' demonstrated proficiency with MS Office Suite desktop applications, such as MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, MS Project.

Note: Candidates with greater experience may apply and may be considered for higher level engineering support specialist classification (II; Senior) commensurate with candidate credentials and as warranted by the scope of work and current business requirements.

We Value:
Bachelor's degree in a technical or business field preferred.

Three (3) or more years’ experience working in an engineering or manufacturing environment in a similar role preferred.

Five (5) or more years’ experience related to administrative/technical support such as configuration management, financial reporting, product testing procedures & data entry preferred.

Experience in engineering-related administrative activities such as configuration management, financial reporting, product testing procedures & data entry preferred.

Ability to plan and organize, demonstrate excellent time management and support several projects at once.

Experience with Earned Value Management metrics and tools.

Experience with Primavera P6 Program Management Software.

Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), Integrated Financial Management System (IFMS)

Three or more years experience in a similar position working in an engineering/manufacturing environment.

Experience interpreting technical drawings and documents.

Effective verbal, written and presentation skills.

Familiarity with six sigma tools and processes.

education level/skills required / respon: Engineering, or Science. Department of Energy (DOE), National Nuclear Security. Kansas City, MO....
job summary:
Location:
Kansas City, MO

At Honeywell, our people are driven
by a desire to contribute, be challenged and grow. Our people make Honeywell a
special company and are a key competitive advantage. Honeywell is a Fortune 100
company that invents and manufactures technologies to address some of the
world’s toughest challenges linked to global macrotrends such as energy
efficiency, clean energy generation, safety and security, globalization and
customer productivity. With approximately 132,000 employees worldwide,
including more than 22,000 engineers and scientists, we have an unrelenting
focus on performance, quality, delivery, value and technology in everything we
make and do.

The Kansas City National Security
Campus (KC NSC) is a U.S. Department of Energy (DOE), National Nuclear Security
Administration (NNSA) facility managed and operated by Honeywell Federal
Manufacturing & Technology (FM&T;).
Our primary business is to manufacture sophisticated mechanical,
electronic, and engineered material components for our nation’s defense system.
Leveraging this work, the KC NSC also provides critical technical and
intelligence analysis supporting efforts to counter the proliferation of
weapons of mass destruction (WMD).

Duties and responsibilities include

a set of the following:

Provide expert technical analysis

on commodities useful in the production, operation, and development of WMD
delivery systems.


Direct and conduct customer

driven research and analysis using intelligence community software and
standards. Produce and review analytical
assessments and briefings, attend meetings, lead interactions with customers,
provide intelligence information report evaluations, set goals and maintain
expertise over a given technical subject matter.


Work to assess developments in

the current state-of-the-art in the field delivery systems and assist in
determining the impacts of these developments on multilateral efforts to
control the proliferation of these systems.


Serve as an expert and trainer

for capacity building activities in strategic trade controls domestically and
abroad. Serve as a trainer in the areas
of WMD delivery systems, strategic trade risk management, and catch-all
controls.


Work collaboratively with program

staff from across the DOE complex and the USG to develop capacity building
training curriculum in the areas of delivery systems, risk assessment,
catch-all controls, and multilateral export control regimes.


May be assigned lead

responsibilities including leadership of capacity building efforts in specific
countries/regions on behalf of the sponsor or analyses with a technical and
nonproliferation policy intersection.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:

US citizenship in order to obtain

US Dept of Energy "Q" level security clearance


Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics,

Engineering, or Science.


Minimum 15 years of experience in

military application of delivery systems and the USG nonproliferation missions.

Additional Qualifications:

Knowledge of and experience

working with the US Intelligence Community and providing or using
intelligence-based assessments.


Excellent organizational skills
Excellent verbal and written

communications skills.


Demonstrated customer service

actions, tact, and diplomacy.


Advanced degree (MS, PhD) in a

related technical field


Experience working with the US

Intelligence Community and the USG interagency on
nonproliferation/counterproliferation issues.


Experience working with the US

Departments of State, Defense, Energy, and Commerce on nonproliferation policy
matters.


Experience engaging with foreign

governments in bilateral and multilateral exchanges and the working level and
higher.


Advanced knowledge of US and

international export controls, sanctions (US, EU, UN), control regimes (Nuclear
Suppliers Group, Missile Technology Control Regime, or Australia Group),
catch-all controls, and international strategic trade mechanism (e.g. UN
Security Council Resolutions).

job summary:
Description

Join a team whose primary business is to manufacture material components for our nation’s defense system.

In Kansas City, Honeywell’s Federal Manufacturing & Technologies primary business is to manufacture sophisticated mechanical, electronic, and engineered material components for our nation’s defense system. Our goal is to seek innovative solutions that surpass our customers’ expectations. To accomplish this, we research, develop, and deploy some of the most advanced design and manufacturing technologies in use in the United States today.

The Staff Engineer will be responsible for leading the technology area for additive manufacturing (AM) and machining to support Special Applications Machining (SAM), Gas Transfer Systems (GTS) and the Rubber and Plastics technology areas. Specific responsibilities for the position will include: nurturing the successful development and application of complex additive manufacturing and the integrated supporting processes; developing and maintaining strong partnerships with the Design Agency (DA), National Security Enterprise (NSE) and National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA) through working groups, technology forums and Centers of Excellence, acting as a strong gatekeeper and project leader in the area of additive manufacturing to support the strategic advancement of manufacturing readiness levels for future programs; develop a high functioning team of technical staff in the development and integration of additive manufacturing and additive manufacturing supporting technologies and represent Kansas City National Security Campus (KCNSC) capabilities and technology maturation efforts in an exemplary manner to internal, DA, NSE and NNSA stakeholders.

Leads strategic technology maturation in additive manufacturing and supporting processes for SAM, GTS and Rubber and Plastics and facilitates technology development, manufacturing improvements and resource sharing

Advances the AM strategic direction and vision for FM&T; in collaboration with vendors, NSE, DA and NNSA stakeholders

Champions initiatives to resolve critical processes and technological related issues in the AM and supporting process areas – including PDRD initiatives for AM and supporting machining and finishing processes

Represents FM&T; in AM, machining and metal finishing processes at NSE technology initiatives and development groups and communicates with all levels of management, staff design partners and customers

Works to mitigate risks associated with AM and supporting technologies

Cultivates the career development of engineering staff in the area of AM including mentoring, coaching and training; encourages and leads teamwork to achieve customer expectations for AM and supporting technologies

Conducts activities in a safe and healthy manner for the manufacturing organization and the environment and takes actions necessary to stop work when an unsafe condition is identified.

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer
Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status. Qualifications

You must have :
US citizenship in order to obtain and maintain US Dept of Energy "Q" level security clearance.
Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent technical discipline from an accredited engineering program.
Ten (10) years of engineering experience in project leadership and engineering activities, including the application of advanced engineering principles and technology related to highly complex engineering technology development efforts.
Three (3) years of experience as a recognized technical expert with significant insight in developing advanced technologies for additive manufacturing.

We value :
Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering from an accredited engineering program.
Experience with NSE in project management, design, product, materials analysis, or process engineering.
Commitment to Six Sigma methodologies, quality, HS&E; and Honeywell Core values.
Ability to positively influence others and create a passion for excellence.
Follow through with commitments to ensure high customer service performance.
Leadership skills, confidence, accountability, and change management experience.
Experience with resource management.
Ability to make difficult and/or unpopular decisions.
Effective interpersonal skills including the ability to communicate orally and in writing.
An optimistic attitude and ability to listen and adjust as necessary.
Demonstrated business acumen being politically astute as well as assertive when required.
Willingness to relocate in order to apply expertise/skillset at acquired sites or residency preferred.

job summary:
The National Security Campus (NSC) is a U.S. Department of Energy (DOE), National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA) facility managed and operated by Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technology (FM&T;). Our primary business is to manufacture sophisticated mechanical, electronic, and engineered material components for our nation’s defense system. Our goal is to seek innovative solutions that surpass our customers’ expectations. To accomplish this, we research, develop, and deploy some of the most advanced design and manufacturing technologies in use in the United States today.

This Electrical Engineer position will fulfill a technical role in the Telemetry Engineering organization. Engineers in this organization provide engineering support of highly technical and advanced manufacturing processes typically requiring specialized qualifications, knowledge, and/or skill. This engineer will perform project management, as well as development, evaluation, production, and quality control functions on complex engineering projects and electrical assembly devices. This Engineering position will exercise considerable latitude in determining technical objectives of assignments.

Summary of Duties:
Participates in establishing operating procedures on new products and components.

Assists in the development of test procedures and performance of routine to moderately complex engineering evaluation tests, product and process capability studies, quality audits, product or project data reviews, and other engineering evaluation work.

Assists in project planning and management of projects.

Translates design agency concepts into production items by coordinating the activities of engineering, quality, manufacturing and related organizations.

Estimates set-up times, flow times, costs of production and acceptance equipment, and compiles cost estimates and delivery quotations, monitors performance and prepares reports, statistics and recommendations for management review.

Determines acceptability of processes and materials in conjunction with customer, design agency, quality and other affected organizations.

Troubleshoot development and production products and processes.

Assists in the preparation of product or project definitions, manufacturing drawings and specifications, and test equipment designs.

Interacts with design agencies and/or internal organizations to assist in resolving design, development, productions and acceptance issues.

Influences design agency for new designs, defines and recommends design changes, and test equipment, and orders tooling, gauging, and equipment necessary to assure product quality.

Plans and performs engineering testing and development programs and uses advanced statistical and scientific methods to address and resolve critical engineering and production problems to assure product manufacturability.

Ability to manage multiple assignments and responsibilities concurrently.

Provides technical assistance in appropriate assigned field.

Evaluates and makes recommendations regarding technological advances that improve productivity and quality, reduces flowtime and enhance operational surety.

May perform other duties as assigned.

Conducts activities in a safe and healthy manner and works in accordance with established HS&E; requirements to ensure the protection of employees, the public and the environment. Takes actions necessary to stop work when an unsafe condition or action is identified. Every employee has the right and responsibility to stop work when unsafe conditions or actions are identified.

Qualifications

You Must Have:
US citizenship in order to obtain and maintain US Dept of Energy “Q” level security clearance.

Bachelor of Science degree in Electrical Engineering from an ABET accredited Engineering program.

Two (2) or more years of applied engineering experience in a manufacturing or technical environment.

Note: Candidates with more experience may apply and may be considered for higher level engineering positions (Engineer III; Engineer Senior) commensurate with candidate credentials and as warranted by the scope of work and current business requirements.

We Value:
Existing DOE Q clearance.

MS in Electrical Engineering from ABET accredited institution preferred.

Effective verbal and written communication and presentation skills.

Interest in applied engineering career in a technology or manufacturing business.

Ability to plan and organize, demonstrate excellent time management and support several projects at once.

Ability to work under minimal supervision, with latitude for independent action and decision making.

Broad knowledge of manufacturing or quality processes and techniques.

Two (2) or more years of experience in engineering products or processes or comparable related technical activities.

Preview relevant internship experience or equivalent preferred.

Ability to interface effectively with internal and external organizations.

job summary:
Responsible for creating and winning sales opportunities for their products/solutions/services. This

role is the clinical/technical and sales expert for his/her assigned products, solutions/services, and

is expected to be able to differentiate GE’s offerings; convey compelling value proposition; lead

the opportunity; qualify customer needs; develop and present solutions proposals and quotations;

and respond to customers’ clinical/technical/process questions in order to close sales.


Essential Responsibilities

Financial Performance

1. Is accountable to achieve Product/Solutions/Service orders and sales OP target for assigned

accounts and or territory

2. Provide input to deal pricing strategy and ensure pricing compliance for segment opportunities

3. Forecast orders and sales within the applicable sales funnel tools and reports for their

products/solutions/services in their assigned territory/accounts

Territory & Account Management

1. Create business plans for territory/assigned accounts including, but not limited to opportunity

development, competitive strategies and targets

2. Build strong business relationships and formulate account strategies and plans to continuously

strengthen relationships within the assigned accounts/ territory. Identify & respond to key account

technical and departmental decision makers’ needs and maintain customer contact records in the

relevant CRM tools

3. Continuously develop and improve a network of key opinion leaders within the assigned territory

4. Track and communicate market trends to/from the field including competitor data, and develop

and lead effective counter-strategies

Product & Market Expertise

1. Maintain up to date detailed knowledge of their product / services. Be able to present and

discuss the technology and clinical benefits in terms which are relevant to customers

2. Maintain up to date market and competitor knowledge related to their product/solutions/services

3. Continuously update their understanding the customers changing clinical and/or operational

issues and challenges

4. Create viable product configurations which meet customer needs effectively, while achieving

optimum margin for GE

5. Differentiate assigned product offering during the various stages of the sales process,

effectively using GE resources and approved product marketing and product promotion material to

actively support the customer through their decision making process towards a successful

outcome for GE

6. Represent the company at relevant medical conferences and technical exhibitions to promote

product/solution and company

Opportunity management

1. Identify and create new opportunities and work with sales leaders and account teams (where

applicable) to continuously increase prospect funnel

2. Drive tender/bid process including the needs qualification, vendor selection, quotation and

closure of their product/solution/service opportunities to meet orders, sales and margin targets as

well as to maximize customer satisfaction assigned territory

3. Create and maintain opportunities in the applicable sales funnel tool and/or CRM tools

4. Ownership of order and configuration quality at the point of entry to ensure accuracy,

configuration integrity and that all requirements are tied to documented customer inputs

5. Estimate date of delivery to customer based on knowledge of the company's production and

delivery schedules ensuring fulfillment of the order is according to customer expectations and

enhances customer satisfaction

6. One GEHC teamwork

7. Contribute to account plans where applicable at accounts covered by account

managers/executives

8. Continuously educate and coach account team members on their product/service/solution

strategy and offerings

9. Collaborate with and leverage subject matter experts and other resources within GEHC

channels to build relationships and secure business

10. Share and follow-up identified leads to other product lines within own accounts and or One

GEHC accounts

Compliance

1. Adhere to and uphold highest standards of compliance to relevant international and local

Regulatory and GE Healthcare Promotional Codes

2. Adhere to all applicable GE and GE Healthcare compliance policies, codes and training

requirements

3. Identify and report any quality or compliance concerns and take immediate corrective action as

required


Qualifications/Requirements
Qualifications


1. Bachelor’s Degree or minimum 5 years of selling experience in a medical, healthcare or

technical field( e.g. biomedical engineering, medical physics) or Life Sciences field

2. Previous experience in the Healthcare Industry

3. Ability to interface with both internal team members and external customers as part of solutions

based sales approach

4. Ability to energize, develop and build rapport at all levels within an organization

5. Strong capacity and drive to develop career

6. Excellent verbal and written communication skills in local language as well as good command of

English

7. Ability to synthesize complex issues and communicate in simple messages

8. Excellent organizational skills

9. Excellent negotiation & closing skills

10. Strong presentation skills

11. Able to travel

12. Valid motor vehicle license

Quality Specific Goals

1. Aware of and comply with the GEHC Quality Manual, Quality Management System, Quality

Management Policy, Quality Goals, and applicable laws and regulations as they apply to this job

type/position

2. Complete all planned Quality & Compliance training within the defined deadlines

3. Identify and report any quality or compliance concerns and take immediate corrective action as

required

4. Maintain knowledge of and understand all applicable Global Privacy and Anti-Competition

Policies and operate within them to ensure that no company policy or Local/ Int’l Law is broken.

5. Maintain knowledge of and understand all applicable Environmental Health Policies (including

but not limited to GE Healthcare EHS Policies, GE Healthcare Fleet Rules, etc.) and operate

within them to ensure that no company policy or local / Int’l Law is broken.

6. Drive continuous improvement on all related processes, work instructions, and procedures to

ensure ongoing standardization and simplification of the Quality Management System.


Additional Eligibility Qualifications

GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation and drug screen.


Desired Characteristics

1. Proven and progressive previous experience in sales/services/promotion to C-suite and

technical decision makers e.g. CEOs, Strategic Planning Directors, Facilities/Estates managers,

Biomedical Engineers, nursing staff, medical specialty staff (Anesthesiology, Radiology, Intensive

care, Nuclear Physicists etc.)

job summary:
As General Manager, you will be accountable for the overall business planning and strategy for Curtiss-Wright's QualTech NP Business Unit located in Cincinnati Ohio. This individual will be a strategic visionary with enhanced customer focus and leadership attributes to orchestrate the growth of the organization. Drive success with your committed team by providing the proper robust business processes, managerial tools, and financial controls to enable this business to profitably grow to more than $100 million within the next five years.


The GM will be accountable for obtaining the performance objectives of the company including revenue growth, profitability, cash generation, customer satisfaction, technology development, operational excellence, business development, strategic planning and talent development through his/her direct reports.


As QualTech NP's leader, you will be an integral member of the management team guiding strategy development and organization execution. He/she will report to the VP Operations of Curtiss-Wright Nuclear and will have the ability to be his backup for the succession plan. He/she will have full P&L; responsibility within this high-performance business unit.


Key Accountabilities

Have full management responsibility for all business operations (P&L; and program performance). Immediate task will be to assume control of the business; familiarize him/herself with the company, its activities, customers, current strategy, plans and policies
Review current value proposition, strategies, and operating plans and agree on the immediate and longer-term courses of action to be pursued. Take the lead in developing strategies to produce growth
Ensure tight control is maintained over business performance and that operating management responds quickly and effectively to any problems or adverse trends
Take a lead role in identifying and developing new business opportunities and core areas for growth, to include global sales and manufacturing capability development
Be responsible for supporting R&D; and proposal development. Provide a central corporate focus for product development including concept definition, product and technology road maps, long range planning (staff and technology needs), and sustaining engineering
Have accountability for establishing and meeting commitments for on-time, on-budget product line delivery for new & existing products, including quality and documentation
Provide input to process improvement initiatives - leads and participates in corrective action teams
Proactively resolve technical, people, and production issues to ensure success of the team and consistent production of products
Ensure product branding strategies are developed and implemented to ensure sales tools and promotional material is available for product launch
Develop and maintain relationships with customers, outside agencies, third party providers, etc.
Ensure compliance with company standards for revenues, efficiencies, cost control, waste reduction, quality, safety, and complete on-time delivery
Provide leadership across the organization for problem resolution to facilitate faster improvements and improved working relationships
Manage compliance with local and national regulatory bodies
Develop the talent in the organization that includes a strong succession plan
Your Expertise

Proven success at leveraging market knowledge and business development contacts to identify and expand new customer opportunities and maintain strong customer relationships
Track record of producing results, meeting financial targets, and leading product development
Entrepreneurial and innovative spirit and sense of urgency
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and the ability to build and develop effective working relationships
Strong collaboration and partnership skills with experience with groups with the ability to listen, solve complex problems, and deal with ambiguity
Able to articulate a vision
Solid listening skills and learning agility
Complete buy-in and commitment to the company's values, business strategy, and directions
Proven ability to develop and implement new strategies in a competitive business environment and a track record in successfully managing a business through change
Prudent risk taker
Accepts accountability for the need to consistently achieve targeted goals
Ability to develop talent -- both as individuals and teams. Strong coaching ability. Commitment to hiring and retaining the best and acting on marginal performance
A career demonstrating rapid progression and increased responsibility and acknowledged as a leader in best practice management
Ability to provide strong leadership to the management team and build confidence -- should be a clear, strategic thinker with a willingness to take a more hands-on, operational approach where appropriate
Energetic, open, and direct manner. Must have the stature and confidence to make difficult decisions
Education & Experience

A Bachelor's degree in Management or Engineering, MBA would be considered an asset
Minimum of 15 years of experience in the Power and/or Industrial market, with at least 5 years in an executive level position, Nuclear Power experience considered an asset
Proven track record of managing in a global sales, design and manufacturing organization
Successful track record of managing Profit & Loss is a definite asset

job summary:
This opportunity is with a leading provider of mission-critical solutions. This firm provides a complete lifecycle of solutions that are custom-fit to the requirements of their client's mission-critical facilities. They help improve the reliability of mission-critical facilities for many of the world's largest organizations.


Note: Only applicants who are authorized to work for any US Employer will be considered, no sponsorship.


Mission Critical Data Center Facility Technician - Cincinnati OH

NAVY NUCLEAR / NAVY NUKE / NAVY MECHANIC / NAVY ELECTRICIAN PREFERRED


We are looking for an EMN, MMN, or ETN to transition into a Data Center Facility Engineer / Technician to support a critical data center. The Critical Facility Technician will be responsible for monitoring compliance with contractual commitments, directing technical and administrative tasks related to the operation of the critical facility infrastructure and assuring compliance with company’s policies and procedures. The Data Center is a 24x7x365 a year operation.


Responsibilities
Troubleshoot and Run Diagnostics, Conduct Preventive Maintenance and Emergency Repairs on Critical Facilities Equipment within the Data Center as specified and on schedule.
Participates in the preparation of analyses and reports on the data center infrastructure, develops project plans and conducts briefings and presentations
Operate and perform both routine and emergency service on a variety of state of the art critical systems, including but not limited to; medium voltage switchgear, diesel generators, paralleling switchboards, UPS, PDU, mechanical heat rejection systems, computer room air handlers, fire detection/suppression and building monitoring systems.
Ensures that operational, maintenance and emergency methods of procedure (MOP’s and SOP’s) are developed and strictly adhered to.
Review schematics and one line diagrams in the event of servicing equipment within the facility
Assist with CMMS database management.

Requirements
2-6 years + of relevant data center / critical facility / Navy Nuclear experience (experience with critical power, electrical and mechanical equipment including generators, critical and essential PDU’s, UPS, switchgear, chillers, Air handling units, computer grade cooling systems, DC Power Systems, and building monitoring/control systems)
Type of Navy Experience - Navy Nuke Trained / Naval Nuclear Training
EMN - Electricians Mate (Nuclear Trained)
ETN - Electrical Technician (Nuclear Trained)
MMN - Machinist Mate (Nuclear Trained)
Nuclear-trained MMs, EMs and ETs perform duties in nuclear propulsion plants operating reactor control, propulsion and power generation systems. The NF provides opportunities to work closely with specialists in the nuclear, technology, and engineering fields; reactor operator of a naval nuclear propulsion plant. The Navy is the leader in the development and safe operation of nuclear power plants and provides the most comprehensive technical education available in the Nuclear Field. This experience is uniquely transferable and can applied to data center facility operation positions that equates to high salaries as well as leadership roles within the critical facilities market.
New and exciting career opportunities await the select group of people who possess nuclear knowledge and know-how, gained through Navy training.
Critical Facility Power & Critical Facility Cooling Experience.
Data Center Operations Experience a plus
Must have the technical knowledge and practical experience of operating, troubleshooting and maintenance of Mission Critical Mechanical and/or Electrical Support Systems.

Submittal Instructions:

Please send resumes to resume@pkaza.com ( resume at pkaza dot com ) with 8453093 in the subject. After applying, if you have further questions, you may call 973-895-5200 and ask for Iggy. You can also submit via our career portal and take a look at other Critical Facility openings we are working on at, http://jobs.pkaza.com


If you are in Data Center Facilities but this opportunity is not what you are looking for let’s still talk. New openings are coming in weekly and others we are not allowed to post. We also not only keep leads confidential but pay for referrals as well.


Company offers competitive salaries and benefits package including medical insurance, a 401(k) plan.
